job_title: Package Handler in Mills River, NC
pros: My ideas are different than most...I didn’t mind the cold or heat. I didn’t mind the hours, the rest of my day was clear. The pay rate was good.
cons: I didn’t mind working with no heat or AC...dress accordingly. Having to be there at 3-4 a.m . The majority of the other employees are grumpy and rude. Management was hard to find. If you did something wrong, mgmt did t say anything, the drivers would. If you do something right or are proactive to a situation, don’t look for mgmt, ask your drivers. If you have to take a couple days off because you’re sick, etc...I guess they think that’ll be your in for quitting,,,they don’t care

review_title: It was Okay for what it was
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Keasbey, NJ
pros:
I was there for about 5 months (I had to leave due to a car accident) and Honestly, I was always on the slower end when it came to unloading trucks. And while they would stress the importance of keeping up your output, I was never given the impression that my job was in jeopardy.

Shifts are in 4 hour stints, making it a good part time gig. 

You'll lose weight.
cons:
During the hiring process, They stress how you need to handle all packages with care, but it felt like the managers would stress you to keep their numbers up rather than focus on proper management.

They expected you to have consistent output regardless of the type of truck you were in. So if you have a truck full of 100lb boxes, they'll grill you for being slow.

You'll lose weight.

review_title: Looking For A Sales Career~Do Not Work Here
job_title: Field Account Executive in Tampa, FL
pros:
Unfortunately, FedEx has changed a great deal over the course of the last several years. Unfortunately, the cons outweigh the pros.  If you are thinking that it is a blessing to have a job in this tight economy maybe you will look at the pros.  A sales career is not an ideal position for any college graduate looking to advance with this corporation. Let's look at the pros of a sales career at FedEx.

1) Flexiability - but this is true of sales professions at many corporations across America.

2) Stability- If you work for FedEx in a sales role (like UPS), it is highly unlikely that you will be laid-off.  Sales people are revenue driving force in the organization. FedEx and UPS (I have worked for both) recognize this; therefore, it is unlikely you will lose your job due to the economy.

3) Overall, FedEx has a good insurance package. The dental is not competitive. You can purchase a better dental insurance package from an outside company that offers a better plan and the same cost or a little less.

4) FedEx is one of the few companies offers their employees a pension. The organization is reinstating the 401K match. It was suspended during the recession.

5) FedEx does not like to lay-off employees. Unfortunately, the economy has caused some lay-offs. However, FedEx does so when the organization has no other option.  Compared to many companies, layoffs have been very low during the recession.  In this respect, FedEx does care about their employees.
cons:
Working as a field Account Executive at FedEx is a low-paying thank less job.   The salary would be fair if you were working a 40-45 hour a week job.  If you are going to be an effective sales person by hitting your numbers and closing new business, you will work long hours.  This might not be a problem if you are compensated for your efforts. 

Also, the job does not really require that an individual work as long if management allowed their employees to manage their time effectively to get the tasks completed to get new packages “on the belt.”  There is a lot of administrative work. The FedEx internal systems are low and outdated. If the sales employees were hourly, I am certain that the organization would work on streamlining many of their internal processes to save their employees time and to make the job easier. 

FedEx does not believe that their sales people are intelligent individuals who can make business decisions.  This can be seen by how they manage their people.  Your focus is not just sales.  You are the customer service person for every account in your territory even for account that you do not receive commission for… FedEx has the practice of giving the Sales Executive cell phone to everyone… Any person who finds your card will be calling you.  It was ridiculous.  The list of problems with this position goes on and on. 

If you want to have a life outside of FedEx, do not apply here. If you want to spend time with your family, do not apply here. If you want to spend your evenings watching television while working on FedEx pricing contracts or responding to e-mails almost every night of the week, then this is the JOB for you. 

I do not mind hard work. I was an effective sales person… BUT PAY ME FOR MY EDUCATION, PROFESSIONALISM, TIME AND EFFORT! This is truly the JOB from HELL!  For those you read this post, I was not a poor performer. I always had good reviews and brought on large accounts.  I attempted to give this company my best during the time I was employed there and make the best of a BAD situation until a new door opened.  It is not worst it!  

In addition, to all of these problems, the promotion process is nearly impossible within sales department.  As an account executive, you can only be promoted to a sales executive (which is the same position with a new title). Your pay increases significantly, but the requirements change almost yearly and the company makes it almost impossible to get promoted. There are a very limited number of corporate and worldwide account manager positions. People who have those positions rarely resign or quit. When one becomes available everyone is trying… promotion regardless of work ethic is nearly impossible.  UPS promotes their people fairly; FedEx does not. I have worked for both… At UPS, I was respected and treated like the educated individual that I am. At FedEx, I was a robot without a brain.

job_title: Handler and Courier in Dallas, TX
pros: For part time employees you have hours that you are assigned and are not required to work more than those hours. This makes it easy to maintain a full time job elsewhere. There are also minimum pay guarantees that prevent them from working you too few.
cons: Lots of people there that should not be but it is difficult to fire people due to corporate red tape. It is also hard for management to give quality new employees much work causing many quality employees to leave. After an initial year or two opportunities open up, but that can be a long time.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Ciudad de Mexico
pros: the pay is good, and so is the  schedule's,they give you  45 minutes of lunch, and 5 days of week with weekends off they have  a tranquilization room where you can take a nap if needed, the installations are nice and very clean, they also have a cafeteria on site.
cons: Really bad Administration the managers dont even speak fluent english very difficult to communicate with managment, and supervisiors , no kind of aid or help when you need it, preferences are very obvious on behalf of supervisior's.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Olive Branch, MS
pros:
The pay is great for someone like a student or those still living with parents.
The management is decent enough to handle any issues you may encounter.
The work can and will make you physically and mentally stronger.
The benefits are much better than most part-time positions available.
cons:
The work is very intense and can be headache inducing.
The heat may deter you if you do not thrive in working in it.
It can feel like you might be working harder than most people who been there longer.
If you are a diligent worker the management will move you around very frequently which can become very exhausting and demanding.

review_title: Good Pay, Hard Work. If you can do the work it's not a bad place.
pros:
For the hours you work, you can make a fair amount of money.
Most Managers started as a package handlers themselves.
cons:
While there are clear goals that you know you have to make, it's focused on almost entirely as a way of rating work. There are general barriers such as the flow of work that isn't taken into account.

The company prides itself on safety, but one of the reasons that safety ends up being overlooked from the package handler to the manager, is that it can get in the way of reaching the numbers expected of them.

pros: Company pays okay good benefits and people mostly.
cons: The companies is not what it once was. It is no longer about people like they claim. Profit is now king. Watch out for those hungry for advancement. They are the quickest to throw people under the bus. Watch what you say and get ready for a ride on the PC train. They are more worried about getting sued than keeping quality people

pros: Great co-workers,Great customers!! Great work Atmosphere
cons: Employed just 8 months- My Managers give  me Olcc as a train tool, I was never explained certain scenerios using the time clock. Example, power pad locks, I punch out,  no time card prints, so I grab a different power pad, to key my time, I get Olcc, then my maanger  explains what and how I need to perform when this electronic error happens....

pros: A company you can be proud of, gives superior service to customers, opportunities to grow a career and gain experience in variety and cutting edge tecnnology.  I was able to work part time at FedEx while in college, made a very good wage and received health care!  Other perks for working at FedEx allowed me to travel extensively on very little cost, all over the US, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, and Hawaii.
cons: Very fast pace, always changing, very high expectations... to some, these are very much down sides.  For me, I thrive on these attributes!!!  With every company this size, you will end up running into some knuckle heads, but just keep on doing your best!

review_title: If you are ambitious or career oriented person stay away !!
pros: You are employed and are paid decently. People around are friendly. Work is easy and relaxed. Lot's of time  for doing your personal work
cons: Work is mundane and uninspiring. You'll need to learn the systems which are pretty old, dated and don't interact well with each other. As a fresh graduate and strictly from a learning and development perspective, this is one of the worst jobs you could have.  Your learning is limited to making systems talk to each other.  There is hardly any strategic or analytical work going around.  Most of the people have given up learning or adopting changes and counting want to retire for the retirement package.  If you are seeking challenging quality work or seeking to develop your career, as mentioned by other reviewers STAY AWAY from this place.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Boston, MA
pros:
They say we will never be laid off, so job security is good.  But they are also not hiring so...
Good benefits and they do seem to honestly care about you and how you feel and work.
Very good people too work with both in the lower levels and in Management.
cons: Rather tedious work, very little variation.  Also at time feeling of not really being able to help the customers as much as you would like. Which can make the job very stressful at times.  You know you will be taking the same kind of calls 8hrs a day 5days a week with very little variety or change in routine.

pros: Excellent promotion opportunities.  FedEx definately promotes from within.  They attempt to make work life balance a non issue in their culture.  The salary range at FedEx is very broad and movement within the ranges is easily accomplished.  You are rewarded for doing a good job in most areas of the company.  The benefits of this company are great.  The comprehensive medical and dental insurance are some of the best I have had in my career.  There are many, many discounts and fun things to do at the company...discounted shipping is a bonus.  The 401(k) is good and there is still a pension, so retirement savings are above average.
cons: There is a lot of work and sometimes it requires a lot of hours to accomplish that work.

review_title: FedEx is not a people Company
pros: The benefit package is very good.
cons: This Company is run by robots, managers work is primarily to cover Fed EX liability right or wrong. Any and all mistakes, injury,accidents, customer complaint is dumped in subordinates laps. A lot of favoritism given to minorities. Pay for the work performed ( courier) is sub standard and pay raises move at a snails pace.Safety in the work place is said to be paramount however you are expected to work at break neck speeds in order to save every minute of time on the clock and service needs. constantly understaffed.

review_title: The FedEx Family is hard to beat!
job_title: Senior Business Applications Analyst in Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
This is a great company with terrific benefits, great team members and a decent atmosphere. Volunteerism is highly encouraged.

Top management communicates very well to all of the employees on a regular basis.

Modernization is top priority and cutting edge technology is being implemented in many areas.

Lots of growth and acquisitions on a global scale.
cons:
This company does not provide  a very well defined career path and promotions seem to take forever in current positions.

Vacation for seasoned professionals begins with the standard two weeks and management needs to address this issue in order to to bring on seasoned professionals.

pros: Some of the benefits are pretty good. Our location's team members are also very dedicated. I enjoy working with them a lot. My management team is average.
cons: Work-life balance is definitely the biggest con. Not many initiatives have been taken to better balance the two. I'd like to see more attention paid to ensuring workers have the time they need to balance their personal lives. The job is important but there still needs to be better work life balance provided. For that reason, I think I should be able to leave only a half star in the work-blance rating category

pros:
Early adopter of technology
Low number of layoffs
Senior management is very competent
Very skilled employees
The most diverse company I have ever heard about
Very low turnover
cons:
The salaries are not the highest in the industry
The benefits are not great and are getting worse
Be prepared to only have two weeks of vacation for your first 5 years at FedEx
When something bad happens, assigning blame is more important than resolving the issue and moving on

review_title: Good place to work overall, but there are definite downsides.
pros: Good benefits package.  New employees start with two weeks paid vacation.  The medical insurance package is fairly good too.  I've heard that the annual bonus program is better than average, but I have yet to see that due to a downturn in business.  The annual raise is 2-4%.  I enjoy my coworkers as well.
cons: New hire training was non existent.  I spend more time dealing with the "system" than I do writing code.  We have tons and tons of paperwork to complete.  The system is very rigid at FedEx.  Recently we were told that we needed to work at least 45 hours per week.

review_title: Receive full benefits and a guaranteed minimum paycheck while still being a part time worker.
pros: After 3 months probationary period you receive full benefits even when one is just a part time worker. As long as you work your normal work week you will be paid your guaranteed minimum even if you work less than that (if you work over your minimum you get paid that amount). Good opportunities to move up through the company. Get discounts with a wide variety of companies that are somehow associated with the company.
cons: Depending on your job it does not require much thinking. While job openings are available at times it can be hard to advance up in the company especially if you are trying to remain in one area.

review_title: Good, but not exactly what I expected
job_title: Senior Programmer Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Very committed employees; many of the people I work with have been with FedEx for decades. For me, it has been a great opportunity for building experience and exposure to new technologies. Fairly flexible hours where I can take off for parts of the day if needed for various needs (dr. appointment, family activity,...).
cons: The work/life balance can be focused more on work and less life. The culture of the company, or at least the area I work in, is to put as many hours in a week towards work as possible and maintaining a life outside of work is not encouraged at all.

review_title: Stay away from the Express Division
pros: Easy job, they don't ask much from you in Express and Services divisions. Ground is very demanding
cons: In Express, there is no incentive to perform well. The company wants to shrink to keep costs down- to a point where service levels are at all time lows. There is no room for advancement as well as no job security in Express. Services is a great place for staff and Ground is where you want to be for advancement and reward.

pros:
Remote
2weeks vacation 
Pension
401k
Personal,sick and flh
cons: Taking sick time affects your performance review. They allow you to do shift bids but you'll never get the shift you want because everything goes by seniority. Can't take pto during Christmas holidays. No flexible hours. If you are hired on a certain shift, thats really it for a few years until they start taking of 15-30 mins at a time. Pay is low. No room for advancement, even though I was told differently during my interview process. You have ppl working for 10+ years just stuck in the same position.  Unless you relocate to Memphis. Managers also do not work with you to get you to the next level.

review_title: I still have Purple Blood after 25 years.
pros: FEDEX is very diverse.  We have a very flexible work schedule.  When disaster strikes, FEDEX is there to help it's employees no matter where or what.  FEDEX supports a lot of charities.  Our CEO is probably one of the most creative and prolific leaders I've ever seen.  His thinking is so advanced and 'into the future' that I am proud to work for his company.
cons: Not enough room for growth in my field.  Not enough recognition for the job we are doing.  I'll see in this survey if we're getting enough pay for the work we do.

review_title: Overall very good experience. The company is well-run and responsive to employee needs.
pros: The benefits and worklife balance are excellent at FedEx. Without question this is the best place I've worked as far as that goes. The ability to move around in the company and grow is also quite good. I've now had three careers at FedEx and they have generously paid for my education while preparing for the latest. Their policy of promoting from within means that a lot of people I know have had opportunities to grow in ways they could not imagine.
cons: Innovation takes time. Paperwork and procedures are somewhat complex and getting moreso all the time. This may be occurring at other firms as well, but it seems especially difficult here.

review_title: I have found my experience to be professionally fulfilling.
pros: FedEx provides professional staff and management with a fast paced and challenging environment that keeps you engaged and constantly learning.  Great benefits, competitive compensation and great people to work with.
cons: Memphis is not among my favorite cities, and if you want to advance up the ranks in FedEx you need to do a hitch at WHQ.  There are plenty of nice suburbs, but with a young family there are numerous other cities in which I'd prefer to call home.

pros: Great healthcare coverage, benefits, bonus opportunities, career growth, and profit sharing.You are not allowed to work more than 40 hrs a week so the work/life balance is great. Only down side is sometimes not having enough time for all the work you want to do in a week.
cons: Time commitment of 18 months before you are able to be promoted to any position in the company. Lack of opportunities cross-opcos. Too many administrative things to complete that are not in our job description. We do way too many things that customer service should be doing instead of focusing on selling.

review_title: Senior Express Clearance Operations Import Coordinator
pros:
Pretty much impossible to get fired unless you are late or call in often. 
Above average paid time off.
cons:
No room for advancement and if there is the work load is not worth advancing. 
No rewards for employees, everyone feels undervalued and over worked. They do not care about quality- only quantity- which is why Customs is constantly threatening to return to paper submission for FDA shipments and a lot of extra paperwork is now needed for USGR. In fact if Customs looked into shipments more they would see that customers are constantly providing tariffs with lower duty to save money. Accuracy is not a factor at all here. 
In 3 years I've gotten a total of 16 cents in raises- that's $332.80 more than what I was hired at- after 3 years of above average work. There is no motivation to be an exceptional employee.
Most managers are lazy or mean and deserve to be fired. 
Health insurance is terrible.

pros: Well structured corporation throughout the world with a great people philosophy. With the right management, this is a great company to work for.
cons:
Those same great people philosophy's are not always adhered to in the UK by sale management. 
There culture that a sales professionals performance can be directly affected by sales management failures does not exist. Performance improvement plans (PIP) is the first stage of a rocky road for a sales professional in the UK and it is not often used in the way it was intended which is as a support mechanism.

job_title: Fed Ex Ground Package Handler in London, England
pros:
It gets you in shape,  in less than 6 months you will lose a great deal of weight if you put enough effort into it.     

pay is higher than most companies offer

They value your safety to the up most extreme

If you are part-time then you may request to work an extra shift to earn more money
cons:
Physically tolling

If you live on your cell-phone,   expect to leave it in your car for your shift,  NO recording devices allowed ( as per notifications on the security check-in station ) ,   so if you need to keep in touch with the outside world,  you'll have to ask management for permission to dial out ( work/life balance a 2 star rating )

job_title: Sales Account Manager in Lewisberry, PA
pros: The biggest benefit to this job is it's flexibility.  A good place for a person just starting in sales out of college.
cons: If you are a professional sales person, you will find the money will never be here; no matter what big accounts you bring in. The commission off the margin made is based off what the operations team can cover the loads at. Not a lot of opportunity for growth; only the chosen few seem to get it, no matter how well or hard you work.

pros:
Very good job security; it's nearly impossible to get fired due to poor performance.
Excellent place for out-of-college students to learn and practice a skill.
cons:
FedEx doesn't practice CI/CD at a production-level.  They are too scared of disrupting the business and as a result have too much red tape involved in pushing code to a production environment.  They want their employees to move quickly, but restrictions on getting your code to production makes this impossible.  You'd be lucky to have a deployment every 2 weeks.
Average programmer is decent, the better employees tend to leave.
2 weeks vacation for Services employees.
Management gives praise, never a raise.

pros: Solid company with a superior product portfolio.  Great reputation in the industry with a forward thinking philosophy.  The compensation structure is fair and the benefits are very good.  Promotions are base on performance of course - the upward mobility within the company is very good.  Ample opportunties throughout the US if you are able to relocate within the Corporation.  Working for a company that has a brand recognition like FedEx helps as well.
cons: Office politics - although probably not unusual in any Fortune 100 company.  Overall, I've had a great experience working for the company and they have been fair with me in just about every aspect.

review_title: Think there is anything better out there...think again!!!
pros: Large company with limitless opportunities.  They treat their employees fairly.  Although they are not unionized (thank goodness), employees have more protections than a company with unions.  This company is one of the most recognized in the world and the name recognition shows with the great service provided by wonderful employees.  I would (and have) recommended FedEx to friends and family.  Several friends have left government service to come to work for this great company.  I would not want to work for any other private company.  FedEx is a multi-billion dollar company that truly cares for its employees.  I feel as if I am part of a family.
cons: Private Company. No cost of living increases.

pros: All depends on the contractor you work for.   Mine was excellent.  Worked with me if time off was needed.  Paid vacation (contractor dependent).  Your customers are almost always happy to see you.  Good job for young, healthy individuals, not a career path.
cons:
No benefits outside of the contractor providing paid vacation. No health insurance, no 401(k), nothing .  The contractors cannot afford to provide these things and still make a profit.  Ever-changing expectations from corporate.  Work is rain or shine. 
 Hard work, physically demanding and eventually will break down your body.

review_title: Good Company to work for after years of work experience
pros:
-Good balance of work-life-balance
- Good health care benefits, especially for single people
- Leadership welcomes moving around in the company and taking other promotional opportunities
cons:
-No real on-boarding or training for newcomers - you learn as you go.
- Easy to get comfortable and become complacent 
- Relocation and  transitioning process

review_title: A great transitional/in between career in preparing for something better
pros: Generally independent work, driving a company delivery truck and meeting customers through out the day. There are clear standards and expectations of efficiency especially in the number of deliveries per hour, time between departing the warehouse and one's first delivery, etc.
cons: A new courier is limited to only part-time hours. It takes a few years, and only when senior couriers retire or move up, for full-time slots to become available. In addition, even with a part-time schedule, sometimes it is difficult to get a second occupation because the length of a work day depends on several factors: personal delivery times, when a shipment of packages from the airport arrives, logistical issues at HQ, etc.

pros: Great working enviornment, team atmosphere, ongoing training to help broaden knowledge of portfolio of services, flexible work schedule, great management, excellent benefits, definite career growth, work/life balance
cons: Promotion is achievable however you must be willing to relocate if you are wanting to fast track. This is not a salary position so they are very strict on working only 40hrs/week. I appreaciate the work life balance but sometimes wish I had more time in the day to get everything done.

review_title: Not paid enough for such an overwhelming amount of work
job_title: Fed Ex Ground Package Handler in Vernon, CA
pros: Mindless work; you don't really have to think much or deal with customers
cons: Packager handlers are rewarded for unsatisfactory work; weak links are expected to be subsidized by everyone else; some employees handle far far less volume than others (I average 700-900 packages per day, others handle 80-10); Managers worry too much about efficiency without knowing how much more difficult they make the job; instead of listening to employee concerns, manager rattle off platitudes about "positive attitudes", and "slow and steady wins the race", without actually having the experience of handling such back-breaking work; they say they hire and promote from within, yet as an employee, you are still required to go through bureaucratic online application process rather than being directly promoted; TERRIBLE electronic equipment; favoritism and inability to properly discipline employees; everyone speaking Spanish

review_title: Great company if you want a specific lifestyle
pros: Fast-paced without being aggressive, great managers, terrific benefits. If you can live a satisfying life without much income, or if you are a student, this is a great job. Low stress, and light physical activity all day.
cons: Low pay although it's compatible with the same position at other companies. You never know what vehicle you'll be driving or what route you'll be doing until you get there, which is a part of the troubleshooting the managers have to do to get packages to the customers.

review_title: Horrible sexist environment encouraged by misogynist management  - would give 0 if there was such option
pros: sadly I am unable to find any pros
cons:
Overworked and underpaid staff
Overworked contractors that are expected to do impossible with little resources
Sexist environment coming from the management

The list could go on and on, but please do NOT join Hornsey depot if you are a female or generally respect gender equality, are a parent or respect families, have any health conditions, are a carer, are not ready to do overtime on a daily basis and feel guilty if you refuse to stay longer one day,  or just generally are a  normal human being.

review_title: Horrible sexist environment encouraged by misogynist management  - would give 0 if there was such option
pros: sadly I am unable to find any pros
cons:
Overworked and underpaid staff
Overworked contractors that are expected to do impossible with little resources
Sexist environment coming from the management

The list could go on and on, but please do NOT join Hornsey depot if you are a female or generally respect gender equality, are a parent or respect families, have any health conditions, are a carer, are not ready to do overtime on a daily basis and feel guilty if you refuse to stay longer one day,  or just generally are a  normal human being.

pros: Aramark cake and retirement parties.
cons:
1.	Dark tension among key people
2.	Living PSP exist so that employees are nice to each other 
3.	HR interviews with a leader’s ability to run their business
4.	Culture of superficiality and weak leadership
5.	Employees lie to executives about business performance and executives are so inept they believe it.
6.	Business moves very slow 
7.	Employees take simple logic and make it complicated and obtuse 
8.	Jurassic in terms of tech and innovative thinking
9.	Culture of discriminating against outside talent including interns.
10.	Retaliation is rampage and people will try to impact your job if you don’t go along with the corruption
11.	Not a healthy place for diverse people – very oppressive
12.	Most confuse celebrities over heroes
13. Company is too fat and won't layoff because of morale.

review_title: FedEx - Time for some tough decisions.
pros: Good well run company normally with better opportunities for advancement.  The compensation and benefit plans are some of the best in corporate America and rival government aganices
cons: "management by consensus" philosophy inhibits the ability to make neccesary but tough decisions.  The company has grown so much and moves very slowly at time to get things done.  Opportunities for growth are very limited but we ARE in very tough economic times and I believe this will change in the future and I hope it does so before we lose too many good people.

review_title: Birds of the same feather flock together...
pros: Good benefits (especially tuition refund, full healthcare coverage, decent wage)
cons: You don't create a culture out of thin air, for a big part you hire it... Because FedEx doesn't fire people the good people eventually leave and the bad ones end up getting promoted. As a result middle management is often clueless, lazy, under-qualified, over-staffed and grossly overpaid. There are no career paths for young ambitious professionals because they are not allowed to progress (mostly out of fear). The focus is put on internal political games that further hurt the advancement of good people... HR is a hot mess. FedEx Express Europe can be a lot more efficient than it is today but again it is unclear if middle management would accept or applaud these advancements... mostly because they would make their own positions redundant if they would do so...

review_title: Senior ECO Coord. @ FedEx Trade Networks
pros: The benefits and vacation time are great. If you are favored by upper management it’s a decent job to have but the skewed office politics and “witch hunt” mentality that the site manager cultivates does not create many pro for most employees.
cons: There is no sense of community at this office. The site manager is sexist to put it simply and will absolutely pit her employees against one another. For some reason her management team seems unconcerned with dropping productivity at the this site and her ability to hire capable people and retain those people. This trend will continue until she is relieved from her position and a more forward thinking person is allowed to step up.

pros:
Good pay
Cafeteria
Benefits
Clear-cut directions
Opportunity for advancement
cons:
Physical work: good posture goes a long way and being healthy
Rude co-workers or management: people can go off sometimes and really start some drama
Time off: You get Monday off gauranteed, and then one more day that isn't Friday, Saturday or Sunday and people rarely get Tuesday off.  2 weeks vacation after a year. You only get a handfull of missed days allowed. 
Start time varies: When it's busy in the winter around the holidays, start times can be at 6:30 or earlier (I've had a 4:45am start time), and some days when it's slow it doesn't start until 10:45am and then gets out at 2:15 on slow days and 5:00pm or later on busy days.  Hours can lead to great paychecks, but slow periods can be slow.

review_title: FedEx-no longer a good company to work for.
pros: Benefits are fantastic.  That's it.
cons: Used to be a good company, then things changed, now the company no longer cares about its front line couriers in the least.  They want to squeeze blood from a stone and work couriers to death while showing favoritism to friends.  Management is an utterly useless group of fools, disorganized and incompetent.  Perhaps if the company would stop strong-arming anyone who utters the word "union" and let us organize, we would have SOME rights as employees, instead of being complete slaves to their foolish whims.

review_title: Great Company but Career Growth hard to come by
pros: Pension eligible after 3 years, 14 working days off, unlimited sick days, great "brand", free range on inet use at the office, nobody monitors you, like to do a lot of out of office events, get interline travel benefits, corporate perks, great discounts pretty much everywhere you can think of
cons: promotions are so hard to come by unless you are willing to relocate after working in inside sales for 18 months, working in inside sales for 18 months until you can look for field sales jobs sucks, and then its up to the manager to help you out which doesnt help out at all!!!

pros: Working at corporate HQ in Memphis was different than any other corporation I have ever worked.  No one worked >40 hours/week.   It was a very relaxed environment, come in between 7-9, take a long lunch if y ou please and leave between 4-6.  Very friendly place and co-workers.
cons:
Working at corporate HQ in Memphis was different than any other corporation I have ever worked.  
-Overstaffed, not enough to keep you busy.
-People stay in position for 20+ years because they are comfortable,  not because they excel at their job. 
-Managers promoted based on diversity, not necessarily merit.

pros:
The company does provide stable employment (they only lay off team members in extreme financial situations).
Benefits (while slowly being reduced due to health care costs) are competitive and better than normal.
Working atmousphere is fairly casual.
cons:
The process and bureaucracy is very overbearing, very similar to working for the government (old school style management)
All of the leadership and upper management is centered in Memphis.  You cannot expect to progress within the company without moving to Memphis.
The company has grown by acquiring other companies and has a challenge integrating those companies together (both systems and process).

pros:
Managers are nice, although not always the best at managing. They do listen to requests for change of position and time off. Each warehouse is different and your experience may be good or bad depending where you go.  For a college student, I am able to work at night and go to school during the day. Nice co workers.
Many opportunities for growth and raises.
cons:
This job alone is not enough to make bills; most people have 2 or 3 jobs. 
It is hard work but the pay is nice.
People quit often and you have to pick up the slack from the "newbies" all the time

review_title: Don't work for FedEx as a courier!
pros: Not having your boss around all day.  Checking out all the hot receptionists.  Working outside in the summer time.  Seeing all the women walking around all day downtown!
cons: Last few years treated the couriers like garbage, even though we are the face of company!  There was a lot of favoritism going on the past few years!  Can't advance through the company at all!  Ripped off with benefits.  Lost all bonuses but having to do more work then we did in the past!  Get no bonus for driving around in the snow, told to work faster but try to be safe!

pros: Great people and good benefits.  Depending on your location and job, the facilities can be very nice.  Management is very down to earth and everyone seems to look out for each other.  This is not a company where you work a ton of weekends or a ton of hours.  They strongly promote work-life balance.
cons: The average person lacks a lot of urgency and controls are extensive.  It would not be an ideal place for independent thinkers.  Promotions are sometimes only tied to amount of time you have worked with the company.  This can be somewhat of a disappointment for people looking to quickly advance.

review_title: Failed to deliver the Purple Promise
pros: Competitive pay for the industry.  Great product/service offerings backed by a well known and respected brand name.  FedEx hires top notch people and I made life-long friendships and connections with co-workers.
cons: FedEx has been off-track for a while and has turned away from the "People First" mentality that it still touts.  Age discrimination is alive and well!  It's hard to swallow that FedEx is in the midst of a  major downsizing e.g., sales office closures, the big BuyOut of 2013 and yet Fred Smith takes a record pay raise and bonus plan as a reward.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Orlando, FL
pros: Interline discounts haven't changed other than 6mos certification on dress code and conduct as a representative.
cons: Higher out of pocket health costs, retirement contribution match not what it used to be, takes longer to top out. New hires earn almost as much starting than 10 yr employees.

pros: Decent benefits, great work/life balance, good training opportunities. Good opportunities to change to another team depending on where you are located.
cons: They use outdated technology stacks, too many people have worked at FedEx for too long and resist change. Focus is on cutting costs and use offshoring as much as possible no matter what the impact is to the quality. Many in management think they are agile because they have daily standups. The development / deployment lifecycle is very long and the velocity is low and the defect rate is medium to high.

pros: The name and the history of the company are inspiring.  It has grown very fast.
cons: The leadership and management below Fred Smith need to get their heads out of their butts and realize the unnecessary stress that they put on their Sales folks.  They do not put their people first, they do not care about their customers.....all they care about is their Stockholders, Wall Street and where the leadership is going to go for President's Club on the backs of their sales people.  The company has grown too fast and the wrong people are in charge and too many good people have gone.

job_title: Delivery Driver/CSA in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: FedEx is a terrific company to work for. The pay to start is not that great, however FedEx offers their employees excellent benefit packages, flexible hours, and everyone is extremely professional and courteous to each other. The work environment is great.
cons: I was moved from SLO (where I applied for the position) to Goeleta because a more senior person wanted to move to SLO for Goeleta. I felt that a bit unfair because I live in SLO and had to commute. So because of this reason I did not stay with the company. But I can appreciate the fact that the company and management backed up the more senior employee and accommodated their request.

pros: Generous vacation and fairly good benefits.  If you know how to play politics and do not want  to (or cannot) put too much effort, this is the place for you.
cons:
I can talk primarily  about the IT department at FedEx Canada and IT in general. The IT management in Canada is paralyzed by  fear to do anything creative. They are just followers. There is no vision, no collaboration between the groups and no respect for the people who try to make a difference.
Even the Corporate IT does not do too many creative things. The Architects engage vendors to build solutions, which afterwards the Architects present as their own.  

 If you have the ambition to develop and progress as professional, stay away.

review_title: Best place to work in Memphis, TN
pros: Management stresses a good work / life balance.  FedEx has the best, highest paying jobs in Memphis, TN.  The company has not had to layoff workers (offering early retirement is first option).  There is a great benefits package, and many training opportunities for employees.  A person can join in one position, then quickly find an opportunity which best fits their desires / skills.
cons: Bureaucracy and cross-functional, cross-OpCo complexity makes it difficult to implement large scale projects.  Currently faced with economic issues related to oil prices and overall macro environment.  This has put the company is in a holding pattern keeping career opportunities limited.

review_title: Working at FedEx is not a job, it is an EXPERIENCE!
job_title: Business Development Executive in San Ramon, CA
pros: FedEx has an excellent work-life balance and the opportunities to further your career or profession is excellent.  FedEx thrives on delivering the "Purple Promise" to their customer, which is: provided their customers with an outstanding experience.  The same holds true for FedEx employees...FedEx delivers an outstanding experience as you grow with the company.
cons: Wow...I can't think of any downsides to working at FedEx. There are outside challenges (fuel cost, electronic document exchange, etc) that sometimes hamper the business development process, yet even with these challenges, FedEx provides us with the tools and resources to overcome the challenges.

job_title: Corporate Marketing Analyst Advisor in Ivry-sur-Seine
pros: Great company to work for, simply the best company in the metro Memphis area. The only Fortune 100 company in the metro area as well (to my knowlege).  Company has jobs which comes with Career tracks.  Great company culture.
cons: Far too much company politics.  Slow to adapt and change.  Seems like it's the "superstar" employees that do the real work of the company, while the others are just running their mouths but not accomplishing much.  Limited salary gains and very paltry bonuses.  Healthcare plan is mediocre.

pros: Benefits package and pay are competive
cons: The company no longer follows its core values. The company treats its employees like a number. Management has zero accountability, so you do not ever speak with the manager who is actually writing you up. Courier employees are expected to do the jobs of managers. Later start times are encroaching on about a 3 month basis, giving you less time to do your job. Employees are being written up for not taking a full hour break, for being 99% on their numbers regardless of experience and conditions they had to deal with. Operations managers are being threatened to be written up by their managers for not writing up employees.

review_title: Good Stable Company, Nice culture, Better to work at the Main Hub in Memphis
pros:
Great sales training
Interesting industry
Nice people that work there
Good Benefits
Decent pay
cons:
Career paths are not very good, I was Promoted and had to take a pay cut because of lack of bonuses
Surprise quarterly goals that consistantly change, one quarter super high the next surer low
Alignment of accounts is horrible and very little control over what accounts your aligned to
No HR representative on the West Coast, most all important roles are in Memphis
If you want to get promoted you have to wait a long time or move

pros: Open communication about things that are happening within the company at any given time.  Senior Leadership is focused on the employee and their happiness, but they are too concerned with paperwork.  The environment is awesome and the comraderie next to none.
cons: TOO MANY FORMS!!  It seems like there are four hundred forms to fill out every time you want to make a change to your employee account, or your benefits, or your schedule.  Nothing is easy.  There are also rampant conerns about acquisitions and the opportunities afforded by them.  Too many chiefs and not enough indians it would seem like.

pros: Friendly culture.  Strong brand.  Good work-life balance.  Nice training opportunities.  Solid career advancement opportunities.  Good opportunities to work in a number of divisions.  Good benefit package overall.  Good salary comparable to other companies of similar size.  Pension plan.
cons: Poorly orchestrated layoffs.  Bureacracy given the size of the company.  Working alongside poor performers.  Minimal incentives for strong performance.  Poor HR division.  Very conservative legal department that slowed everything down or prevents things from moving forward.

pros:
-Start off making $11.90/hr. Overtime is like $18+/hr. Raises come every 3-12 months
-Easy work moving boxes/mail if you're in good shape
-Get a personal workout everyday (you will sweat & work most muscles in your body but its worth it and you'll feel great, make sure to stretch 
-Nice hours, only 3-4 a day unless you do overtime
-Complimentary Uniform/boots 
-Vision/Dental/Medical benefits after 3months
-College tuition assistance & reimbursement
-Retirement Plan
-Good working environment
-Resembles a small city 
-Complimentary food catered every few months
-Security
cons:
-Gets very hot in unairconditioned work areas esp. In the summer
-Hours (start time & end time) are different everyday so you have to call a hotline in the mornings

review_title: Could be great, but too many old heads at the helm
pros: Great benefits, good pay, decent bonus, excellent resume booster.
cons: Extremely antiquated systems (I mean, they don't even teach the programming language anymore), tenure is valued over innovation, too many in leadership who refuse to retire which creates a bottleneck for younger people who want to grow with the company. There is a reason that millennials and generation X'ers are exiting the company en masse; look at the root cause and DO something to address it.

pros: Great brand, easy to get customer meetings, product easy to sell because we can genuinely help small businesses improve and save, overall good company culture, good expense accounts for customer entertaining
cons: Underpaid in a bull market --  new bonus structure (rolled out in 2017) cuts quarterly bonuses by thousands,  internal partners are mostly incompetent making getting admin work done very hard, not enough reward and incentive for selling, sales salary is very low compared to sales job averages, SO much customer service on the shoulders of sales  - hard to delegate.

pros: People are the focus for FedEx, you always feel that the company cares about you. This is also a very customer centric compnay so we will bend over backwards to make customers happy and FedEx rewards employees for doing that.
cons: As any large corporation, there is bureaucracy and things are slow to get done as you have to fight for resources. Currently due to bad ecomony there are no carreer opportunites at FedEx, it is in a so-called 'hiring freeze'. Memphis is another downside. This is not an exciting city and crime is bad.

pros: People are the focus for FedEx, you always feel that the company cares about you. This is also a very customer centric compnay so we will bend over backwards to make customers happy and FedEx rewards employees for doing that.
cons: As any large corporation, there is bureaucracy and things are slow to get done as you have to fight for resources. Currently due to bad ecomony there are no carreer opportunites at FedEx, it is in a so-called 'hiring freeze'. Memphis is another downside. This is not an exciting city and crime is bad.

review_title: People First? I don't think so!
pros: Benefits! For employee and family are quite good.
cons: Policy is KING. Even when policy is irrelevant, out dated, or diminishes the "people first" policy. FedEx also, just took away the company matching contribution on the 401K!

review_title: The pay isn't the best, but it's honest work...if you're willing to do it.
pros:
- Great co-workers. All of them were friendly and hard-working, and willing to help out. 
- Pay was higher than expected.
- Very relaxed atmosphere.
cons:
- Grueling requirements.
- Unreasonable requests.
- Dark and cramped spaces
- Very biased. Expected me to do more work than others due to my gender/age/etc, even though all of us were getting paid the same. 
- Too much favoritism. They would deliberately pull me off my assignment to load someone else's truck, because it was a girl and she couldn't load 150lb. tires, which I totally understand, but the favoritism was just too much sometimes.

job_title: Highest Level Individual Contributor in Memphis, TN
pros: A great place to work. Forgiving of mistakes.  My job entails using advance analytics and project management on cross functional projects. Forward looking strategic analysis. Mentoring newer employees. Team leader at times.  I truly admire about half of my management,
cons: Multiple operating companies means no unions,except for pilots, but it also means inefficiency. Changing focus multiple times during the year.  Much emphasis put on as opposed to valuing challenging ideas. Most executives children work for the company and are promoted very quickly.  Promoting within leads to group think.  Salary for the highest level individual contributors is too low.

pros:
I've worked for FedEx for five years, many of my colleagues have worked for the company over 15 years (and I have one who's been with FedEx 40 years!). I feel my pay is commiserate to my job title, our health benefits are excellent (coverage and cost) and we have a generous pension and 401(k) opportunity. 
My work / life balance is what I'd expect for a full time corporate level position and I have the opportunity to learn and explore new challenges.
cons: In my department opportunities for advancement are limited (but not at the company as a whole). And we have a low morale issue due primarily to poor vendor management and a few very very negative employees (they are never happy).

pros: The benefits are impressive and promotion opportunities are there if you're willing to wait. There are not too many companies that offer full health and dental insurance to even the lowest level employees. The continuous assessment of performance can be either a positive or negative.
cons: Stress. Promotions are based mostly on seniority. The hours required to actually meet standards far exceed a normal working week. Employee turnover is especially high if you work in the logistics department. Some of the employees seem to be barely conscious neanderthals or are super gung ho military types who get far too excited about getting a truck to Memphis on time.

review_title: FedEx reminds me of a dysfunctional but loving family... for the most part, it's great, until the doors are closed.
job_title: Senior Software Analyst in Maitland, FL
pros: FedEx is stable and tries to keep employees best interests at heart. They offer reasonably competitive pay and benefits. There is pride in the brand, even among employees.
cons: FedEx can be political and two-faced... the company seems much more concerned about their reputation to the public (shareholders) and sometimes shoots itself in the foot. Also, FedEx has become very bureaucratic and more of a popularity game, rather than truly rewarding innovation and hard work. The employee has become more disposable over the years, though, admittedly, it's still better than most companies.

review_title: Small part in a very large organization with somewhat limited scope, but many good things about company.
job_title: Marketing Specialist Advisor in Memphis, TN
pros: Work conditions.  Safety.  Facilities.  Adequate tools to do the job.  Convenience.  Sufficient flexibility.
cons: Limited income growth.  Pay scales not rationalized.  The real inside track is not always known.  Very challenging competition.  Lots of outstanding talent and intelligence, but sometimes lacking in real and broad experience, especially experience in Transportation.

job_title: Home Delivery Driver in Saint Rose, LA
pros: Good pay, meeting interesting people.
cons: Delivery drivers seems to e the only ones who are held accountable for doing their job. The freight drivers that travel between statio can show up as they  well please, which cause us to be dispatched late( sometimes as late as 10 oclock). Station manergers and their sidepieces (women) are not in anything but their bounuses. And working for a contractor sometimes means lack of flexability to take time off in an emergency.

pros: Keeps you in shape. They will give you benefits after a year. Education benefits. Other company benefits listed on the websites. Struggling to think of pros.
cons: I don't enjoy getting hurt and receiving cuts and bruises on my body on a daily basis. No matter how safe I try to be, It happens. I don't care if it's minor cuts and bruises here and there. I didn't like this job because I didn't like the lifting, as a former UPS employee, I found that working at the unloading area at their "new state of the art building" was more difficult than the much older UPS ups hub.

review_title: FedEx truly a first class company
job_title: Senior Project Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros:
The best reasons to work for Fedex include the following:
-The ability to work for a great company
-The experience of working for a top notch organization
-Great name for building your resume
-Great benefits and competitive pay
-Everyone knows what FedEx does
-For the most part, people are truly valued by the company
-Work/life balance is good
cons:
The downsides to working at Fedex include the following:
-Career opportunities are limited because people in management rarely leave FedEx
-Some questionable people in management
-Employee development could use improvement
-Memphis is not the best of cities to work and live in

review_title: Excellent place to work but driven individuals beware!
pros: Excellent camaraderie with other employees, job security, excellent benefits, very ethical company.  I'm proud to work at FedEx.
cons: There are a large number of employees that aren't carrying their fair share of the workload.  While this is encouraging for some, because of job security, it is very discouraging for those that really want to contribute to FedEx's success.  It can be demoralizing to see other's that aren't contributing as much getting the same recognition and compensation as those that strive hard to do an excellent job.

review_title: Great company, challenging work, decent salary.
job_title: Senior Marketing Specialist in Memphis, TN
pros: Challenging work. Committed team members. Generous benefits. FedEx is a strong believer in positive reinforcement. They often make the top of best places to work lists because they treat their employees very fairly. Respect, diversity, and cooperation are heavily favored.
cons: Limited short-term promotion opportunity. Heavy workload. Politics. Employees come from all over the country to work here for the opportunity to work for this very well respected company and they tend to stay for a very long time. Most promotion is from within but opportunity is limited due to very low turnover and high satisfaction. Great opportunity if you plan on staying in Memphis for 10 + years. Hard to advance in shorter periods of time.

review_title: Perfect for College student who wants to earn fast cash or turn in to a career in the future
job_title: Package Handler in San Diego, CA
pros: Good Pay and Hours, advancements are available based on your performance, including time. In my facility, managers are awesome! treats their workers right. If you do not have a gym membership, treat this job as a work out! and getting paid at the same time!
cons: So far there are no Cons, other than people calling out and have to pick up the slacks. This is a very physical demanding job, so if you don't mind sweating and getting sore, this job is perfect! You eventually get used to it.

review_title: Good pay if you don't have a degree
pros: Benefits are good for a part-time position. Pay is fair for not requiring anything above a driver's license and HS GED.
cons: Can be stressful if you take the job seriously. Can't have time off during seasonal peak. If you are full-time, basically become property of the company with no guarantee of day off. Management talks good game, but nothing ever changes for better. Vacation is by bid with seniority getting first dibs, family friendly weeks off are slim pickings to new hires. Warehouse has no climate control. Vehicles aren't maintained well, so they usually have a check engine light on. Might not have heat or AC.

review_title: Worst place I've have worked in my career so far
job_title: Associate Programmer Analyst in Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
Opportunity to work with a large number of systems
Job Security
Average Benefits
Nice Facility
You can get buy doing the bare minimum and not get fired
cons:
Required 24/7 attention to job, no disconnect
Pay well below industry average
Job Titles mismatched to allow for lower pay
You are not a person, only a number.
Lack of empathy or compassion from management
People can get buy doing the bare minimum and make more than you
No real incentives for performance
After 3 years I made less than when I started

review_title: Review of the dock working position at Fed Ex freight
pros:
The work is hard to good use to at first because the pace but after a month, you should use it it. 

Management is cool.
cons: A focus on bills/rates despite workers getting different work load. For instance, a worker might have to move 5 units out of a trailer while the other worker moves 1 unit out of trailer yet the rates for both need to be high.

review_title: The interview provides falsehoods about the actual job and the job is very high stress for little reward.
job_title: Senior ECO Import Coordinator in Tonawanda, NY
pros: Decent start pay but next to nothing on raises. OK benifits when I started but have reduced to a very high cost for all.
cons: Management talks to you like a child and makes every attempt to make you feel inadiquate no matter how good of a job you do. Even though many new oppertunities open up if your not a blood relitive of Sr. empolyees you will not get the job. Not enough parking for employees and you must park blocks away on the street with tractor trailors almost running into your vehical. They have been advertising for hiring  nonstop sense I began there in 2006, this high turnover in workers should tell you something about the enviorment.

review_title: FedEx values their employees...Great place to work, Invoice Analyst
pros: The benefits are very good, lots of training available, clean and pleasant office, and all the necessary up-to-date tools to complete the work. Good work/ life balance.
cons: The workload was heavy and sometimes very monotonous.  There was very little room for advancement without going to Memphis.  Progressing to higher positions takes a LONG time. There is also very little regulating the management from nurturing and advancing their 'favorites' based on their relationship not the skill level.

pros: The benefits are great, the location is perfect for me very close to my home. I really like the team I work with great culture and establishing a living psp.
cons: Wish there was a little more room for development and promotion but I know if I work hard stay focused and get my graduate degree a new field of work will open up for me n

pros: FedEx Services is a great company and the perfect place to build a very rewarding career. Because of its size, there are a lot of opportunities to move up through the ranks. They also have really good training available for anyone who wants to take advantage of it. The benefits are pretty standard. The people are wonderful!
cons: They suffer from some of the same issues as most big companies: upper management is in the dark about some things; there is a lot of competition to move up; and although the benefits are standard they've become expensive.

review_title: Ehh. Workload high, manager showed favoritism, didn't care about your personal responsibilities.
job_title: Senior ECO Import Coordinator in Memphis, TN
pros: Got alot of overtime. Insurance was good and cheap. Can't really think of anything else to say about pros of the company.
cons:
The workload was entirely too high. Impossible to complete the work in your 8 hour day and even with overtime, it was still impossible unless you stayed till 8-9pm, sometimes later. 

Manager didn't care if you had a child that needed to be picked up a certain time. But she always ran out of the door to pick up her pet dog by 6. 

I can go on and on.

pros: Horrible place to work.
cons: If your under 10 years with the company you have no seniority.  When you turn in your vacation forget about summers. You get split days off. No balance with work and home life. If you call out sick your manager for sure will ride you when you return. If you get into an accident and you hurt someone your fired. If you have 3 related vehicle accidents, or any ocurrence with your vehicle your fired.  Managers reviews don't mean a thing. If your part time you can be sent home after 3 hours. people transfering in your department from other department will bump you after six months so if your new forget it.  Managers are uneducated locker room mentality idiots. No continuous education for upper level staff. Trucks are terrible and unsafe. Tractor trailers are old seats with terrible springs and air. Lots of problems with back and knees.

pros:
Excellent work life balance 
Generally nice people through out the organization
Comprehensive Benifits - 401k match, dental,health, tuition reimbursement
cons:
- For those who are career oriented and trying to quickly move up this is not the place to work.   There are limited opportunities for advancement. 
- It is nearly impossible to develop new ideas into programs, products or services from the bottom up. Everything requires large project teams and sign offs from multiple departments with conflicting political interests.  The only way anything moves forward is if SVP or CEO forces it through. 
- Pay is well below industry average for all salaried positions

pros:
Great people in a team-oriented environment. I spent 25 years there, and learned invaluable skills that have served me well since I left. I was generally happy with the managers I worked for, and the culture was people-friendly, fast-paced, and fun.

From a work standpoint, there were always interesting, challenging projects that kept me interested and engaged. We weren't afraid to push the envelope on technology, and most of the time I could see how my efforts contributed to the bottom line.

Over the years, I developed a wonderful network of professional associates and friends, and will always value my time at Fedex.
cons:
Fedex is BIG, and the challenges of managing that size of organization has led to an over-reliance on rules and procedures that tend to hider productivity and innovation. More and more, it is losing the ability to respond to market pressures and opportunities in a timely fashion.

Additionally, the company has lost the managerial edge that propelled its success in early years. They have acquired a glut of mid-level corporate survivors who rely more on preserving the status-quo than taking the risks necessary for competitive success. 

From an employee standpoint, a job at Fedex is not as secure as it once was. While they formerly had a no-layoff policy, they have abandoned it. Layoffs aren't frequent, but they are now part of the Fedex culture, with the attendant effects on morale.

review_title: Good Part Time Job, Difficult Full Time Job
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
Guaranteed hours based on Full or Part Time (35 vs 17). 
Usually much more available if you are flexible. 
Always work, especially mornings to help full time routes
cons:
Incredibly slow pay progression, you will never top out  (29$+) 
You will be stuck in 17-22$ range per hour for 10 or more years. YES 10+ years. 
Strong likelihood of injury
Not nearly enough training for full time routes . You WILL learn on the job.

pros:
Good money for unskilled labor
The hours were perfect for a night owl like me
Very quick advancement at first. Within my first three months I had been trained on Forklifts, Tugs, and had become a material handler.
cons:
Very hard on your body.
Creepy cult-like brainwashed mentality is widespread among the workers... Seriously, these people take company loyalty to a whole new level.
I'd go home caked with dirt and dust every night.
So many people quite because our manager was incredibly short tempered that we were understaffed for quite a while. 
Almost impossible to advance very far because nobody retires anymore.

review_title: FedEx is a good starting job
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Romeoville, IL
pros: Its a place that is usually hiring, and is a bit faster paced than usual, you'll have plenty to do with nice pay, compared to other entry level jobs. Applying for a position in early fall through winter is basically a guaranteed job, and if you work hard enough you'll have a good chance of moving up their higher positions.
cons: FedEx is usually hiring because its a labor intensive job, and requires actual physical labor on the workers end. Most of the time though your workload will be small, although this is no good if you need money, because at FedEx you work until all the packages are where they need to be, which means at whatever time all the packages are loaded is what time you'll be going home. FedEx cuts hours based on how much labor they need, so if the package count is low, then your hours will be low. The best time to apply for FedEx is right before holiday season; (I applied the last week of october and got my job on Halloween. ) although, holiday season has really high amounts of workload and you'll be forced to work extra hours at varying clock in/clock out times. You don't have a standard clock in/clock out time at FedEx, it is changed actively thoughout the week. If you're part time you might have anywhere from 15 to 32 hours a week based on how much work there is to be done, and how long you are willing to stay each day. If you aren't a work horse beware, because this job gets to a point where its not the physical effort you have to put in to lift boxes; (which, to be fair, are usually light) its about how monotonous the job can be, the work never changes, your job will be to take a box, scan it, and put it somewhere else for however long every day, so good luck with that. This job has more of equipment, sharp edges, and heavy lifting than usual, so becareful, and steel-toe boots could help out a lot.

review_title: I am proud of working for such a respected company
job_title: Corporate Account Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: FedEx is a company that most people recognize, and has an excellent reputation,  It is a company that has allowed me to grow professionally and allowed many opportunities.  The culture of FedEx is also very positive and inspirining, and I feel like I am selling a quality product.  I also feel very lucky to be working under a CEO with such leadership and vision.  I feel like I have many options in staying with FedEx, and feel like I truly am a valued employee.  They also provide excellent benefits, I think, compared to other organizations.
cons: I beleive other organizations have more competitive salaries.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros:
People are treated decently - fair towards minorities and immigrants.
Race or color does not matter towards promotions! FedEx is the largest employer of immigrants within the state of Tenneessee. Certain groups have world class talent and it is a great experience to work with such people.
The benefits are great with discounted air tickets, good health insurance, great work environment, etc.
cons: Company is slow to move to market conditions and bit conservatinve. As a result if you want to make a change it will take time and at times could be frustrating.

job_title: Inside Sales Account Executive in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: career opportunities - operations, sales, analytical positions available when times are good. If you are willing to move, your chances for advancement are greatly improved.  Compensation seems fair compared with competitors is fair, but variable compensation could be better for sales jobs.  Benefits are tremendous, still offer pension as well as half-match on 401k. Good health benefits and promote good work/life balance.  Must like a constantly changing atmosphere. Always keeping pace or getting ahead of competition means procedures never stick around long.  Management does a good job of reconizing good performers.  Overall good place to work.
cons: morale - can be negative with some employees, typical for most large companies.

review_title: PSP is just a slogan -- it's the same as other corporate cultures
job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: The corporate environment at FedEx is not demanding if you are a reasonably adept politician.
cons:
Little means of long-term advancement other than management, and little value given to skilled performers. Leadership is just plain greedy. 

Just this week there were 2 separate stories about FedEx in the news:
1) FedEx earnings estimates were down (due to weak global economy)
2) The CEO, Fred Smith, nearly doubled his salary, and Rob Carter, CEO of FedEx Services, accepted an 80% raise.

Does this sound like they care about you the worker, or you the stockholder?

review_title: I love working at Fedex, best company I have ever worked for
pros:
Excellent benefits and salary
Company tuition reimbursement program
Good work/life balance
Most employees have been here for many years and will retire from Fedex
Management cares and listens to us
Great location, parking, cafeteria, gym, etc.
Lots of training and opportunities 
No layoffs due to the fact they use contractors as part of the staff
cons: The only con I can think of now is the drive to the top of Fedex Drive in the snow.

pros: Good experience for someone just coming into the job force. You will learn how to interact with customers and deal with the general public. You will learn some basic sales techniques and how to up-sell products. You will also learn some basic computer skills and project management skills to put onto a resume. There are also pretty good medical and 401k benefits.
cons: There is a large learning curve and allot is expected of you as you will be filling many roles without allot of time to learn all that is needed to do your job.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: No Pros. U will b treated like u work in a sweat shop. If u r injured it will b deemed preventable and b yr fault. Mgt expects u to wrk xtra hrs when others r off.  Yr hrs will not b consistent and will be cut when mgt doesn't need u.  Training for yr job is terrible or doesn't happen.
cons: Fedex is doing poorly but employees shouldn't b treated so badly.  FX needs to return to offering psychological incentives, treat their frontline employees better. U only hear frm mgt. when u make a mistake.  Very stressful, very low morale exists and it impacts yr personal life.

job_title: Fed Ex Ground Package Handler in Fort Worth, TX
pros: In my area, you get paid about twice minimum wage. Not bad for unskilled labor.
cons: Unreliable hours. Unreliable managers. Unreliable Equipment. More often than not, I was cut due to lack of work. More often than not I couldn't get my boss' attention off his tejano music video to do more than point out what chute was 75% or 100% full.  This is not a place for the slow, weak, or those easily bored. There's  no room to advance as they hire outside. They never ASK anyway.

pros:
Great Coworkers
Team Atmosphere
Good Benefits
Superior Brand Recognition
cons: Sales is responsible for everything- from billing issues, lost packages, driver issues and integration.

review_title: A really Frustrating experience. FedEx don't value your qualification and expertize
pros: No pros. It is totally a mess.20 % people will work  like donkeys and the remaining 80 % are enjoying  as they are manger's pets/ relatives / friends. If you don't have any hold with mangers your life and future is gone.
cons: Very  low salary .I have worked for 26K for almost 4 years with nominal increment of 20 to 40 dollar yearly. After having  a masters and couple of years IT experience failed to get a decent job within Fedex. and ultiamtely end up in quit and I have landed in a IT job with  a staring salary of 70 K.I truely wasted my valuable 4 years with Fedex

review_title: Hard to advance past this part time job
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Keasbey, NJ
pros: The pay is pretty good. There will be some form of benefits after one year. The work is not too hard and  some of the managers are sympathetic since they worked as part time package handlers.
cons: Hard to pin down  when there will be career advancement. Not just more hours added to the shift but a full time job with benefits.

pros: various opportunities career changes within the company. strong "people first" culture. Laid back culture, business casual, strong commitment to community service. Flexible work schedule and family friendly environment
cons: Limited levels of promotion for professionals, very little upward mobility and growth, performance management very subjective, even in new system. Maternity leave only 5 weeks of partial pay

pros: various opportunities career changes within the company. strong "people first" culture. Laid back culture, business casual, strong commitment to community service. Flexible work schedule and family friendly environment
cons: Limited levels of promotion for professionals, very little upward mobility and growth, performance management very subjective, even in new system. Maternity leave only 5 weeks of partial pay

review_title: FedEx is not a good company.
pros: Good Benefits and 401K match was decent. The brand is well known and a common name in the industry.  There are many locations to seek employment.
cons: Health Insurance is not what it used to be,  Insane amount of hours and no lunch allowed if you are in management and the pay is peanuts compared to the amount of work you do. FedEx has a habbit of understaffing to hit operational metrics but never shows it's employees the truth about if their operation is making or losing money. They are rude to customers, overcharge them for anything they can and damage alot of shipments. Additionally, their is poor top down communication and little to no cross communication from the different departments.

pros: The people at FedEx are amazing. The company pays very well, even its interns. My higher ups did a great job of making me feel comfortable and included. The culture is fun and vibrant. Being such a big company they get to play with the other "big boys."
cons: There is a lot of red tape to get through at FedEx. Everything has to go through legal and brand scrutiny. Being such a large company, your field of work is very narrow, especially in marketing as there are several teams and multiple directors.

job_title: District Sales Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Stability and opportunity to advance
cons: Senior leadership with antiquated view of management and sales philosophy. Pay not inline with market value. Advancement opportunity ends at district manager unless you REALLY become a sycophant and play the game.

pros: Great Benefits, World Class Training that you won't get anywhere else but college! Generous Pay Great place to get a career started at any age. Generally Intelligent and Personable Coworkers. Your opinion is valued if you get it to the right persons.
cons: They'll work you to death in exchange for the good pay and bene's. Getting sick repeatedly will cost you your job....fyi I worked part time and left on a buyout. They own you during the holidays so get used to it right up front. Management appears to be driven by upper management to really crack the whip.

review_title: Great place to work while in school or seeking a second source of income
pros: Excellent way to get paid to "workout". Superb tuition re-imbursement program along with employee benefits even though all the positions are just PT.
cons: Minimal career advancement oppertunities unless you are willing to relocate within the company. To focused on the negative rather than mixing in some positive. Makes everyone fear for the potential loss of their job.

review_title: Almost like being self-employed, but with the security if a corporate position.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The company is doing very well and the pay and bonuses show it.  As a Customer Technical Consultant you are left to plan your work day and training yourself. Usually, that is a good thing, but sometimes that can leave you feeling isolated and lacking support.
cons: It can be difficult to know where you should focus your energy and what direction to take your technical skills when there is no direct oversight.
