cons: Working at the ramp in Austin, TX, the summer months are tough, the warehouse is hot, working on an aircraft is hot, but your body gets used to it. Like with any work place, there is miscommunication that leads to extra work needing to be done which is often frustrating.

pros: Company has provided extensive training and tools to help me become a better professional.  Great benefits and fantastic tuition reimbursement program.  Employer is great to provide flexible hours while getting your education.
cons: The pay is not the greatest.  Pay increases are minimal.  With a Bachelors degree and over 10+ years of experience, I'm getting ready to leave due to $39K a year.  Not meeting my financial needs, but I will certainly miss the company.

pros: Secure position, steady pay check, some nice coworkers, relatively good benefits, recognized company, adequate vacation and free holidays, some tuition reimbursement
cons: Not much advancement opportunity, tends to promote at upper levels with no rewards or promotions at lower levels

review_title: Great job if you just do it
job_title: preload package handler  in Lenexa, KS
pros: Absolutely love the job and the company. It is physically demanding at times and just mentally demanding enough to keep things from getting boring. Basically show up on time, do your job, and get paid without any of the typical BS associated with other jobs. Fantastic especially if you have another job during the day.
cons: Only con I have is some employees like to whine. Ignore them and just do your job.

job_title: Warehouse Loader in Pompano Beach, FL
pros:
Paid every week on time.
Repetitive but simple work
Decent pay and good benefits
Generally good co-employee
cons:
Grueling hours, sometime no breaks
Hot humid work environment
Overwhelming workload at times, high turnover so ALWAYS understaffed
Management good/bad, the good try to help where they can.  The bad are lazy and loud, sometimes at the same time. Avoid the midnight shift at all costs.

pros: Pay, vacation time and benefits are good for an unskilled worker like me.
cons: Fedex is currently in stupid/confused mode. They are buying up other transportation companies while taking their focus off the part of the company that started the whole show. Express volumes are way down due to sales shifting pkgs to Fedex Ground. They are mothballing aircraft and keeping vehicles well passed their service life. I would love to show pictures of the rusted piece of crap truck we just got rid. I'm sure investors would be interested in knowing what's really going on at Fedex. They take vehicles from station that some coffee dog in Memphis says the station doesn't need even though he/she doesn't have a friggin clue what the stations vehicle needs are. They put 2 wheel drive vehicles in parts of the country that need 4 wheel drive. Having 4 wheel drive vehicles is what separates us from the competition but upper management is too stupid to figure it out. The give us a raise and then raise our rates. They have a spending freeze so it's hard to get new uniforms. I've had the same shirts for a decade. If you are young and a hard worker and don't mind being stressed all the time Fedex is for you. You will learn to hate driving. I mean despise driving. Remember those weekend drives you took with your significant other? Say goodbye to them. You will not want to leave your home your days off. Christmas? Don't even get me started. You will come to hate your favorite holiday and will only put up with it for the sake of your kids. 20 years of my life wasted but they paid for my kids and my wife was able to be a stay home mom. So, it is what it is. Most of the employees I work with are smokers and alcoholics.

pros:
Great pay
Great benefits
Many opportunities for promotion
Nice people

This is a company that really understands the fact that their business is dependent on their labor workers, and they treat them well.  The pay is great, with wage increases happening every 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12 months, and then every year for four years.  The benefits are great, after six months of employment part timers are eligible for PTO and other benefits, as well as the opportunity to switch to full time.  The management staff really seems to have a legitimate care about safety and are very encouraging, motivating, and polite.  Management thanks package handlers after every shift and every two weeks or so they have a "package handler appreciation day" and give out cookies, cupcakes, or even sometimes a catered snack such as bagels or hot dogs.  Also, they will tell you that FedEx is one of the few places where you can start as a package handler and work your way up without a college degree, and it is true that hard workers are quickly spotted and promoted.  This is a great job for someone who is willing to provide tough physical labor, and can be great as a summer job or as a career starter.
cons:
Hard work
Hours (Depending on your shift)
Weather

The cons that I listed are not really FedEx's fault...  Just know that while you are paid well and given great benefits, this is a labor based job and you are expected to work hard for the duration of your shift (usually 3-4 hours off season, but as much as 5 during busy season).  The warehouses are not climate controlled so it is very hot and muggy in the summer and you WILL sweat, so make sure you bring a water bottle.  Management is very understanding and they provide gatorade and allow you to take short breaks to fill your bottle during your shift.  Also, some of the shifts are terrible hours (like 3AM - 8AM or 9PM to 2AM), but these shifts are also paid more and often are easy to get hired into, if you are willing to alter your sleep schedule.  Overall though, all of the cons relate to the nature of the job and not the company itself.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Buffalo Grove, IL
pros: Great Benefits, Company provides good training to mean job requirements, FedEx has a reputation for having a no-nonsense work environment where performance is constantly tracked, measured, and available to employee during annual review. All calls are recorded and may be monitored and graded by managers of other call centers reducing discrimination or favoritism.
cons: Little chance for meaningful promotion, Some performance (matrix) measurements are contrary to customer service. A focus on call time (for example) pressures employee to get off call regardless if customer issue has been resolved.

pros: Decent pay and benefits plenty of flex on your schedule, ok upward mobility.
cons: They brag on how they never laid anyone off all the time, and its true they just offer you an impossible job in another state.  Office politics are idiotic the higher you go.  If you have a good upper manager then you are golden but if they don't like you they will give you jobs that force you to quit or go to another shift.

pros: Vehicles are well maintained.  Uniforms are supplied including the cost of steel toed shoes/boots.  Job description is well defined. OT is paid after 8 hours.
cons: 60 minutes unpaid breaks are required.  was not able to get the equipment I needed had to supply my own dolly and shovel.  Behind on having a drop off store front in smaller location for residential pickup when they are not home in comparison to UPS, DHL and Purolator. Uniforms do not fit and have to pay for tailoring.  Ceiling on wage.

pros: Good pay, friendships were easily made, team leaders were always friendly and caring of there workers. Good benefits and room for advancement .
cons: fast paced heavy lifting  for long periods of time. Managers could have been more helpful and thoughtful of their workers. Weird hours and times that we would start and finish work. Never had enough help on the shift so the workers working that particular shift had to work harder and do more than one activity.

pros: Strong company with a world-wide known name and reputation; all in all - a great place to start one's career or reinforce one's CV with. Very strong operations, planning and IT units with a variety of internal development programs and training courses, shall it be required, highly professional teams.
cons: As often in large companies, decisions may take a while to be made, usually much bureaucracy involved into anything that has to do with back office operations. Career opportunities are not as high as expected - much tasks are now being shifted to India & Poland, outsourced.

review_title: This company over works its employees and pay them very little.
job_title: Assistant Manager in San Rafael, CA
pros:
The customers are amazing! Especially during the holidays they bring us gift cards and coffee! Health and dental Benefits are good too!  I get up to 70% of shipping and free computer use.
Fast-paced environment of you like to be under high-stress, demanding type job.
cons: Employees are overworked, under paid, and employees are not appreciated. FedEx is not flexible with your schedule and rarely is vacation time looked favorably upon. My manager is one of the worst managers I've we worked with. My schedule is constantly being tossed around without consideration of my personal life. This is one of the worst companies to work for. They do not practice what they preach in their mission statement.

pros: The benefits are good, if you're there long enough to get them and use them.
cons: Could not work full time and they didn't offer it because they didn't want to have to pay anyone for full time hours besides the couriers, they valued couriers over everyone else, management will try to get over on you any way they can, you will be overworked and underpaid, they'll up your pay to $16 and then cut your hours, and when you quit the job they'll put it down as a termination instead of you quitting because they have such a high turnover rate.

review_title: It's like working for a shifty company....that's huge and global!
pros:
Discount shipping
Travel discounts
Peers
Paycheck always clears the bank
cons:
Promotions now seem based on a pulse rather qualifications, experience or proven results.
Continue to skirt job classifications to keep payroll for hourly team members at a minimum
Set or provide instructions for processes that have a direct impact on peoples compensation after the fact
Company tends to put very little in writing - and when something is in writing the ambiguity is deafening - this protects them during quarterly closing as the rules *need to be reviewed on a individual scenario basis*

review_title: The compensation and benefits package are very good, benefits better than most
job_title: Leadership Role in San Antonio, TX
pros: The compensation and benefits package are very good, benefits better than most.  The company has good core motives and does a lot for charity.   There's a tuition assistance program that can pay for almost everything except parking and books.  The mail order prescription plan can save you tons of money.  There are airline discounts for regular part time and fulltime employees as well as many other discounts available.   You can get a workout on the job while getting paid--because much of the entry level work is physical.  We call it being an industrial athelete!
cons: The current high oil prices have me considering other employ, because of the negative affect it has had on other airlines recently.  FedEx is heavily aircraft driven, which gives the cause for my concern.  Upper management can be out of touch with lower level employees.  The shiftwork can be demanding on family and social lives because FedEx is a 24 hour company.  There are opportunities for advancement, but it may mean taking part-time work for a while in order to get a better full-time job.

review_title: Its what you make of it.
pros: My co-workers are the first thing to come to mind. They really make the company. Beniefits are fine and there's opportunity for advancement if one so desires.
cons: Like all successful companies, they must answer to the stockholders and this sometimes leaves some employee with the feeling  they dont matter to the company. The couriers make up the majority of the company, yet they are the only employees not given any kind of bonus/pay incentives.

review_title: Overall I enjoy going to work everyday.
pros: Great Pay, Great Benefits, and good people. Fedex Ground is one the best companies to work for in the world. Great chance for advancement if you work hard for it.
cons: Limited growth at some locations. Can be stressful during the peak season of Christmas. Long hours during the Xmas season. Filling in and being on call once you get higher up.

pros: Learn alot about the work
cons: Identitify the right person for the right work .... dont blindly assign the work

review_title: Great place to work...if you want to settle down for good
job_title: Senior Programmer Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: The benefits and work-life balance is terrific.  The work environment is great.  Attrition is very low and hence job security is high.  If you are planning to start a family and want a secure job with good benefits and work-life balance, this is a great place to work.  Even though the salaries are not flamboyant, considering the job location is in Memphis, down South one can save a lot of money as the cost of living is quite low compared to the West or East coast.
cons: From a technical standpoint, if you are a software engineer and have aspirations in designing new technology and producing mind boggling innovations, forget it.  This place is terrible in software innovation.  To get something done, like getting a new laptop or even hardware infrastructure, it takes a loooong time....well, its down South :)  Like any job in the world, yes this job can also get monotonous.  But the opportunities to make it exciting and interesting....very little.  Lots of bureaucracy (which comes into picture with bigger workforce), lots of red tape and loads of meetings for planning other meetings....Yep, this place is just like Dilbert cartoons.  Sometimes I think Scott Adams worked in this place.  And if you are single or a young couple, trying to get a lot out of the city where you live, forget it.  Memphis has very little to offer except the Blues.

pros:
FedEx is a diverse company with a lot of opportunities.  My experience is at Express as a driver and manager for many years.  Couriers can make a decent living wage.  The job is physically demanding but rewarding for those who refuse to sit at a desk.  Couriers are not required to have college experience, but can make comparable wages.  The culture is good, though seems to be less customer centered as time goes on.  If you like to move around FedEx has the ability for couriers to transfer to any other available positions in other stations/cities.  Great if you want to see lots of places.  

As far as management, it was a good job as well.  Comp is fair, but not highly performance based.   It's the type of job that uses the same skills every day, but no two days are alike.  Managers have some flexibility as far as their schedules.  Once your team has launched and all is well, you can go on road and spend time one-on-one with employees, which is fun.  Peak is a pain and 2 straight months of 55 hours weeks, depending on where you live though, they great summers can efficiency of the FedEx machine make up for it.
cons:
Pay for performance is very poorly done at FedEx.  New employees likely start at the same wages their peers are making after having been there for several years.  Its not equitable and creates a lot of resentment in the workforce that's hard to overcome.  Due to route structures, bidding, seniority, there is a lot of entitlement among the employees as well.  Essentially they reward the most experienced, best drivers with the easiest routes and schedules pushing the harder work on the newbies (and even after 5-10 years, you might still be a newbie with the amount of tenure in the workforce).

As a manager, your roles are so specialized because FedEx is so huge, that you are constantly pigeon holed into positions that don't offer continued growth.  You have to be aware of that and work your way through it if you want to move up.  Too, there is a terrible misalignment of goals to hit unrealistic numbers.  What happens in the Company makes their plan, the EVPs divided it up (leaving a little in their back pockets)... then the RVPs hang on to a little extra... then the division guys do it, too so eventually the stations end up with FTE goals that are impossible to hit.  You burn out your people and everything is negative because your station cant reach the target, meanwhile the roll up numbers are just fine and your employees could have been celebrating their good work.  Just a lot of misaligned incentives at "good ol boy" FedEx.

pros: This company provides excellent benefits and retirement options as soon at your start state which is unheard of in this industry. They also have 401k and a pension, also unheard of in today's business world. The work expectations are reasonable and job support is there if you need it.
cons: There are not many options for upward mobility which is common in company's this size.

pros: The job is a job. You get paid and have benefits. There are a lot of overtime opportunities. You can learn a lot about customs if you take the initiative to do so.
cons: Because people work so much overtime the environment is stressful. It is a place where a lot of people have been working for years and are not willing to help new hires. The people seem like they are stuck and hopeless because this job is their only option. The job is very sedentary and could be boring after a while because it is glorified data entry.

pros: Professional atmosphere.  Depending on the management, you are not micro-managed; however you do have to communicate well and often the status of your projects as you would expect. If you have a capable manager you will thrive. Somewhat flexible on start and end times and lunch break if your circumstances need some flexibility. Some allow you to come in a little earlier than others and leave a little early or come in a little later and leave a little later as long as it overlaps what most consider a normal day. Pay and benefits are good though maybe not excellent. Still have an opportunity to move up or around in the company (though not as easy as it was at one time). If you get on a good team (good managers and co-workers) it is still a good place to work and I would recommend it.
cons: True to most jobs, your manager and management team determines your success, or lack thereof, so pray for a good one! it is not as easy to move around in the company as it once was. Reorgs happen from time to time and can be ok or not depending on who you end up working for.   Need to be good at office politics.  Benefits are not as good as they once were but not sure how they compare with other companies. Out of pocket expenses can be high initially and for medical procedures. Pay is usually not as high because benefits were ONCE good enough to balance it out. Now that FedEx is so big and has been around so long the people philosophy it was founded on is not shown like it once was but it is still a good working environment for the most part. Incompetent managers look for scape goats but that's not something that just happens here....it can happen anywhere.

pros:
Job Title sounds like an important job, and that may just help you get a real important job at a different company.
A lot of overtime available...so far. (They have been hiring many people so they won't have to pay overtime).  If you get $14/hr and you work 4 hours overtime everyday for a year, you can make 50k. Might be worth it for some people, definitely not for everyone.
cons:
It's basically a data entry job, don't let the title fool you. The pay is low, not a job for college graduates.   There are around 30 other people doing the same thing as you so seniority is going to play a big role in promotions.  They start you at around $14 or $15 per hour.  And you get like 2% raise each year, so you do the math. You will have to put in 4+ years just to get $1 raise.  There are other reviews here that proves it could be worse than the example i gave you.  At these kind of pay, a single person cannot survive since rent alone is around $1,000 + utilities for a studio.  This job is for kids living with parents or for people with a significant other that is making the big money.  How does the company get away with paying so low? 
They hire minorities(some can't even speak proper English) who would otherwise have a hard time finding a job.  If you are a white person, don't bother applying to Sr. Entry coordinator positions at the LA/Torrance (soon to move to Gardena) location because they have filled these low level jobs with minorities. Great move by the senior management at the HQ in Memphis.  They can claim to be a equal opportunity employer saying they have this many minorities in the company and this many minorities in management.  But if you look deeper into the company, you will see the minorities are at the very bottom in job level and pay.  The higher you go, the whiter it gets.  They have minorities in management positions at this LA locations, but these supervisor/managers are just puppets.  They have no authority over anything.  All the decisions are made in Memphis.  Again, don't expect to come in a get a promotion anytime soon.  Prepare to put in years at these wages since there are already many people in line ahead of you.

review_title: Great job (if you don't mind overtime)
pros: Friendly people, good atmosphere and modern office with canteen downstairs.  Lots of customs rules to learn but colleagues are super helpful.  Benefits are nice.  Job is pretty secure as long as you can work fast and accurately on repetitive tasks - they are always looking to increase the team.  Pay is fine for a first job in a corporation. Some opportunity to 'move up' eg. as a team leader.
cons:
Lots of compulsory overtime which to be fair is paid well (100% more), sometimes an hour extra per day, sometimes shorter, occasionally even longer than an hour. Overtime depends on when the tasks are finished by the whole team, so you cannot predict what time you'll go home in advance. 

Lots of pressure to work quickly. Tasks are repetitive but you have to keep alert in case of anything unusual.  This can be a bit stressful.

Holidays are very inflexible and you may not be granted your request, even if you ask months ahead of time - this applies to several months in the year, not only the obvious flashpoints like Christmas or August.  No Polish national holidays are given automatically - you may take the day off at a different time instead or be paid extra.

Be aware that if you are a 'native' English speaker, or near native then you may well be asked to join the small team calling out to customers. Customers are usually friendly (or neutral) so this is not a bad task, but some colleagues were disappointed to be moved to this team as they don't like to speak on the phone.

review_title: Great job (if you don't mind overtime)
pros: Friendly people, good atmosphere and modern office with canteen downstairs.  Lots of customs rules to learn but colleagues are super helpful.  Benefits are nice.  Job is pretty secure as long as you can work fast and accurately on repetitive tasks - they are always looking to increase the team.  Pay is fine for a first job in a corporation. Some opportunity to 'move up' eg. as a team leader.
cons:
Lots of compulsory overtime which to be fair is paid well (100% more), sometimes an hour extra per day, sometimes shorter, occasionally even longer than an hour. Overtime depends on when the tasks are finished by the whole team, so you cannot predict what time you'll go home in advance. 

Lots of pressure to work quickly. Tasks are repetitive but you have to keep alert in case of anything unusual.  This can be a bit stressful.

Holidays are very inflexible and you may not be granted your request, even if you ask months ahead of time - this applies to several months in the year, not only the obvious flashpoints like Christmas or August.  No Polish national holidays are given automatically - you may take the day off at a different time instead or be paid extra.

Be aware that if you are a 'native' English speaker, or near native then you may well be asked to join the small team calling out to customers. Customers are usually friendly (or neutral) so this is not a bad task, but some colleagues were disappointed to be moved to this team as they don't like to speak on the phone.

review_title: Experience at FEDEX in Edison, NJ
pros: They offer tuition reimbursement and other discounts for package handler.
cons: A lot of the time my questions were not answered by my managers. I have been ignored many times. When I went through the chain of command and spoke with someone from HR, I was told I would be contacted after a follow up was done. No one from HR reached out to me.

job_title: Senior Marketing Specialist in Dallas, TX
pros: FedEx has the best work-life balance policy I've ever seen.
cons: No growth opportunities outside of Memphis.  FedEx has the least prepared leadership I've ever seen because they promote from within only behavioral questions are asked.  Experience and expertise mean nothing.  You could have no experience in any given functional department but end up leading that department.  I've never seen anything like it.  It a comedy of errors.

review_title: Smart marriage of services...not so smart incentives to keep employees sharp and productive.
pros: Great flexibilty in schedule especially if you are a student. Good health benefits.  Worked with and meet the most amazing people! Good opportunity to learn graphic arts software, like Photoshop, Illustrator and good exposure to a variety of software and innovative technology.  Brilliant marriage of 2 needed services by almost anyone who is running any business, espeically small to medium size. Like any marriage FedEX is still working out its communication kinks. Variety of opportunity to move laterally, but limited upward growth.
cons: Try too many new things at once and do not let new concepts stay in place long enough to see if they work. Constanltly moving the target or goal.  Little stability -often reduce hours at will. Sometimes understaffed. Many times 1 or 2 coworkers left to run store with no management or supervisory presence. very little training.  Prior to merger could go online and do training on your own time & initiative - to gain better understanding of design software to bettter service the customer. Now it needed approval and on the floor training is reqularly interrupted, not completed or rushed while trying to service customers. Difficult to learn and master concepts to provide better service and consistent quality product.  Every customer across the nation should experience the same or close to the same level of service and knowledge when they enter FEDEX Office just like they do with FEDEX shipping services.

review_title: FedEx has blessed me with a rewarding career and opportunities I wouldn't have received elsewhere!
pros: Beyond a team environment, the culture at FedEx is like my extended family. Strong leadership and a management philosophy that puts employees first. Excellent healthcare benefits and college tuition reimbursement opportunities! And more importantly FedEx supports and provides employees opportunities to give back and support local communities!
cons: I don't have any complaints; after 23 years I still look forward to getting up and going to work every morning!

review_title: Loved the job, had issues with management styles
job_title: Package Handler in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Great part time job, enjoyed the different projects you get to learn and do. Good pay. Good benefits.
cons: Not crazy about the training process. When you hire 6+ people all at once and have different trainers, you don't actually know what they have actually been told. So you may not know something and they don't know where you are at in training until it's too late. Some of the trainers are also very angry and only know swearing and yelling.

review_title: Fedex Express is a great place to work
job_title: Courier/Dot Ramp Agent in Aberdeen, SD
pros: Great benefits, good pay, and self satisfaction. I work with great people and they always find a way to help me out if I need it.
cons: This job can be stressful when it comes to getting your packages out on time. A lot of stuff to learn in a short period of time.

pros: Good benefits. Full time: you get your hours and frequent overtime (depending on location). Paid time off, holiday (thanksgiving, christmas, New Year), Sick time.
cons:
Not career or skill development oriented. They have a learning plan you and your manager develop but will never allow you to train the skills you are interested in developing. Will not cross train even though you are supposed to be cross trained. Management is childish; lack of communication, lack responsibility, bad people skills. Team members are a mixed bag; some will work others will pass off work and do nothing. Management will let slackers be slackers and place the rest of responsibility on the few harder working employees.

After being in a car accident  outside of work I sustained an injury to an eye and my back. I was going to therapy and returned to work with a doctors not to be placed in lighter work load while I was finishing therapy. I asked if I could switch with a co-worker and work in the business center instead of the parcel center. My manager refused to accommodate me because he didn't have anyone to switch me with. His excuse was that the other team members were female and could not do heavy lifting and that no one in the center is cross trained (referring to team that has been there at least a year and more without cross training).

pros: The pay is good, if you finish early you can leave early sometimes, once work is clear they give a smoking break
cons: Work is very tiring and the shift times are awkward to get used to , can get really busy at times

review_title: FedEx is a solid company in a steady industry.
job_title: Senior Account Executive in Los Angeles, CA
pros: FedEx is a great brand to represent. Very highly regarded in the industry. You get good access to decision makers.
cons: Out of touch upper management, a very dense bureaucracy, highly centralized decision making, too slow in making necessary changes. The numerous operating companies make it difficult to get things done and create a lot of confusion for customers.

review_title: A truly great global company headquartered in the USA.
pros: FedEx offers a very dynamic and fast-paced work environment.  They take great pride in hiring the best and brightest people so that they require little direct management involvement to get the mission at hand accomplished.  There is a great deal of personal leeway granted as long as results match expectations.
cons: Stiff competition and highly specialized areas of expertise make it difficult to land desirable management jobs even if you are well qualified.

review_title: Co-workers and management were fantastic but indeed back breaking.
pros: Most employees at FedEx were friendly and management was amazing. The hub manager was always on floor, and the assistant manager had weekly meetings to ensure everyone was working together. An overall good experience.
cons: Not recommended to anyone with ANY back or joint problems as there are very heavy packages, and there are a very few counter productive employees.

review_title: Great company that takes care of their employees.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Very strong culture of putting employees first so they take good care of the customers after which profits follow so they can afford to pay for high quality employees.  IT uses the latest technologies and has strong vendor relationships for good support.  Senior management is very supportive of IT because they understand the company runs on IT.
cons: Most opportunities in IT are in Memphis, TN - especially if you want to advance in management.  Dallas, Orlando, and Colorado Springs offer good opportunities for first line managers.

job_title: Senior Account Executive in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: The training is very intense, you come into your job knowing FedEx in and out.  Flexible work schedule. Good starting salary. They put a lot of time and effort into understanding that you are an employee and not a number.  Acting as a consultant instead of a sales professional.
cons: Very limited opportunities for advancement without moving. Collaboration with different internal contacts can be difficult.

review_title: Despite the challenges, I enjoyed working there.
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Will make you physically fit.
Feels like a real job; you are needed and your role is serious.
Straight forward. Get to work, do your job and leave at the end of your shift and you're paid extra if work is extra; no BS.
cons:
3am shift made concentration in class almost impossible no matter how early I tried to sleep beforehand.
work is actually very hard and tiring and will make you tired the rest of the day.

review_title: FedEx is a great company to work for
pros: I worked in FedEx Services and the people are great and talented. It is not a high stress environment but each team member Contributes a lot.
cons: It is like a barge. It is a huge company that will keep going forward no matter how slow it is, just because of its size. It is impossible to make changes in the organization.

review_title: Not for you if you ever want to do more
job_title: Senior Pricing Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Pay is good, but don't expect much else.
cons:
With this company being a Fortune 50 company, you'd expect more from it, but don't get your hopes up.  This is the biggest employer in Memphis so they pretty much can treat their employees any way they want and we'd have to put up with it.  The Vacation and Benefits are outdated as compared to other companies of it's size.  Management is great at saying things that sound good without any follow through. All the systems are old and outdated and the one new system they have promoted as a "savior" has landed is the biggest thud in history.   The new system makes our job 5x harder because it just will not work. So we're still being told to work harder even though we have bad tools to work with. 

The sales dept has been allowed the run of the company. They treat everyone they come in contact with horribly and the department has no backbone to stand up to them.  They will consider you their personal concierge.

If you're looking for opportunities to move up. Don't join.  The opportunities here are few and very far between.  There are a bunch of people who are sitting in positions, who have been in the same position for 20 years,  and plan to retire in those same positions, blocking the way for any movement.  You have others that don't want to be here, but are waiting for another buyout to leave.  Even applying for internal positions is very political.  In some cases if you want to even be considered for the job, you have to go and talk to the manager and  kiss up to them  a little otherwise your resume won't even be called for an interview. Even if you're highly qualified.  Most areas would rather fly someone in for a job than promote from within the company.

pros: A world wide respected organization, great benefits, fair treatment by management,  great team atmosphere, loved working there.
cons: Customer Service department can be ineffective at resolving issues and then the sales team ends up being the customer service team and therefore not selling. Payroll increases are kept in check and no one really gets ahead financially; however, benefits are great. Promotions are hard to obtain even if you are a high performer.

pros:
Very Flexible in just about everything they offer, including benefits, time off and other perks.  Employee Discount shipping.  

Everyone at FedEx from the top to the bottom is committed to pursuing the purple promise, "I will make every FedEx Experience outstanding".  Its that shared pursuit that makes this a great place to work.  Everyone carries their own weight and everyone is willing to lend a helping hand.
cons: Since its such a large company, it takes a lot of time and energy to amke changes.

pros: Great people to work with....... good environment .......overall a good workplace to begin with
cons: low on yearly increments . . .. . . on the outset you see lot of opportunities....but actually there is lot of partial and minimal growth....the biggest con as far as my profile is concerned OVERTIME...you have to do it almost every week and for it least amount will be paid above all its not an option!

review_title: Any CEO that takes a 20% voluntary pay cut for his employees and the company is doing the right thing.
pros: Great benefits, medical, and company culture.  401K match, and where else can you get a Portable Pension Account?  Most places after you leave your pension is gone.  The people and management are outstanding from the front lines up to upper management.
cons: There's been a few times that negative news has not trickled down as fast as I would have liked it to.

job_title: Senior Marketing Specialist in Memphis, TN
pros: The culture of "Living PSP", which stands for People, Service, Profit, has been revived in this company over the last year. There is a great sense of ownership amongst the employees, and FedEx is Constantly finding ways to keep it self on the "Best Places to Work in America" list. The opportunity for lateral job moves within the company is almost endless, as every Development is highly encouraged. work function is represented, and professional
cons: FedEx needs to improve its salary and bonus offering in order to retain talent and remain competitive.

review_title: Ok but don't believe the hype
job_title: Package Handler Part-time in Charlotte, NC
pros: Raises, Benefits, people, Non union
cons: Fed ex wants you to kill yourself just like everyone else for a couple bucks and change. Its really physical hard work if you are not in shape you will be when your done. This is basically just labor you scan and stack boxes that's it for up to four hours straight, Pay less than others, hours vary

review_title: The company is very involved, warm and personable with it's employees as well as it's clients.
job_title: Student Support Specialist in New Castle Industrial Park, DE
pros: The company is loyal and an asset to it's employees especially with the economy climbing out of debt.  As long as you  give them your best you have a job.
cons: Patience is a must, must and a willing spirit to be successful on the job because you literally represent the company and it's reputation. If you look bad they look bad.

pros: Good work environment and everyone at FedEx is helpful. I was given an opportunity to make my project plan that hone and developed my project management skills. It was great experience working with some great people at FedEx. Interns are able to network with other manager within FedEx.
cons: In some departments at FedEx, there is very little opportunity that internship will be converted into full time employment. Intern are not allowed to work in other departments for side projects to get experience in other fields. Limited access is given to interns that might cause delay in projects.

review_title: The loyal customers made it worth the hassle of the companies heavy tracking and bureaucracy.
pros: You meet a lot of very nice people that you work with and as well as that you help get the right services done. A happy customer satisfied with your work was always a good feeling
cons: Sometimes you felt so insignificant and the raises were very minimal.   It also could be a bit like high school at times with groups of who is in and who isn't.

job_title: Program Manager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Ability to work from home and flexible sick time policy
cons: Limited vacation (2 weeks when you start).  Little room for advancement unless you have worked for the company for 20+ years.  Very top-down management environment although they say they are an Agile environment.

pros: The benefits would be the best reason to work for FedEx but those benefits are increasing in cost every year and FedEx is poised to shift that cost over to the employee. Just take a look at the latest headlines.
cons: No opportunity for advancement and no opportunities to go back to school or take sabbaticals at the lower levels

review_title: Very one-sided and unequal treatment of people in the same jobs.
pros: Th company has done a good job of selling the brand and people of the outside are impressed when they hear the FedEx name.
cons: It is all about the shareholders and many decisions are made with seemingly no regard to what the end result will be.  Very difficult company to work for.

pros:
-awesome benefits, even for pt employees
-competitive pay when compared with industry rivals
-good balance between work and private life
cons:
-upper management seems to think they are very smart, in the case of the region where I worked, they were not.

-making changes that were detrimental to our operations and the equipment we needed.

review_title: Great service , but not a Great place to work
pros: Benefits and stable position if you perform
cons: You'll work 24/7 due to lack of support and for-little pay. Company needs to realize they are not going to retain good people if they don't pay or promote them. Way too much admin time devoted to non essential things that should be handled by customer service or support staff.

job_title: Fed Ex Loader in Memphis, TN
pros: Great benefits and a great company that supports its part time employees. The part time employees in the Hub are the heart of the company and Fed Ex does everything they can to keep them employed.
cons: The greatest con to being a part time employee are the hours. The easiest job to get at Fed Ex is a material handler during the night shift. This job makes it very difficult to get college done which makes it difficult to further your career.

job_title: Customer Service Associate in Brisbane, CA
pros: Excellent group of people. Great teamwork . Opportunities to move up the ladder. Medical and dental premiums are very low. Very generous with floater days and vacation time.
cons: Very low pay. Isolated location. Not many celebrations. Most of the companies I worked for,  the boss would bring donuts or pastries. Treat us to lunch once in awhile. FedEx Trade very rarely does this.

job_title: Fed Ex Ground Package Handler in Perth Amboy, NJ
pros:
A lot of hours,average of 42 hours a week. 
Good pay, part time starts at 13, full time at 14 an hour. 
$450 plus a week (full timer) 
Promotions, if you work hard, you’ll get promoted quick.
cons:
Working all day long. Earliest start is 11am to 10pm.
Climate, of its 90 degrees outside, expect it to be 100 inside the trailer. 
Heavy lifting and fast paced. 
When there’s a lot of work, don’t expect a long break. Minimum a 20 minute break.

job_title: Manager Administrative in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Lots of flexibility.  Good benefit package.  The majority of people are genuinely nice and caring.
cons: Hard position to learn with very little training.  If located outside of Memphis HQ, there is little to no career advancement without relocation.  Pay is considerably less than other Fortune 50 employees - across all positions.

pros: There are no pros to being a driver for this company.
cons: First of all, all drivers, except for those in Connecticut, are not directly employed by Fedex, so we get no benefits at all. Second, we’re putting in anywhere from 50 to 70 hours a week, and we do not get paid for overtime hours. Third, considering the hours you have to put in, kiss your personal life goodbye. It’s literally a cycle of sleep, work, repeat. Every other courier or delivery service provides more for your time and effort.

pros:
Great Benefits
Friendly people
Global company
Work Life Balance
cons:
Culture can be "too" positive at the expense of identifying and correcting mistakes
Management can be to complacent
Salary is not competitive/in line with Major Markets

pros: fedex has pretty good job security due to the fact it is in the transportation industry and therefore will always be needed to keep the economy gooing, also the pay is good for what I do
cons: working in a call center there tends to be a lot of micro managing going on, also I work in a high volume call center where I take in over 100+ calls per day

review_title: quota equals hard work and damage rate
pros: they offer healthcare and paid vacation if you've worked there for 1000 hrs.  the pay is slightly above what other similar companies pay.
cons: all the managers care about is meeting the quota. Which I honestly believe is set by superhumans.  the managers push thru to meet the quota, and damaging the packages in the process and end up paying for some of them...and sucks for those without insurance.

review_title: good place to work for with very limited upward mobility
pros:
great company with a good business model
great benefits in terms of discounted shipping and airline discounts
culture is friendly
cons:
opportunity for growth is very limited. You will get promoted based on who and not what you know.
performance evaluation is a joke. No real reward for being a star performer.

pros: if you just really like a cold corporate environment where the bottom line is all that matters, you will love this company.
cons: cold and calculating, very impersonal, You are there for them not them for you.. If you have something that comes up and interferes with the work schedule, that is a problem.

review_title: Stable Company, but not much room to grow
pros:
You can't get fired...almost ever. 
Decent benefits and vested retirement accounts
Stable company with no foreseeable demise coming soon
cons:
Very territorial department managers
Raise and promotions are fixed at very low compensation
Positive corporate culture is just non-existent
Won't fire people who really should be let go
VERY big company, which means if your immediate manager doesn't care about you then no one does

review_title: Fired after being critically injured on the job.
pros: Stayed busy all the time. Time flew by. Never boring. Able to work outdoors.
cons: After being hurt on the job twice, one of which put me in intensive care for 4 days, returned to work after a few months. Ended up being fired probably because they felt I was a liability for them.

job_title: Senior ECO Import Agent in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Friendly environment, opportunities to move up, and many benefits (Ex: discount on cell service, shipping with FedEx, schooling, etc.).
cons: Training could be longer, but you will learn a lot in a short amount of time. Don't be afraid to ask questions once out of training. Time-off is based on a first-come first-serve request. Must travel to work even in harsh weather conditions (heavy snow storms), and work on major holidays.

pros: Great work environment with lots of freedom to make your own schedule. Managers were available when needed and I was able to shadow BSF employees.
cons: I really had no cons with the job. However, I would make sure you understand that this job requires meeting new people and knocking on doors. You have to be aggressive and not afraid of bringing in new business.

job_title: Air Craft Material Handler in Cordova, TN
pros:
I was able to pick my working hours (days or nights)
Insurance is cheap( but you never meet ur deductible to use it...its a scam.)
cons:
The pay isn't up to par compared to other operator jobs in other companies. 
They will hire felons .
They have exhausted their 'source of new-hire options' soo badly that many people operating deadly equipment are so young they don't even own or drive a car daily.(very dangerous environment)
Managers are promoted to their positions based on how long they have been with the company, not their ability to be effective.

pros: This company has great minds at the very top that are responsible for the direction of the company.  This being said, Frontline, operational managers are terrible... they have no operational awareness, are often promoted due to seniority (not ability), and have a work ethic honed by years of doing the bare minimum possible.
cons: Lower level management are quite unprepared and unable to preform their duties.

job_title: Sales Consultant in The Woodlands, TX
pros: The pay , the hours
cons: Don’t work here if you are pregnant or plan on being they don’t value their employees at all , not helpful with maternity leaves , will work you even when you aren’t able to health wise they don’t care . When they don’t need you they dispose of you. Very unfair and forbid if you have harassment on the job they don’t take it seriously.

review_title: Know what you’re getting yourself into
pros: Benefits and good starting wage
cons: Understaffed centers, high stress, big workloads

review_title: Great environment, stagnant jobs and pay
job_title: Senior Import Coordinator in Tonawanda, NY
pros: Awesome environment, very relaxed, pretty much your own boss, great customers, good 1st level management, benefits, vacation time
cons: Raises are horrible, positions become stagnant, upper level management are clueless, new hires with zero experience get paid more than 10+ year employees, upper management sees no issue with this “you shouldn’t know what other people make”

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Seattle, WA
pros: The people are amazing to work with. It’s a very inclusive company and managers are kind while still being professional. Not to mention the work is honestly pretty fun, during holiday season we have friendly work competitions and gifts. And some days they even provide food and drinks!
cons: Communication is key and some people can’t! Certain employees can be challenging to work with, there’s a lack of clear communication and it can create issues down the production line.

review_title: Fedex is the worst company to work for, period.
pros: Get tuition reimbursment for college (to move on to better things)
cons: Where shall I start? You are extremely overworked and underpaid. There is favoritism. Managers only care about their numbers. Fedex continues to take away benefits yet wants you to do more and more. Advancement only happens if you kiss you know what. I can go on and on but there isn't enough time in the day....

pros: Pay, that is really about it, benefits are ok but were better when it was American Freightways and no cost for employee benefits.
cons:
Management  says they want input, they really don't
Co-workers will stab you in the back given half a chance.
Excessive cost for health and other coverage unless you want high deductibles

review_title: Co. needs to step up with pay increases
job_title: Senior Strategic Marketing Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros:
Tuition reimbursment
Opportunity to change jobs and / or careers within the company
HQ in a city with low cost of living
cons:
Salary increases very limited for those that prefer to remain in non-managment positions.
No apparent effort by management to retain effective employees (counter offers, vacation days, etc.)
Very bureaucratic - too much red tape in processes

review_title: It is a good company to work for
job_title: Material Handler in Grand Forks, ND
pros: FedEx paid a good and competitive salary, the benefit are one of the best I have encountered. It is definitely a place I will recommend others to work at.
cons: Our schedule depend on the weather; because the jet cannot land or take off during bad weather in the winter, we'll have to wait for hours sometimes. This shift our starting and ending time

job_title: Cross Border E-Commerce Agent in Memphis, TN
pros: Flexibility, ability to move do various parts of the company and country.  Great people to work around and there is an ability to go places professionally that one normally wouldn't have an opportunity to otherwise.
cons: The shifts can be cumbersome and one often feels exhausted.  Sometimes there can be a lot of favoritism and nepotism.

review_title: Very good got fired 2 times but pretty sure if i were to apply again they would hire me in a heart beat.
pros: Great pay. If you in college this might be a great part time. Might be a lil too much for females. People is great.
cons: heavy work. You will come out dirty as hell. Not suitable for a girly girl.

pros: Chance for advancement.  They believe in hiring from within.  If you survive.
cons: Heavy packages come through constantly.  Maneuvering them from table to truck not easy.  Keeping up your hourly rate for hour after hour not easy because of all the heavies, tight maneuver space and heat.  Hope you were born bigger than average.

pros:
Decent health benefits (used to be better)
Pension 
401k
Vacation time
Holiday pay (all holidays are worked except for Christmas Day and New Year's Day)
cons:
Limited opportunities to move up 
Emphasis there is put on quanity of work done and not quality
Favoritism and too many cliques
Lots of mandatory overtime
Employees are scared to say anything for fear of retaliation
High turnover rate due to the high-stress environment

review_title: Great for supplementary income if you're physically up for it
pros: Wages are nice. Hours are very early, which leaves the rest of the day. Excellent benefits if you're a student.
cons: Hours are early. Can be very physically demanding depending on the season (e.g. holidays). Buildings were unheated/uncooled, so it can be pretty brutal depending on the season.

pros: You're out of the building all day, which means nobody breathing down your neck. You set your own pace (generally speaking) and, sometimes, get to work in some pretty beautiful places.
cons: Horrid management; the drivers are "contracted" employees, which means you follow all of the rules, but receive none of the benefits from the actual corporation. Most drivers receive no PTO, Insurance, nor 401K, and there is really no room for "career growth". Also, we're mostly all on Salary, so there is no set schedule to speak of.

pros: They pay you money, even though its not much. Good benefits after 1000 hours. Great automation and innovations in place by existing staff and plenty of opportunities for improvement.
cons: Lack of oversight, ancient management practices, horrible communication, unable to develop lower management and employees, high turn over rate, lack of interdepartmental communication, hr is confusing about your actual hours during orientation, and no breaks.

review_title: I believe this company is an amazing company to work for. You are never bored and are always pushed to do better!
job_title: Senior Service Agent in La Crosse, WI
pros: Great benefits! I am never bored, love my job, and get great tuition reimbursement for my schooling.
cons: Very fast paced and challenging. If you aren't going hard worker and willing to get a little dirty, then this is not the job for you!

pros: If your looking to spend some time and get some experience this place is fine for people with little or no ambition. the structure might come across as a multinational but it is a sole proprietorship in many ways.
cons: Bad Paymasters, no training or visible career growth.  It's a place where you can spend some time to search for better jobs. Staying long term here can be detrimental to your career

review_title: Great company overall - limited career advancement opportunities in certain areas
pros: Stability, well-known brand, strong culture and values, great benefits
cons: Growth opportunities are limited in certain areas.  If you desire to change positions within the company often to stay innovative and learn new skills, you will probably be disappointed.  Competition is fierce and career path programs seem to only benefit certain roles.

review_title: Was fired after I called that I couldn’t make it to a class
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Memphis, TN
pros: I loved the job great company good pay great people great benefits just a fun place to work
cons: I got fired after I called and said I wouldn’t be able to make a tug class the manager got fired right after I got fired I don’t know why.

pros: From the perspective of a financial analyst who worked most recently at the World Head Quarters, managers were vary fair & balanced.
cons: The outfit is so big that it can be very difficult for talented employees to be recognized, and move-up the corporate food chain.

review_title: Learn alot about the structure and the importance of chain of command in business
pros: It is a good place work if you are a team player.. there training is top notch. and they have great benefits and perks.
cons: the company promotes mainly through seniority.. you have to get used to policy changes on the regular and and if you are looking to get into management its alot of politics involved more than anything..

review_title: Solid pay and benefits; middling management; work-life balance out of balance
job_title: Project Manager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Good pay and benefits; stable (layoffs are rare); many experienced and knowledgeable coworkers
cons: Upper management places burden of achieving work-life balance entirely on the employees, while first-line managers assign excessive hours, weekend work, and/or shift duty to employees; more than a few managers have a supercilious bearing; employees have no power over their working conditions.

pros: Most people have a great attitude and really want to work to make this company great.
cons: The company keeps changing philosophies and just when you get used to following one way of doing things, it all changes.  A lot of people get promoted without deserving it and those who do deserve it get passed over.  Managers are not qualified for their positions, going through mentoring and training after they have the position and in the meantime they have messed things up and blame their direct reports for their mistakes.

pros: Good access to resources, due to the size of the company. Positive brand image. General commitment to core values. The opportunities for community service and the support the company provides after natural disasters help to make the work meaningful.
cons: Career progression is political, rather than skill or merit-based. Overall too confident about its position. Bureaucracy slows decisions; Legal makes the final call, rather than providing counsel. Departure in later years from the core values - but trying to get to basics.

job_title: Dock Worker Full Time in Chicago Heights, IL
pros: Pay/benefits was good and that's the only reason anyone is there. My trainer told me when I started there "we all hate our jobs but the pay is good so we're still here"
cons: Management is overworked and therefore treats their workers like trash, don't expect to ever be recognized for anything except your mistakes. They fired me for a policy that was "zero-tolerance" that I had never heard of after working there for 3 years. They can change the policies as they go.

review_title: Great place to tow the line and become irrelevant.
job_title: User Experience Manager in Moon Township, PA
pros: Technology stack is coming up with the times. People are generally friendly. On-site cafeteria.
cons: Weak management that protects each other. Pay is good if you never get out and realize IT salaries are 30% higher anywhere else. I was offered 73k to convert from a contract making 109k. I got the Kool aide speech about longevity and went to work for an insurance company for $151,000.

job_title: Senior Pricing Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Pay is good for the market area. Benefits used to be better, but are still okay. Nice people. Bonuses are pretty good.
cons: Opportunities of advancement are very few. Managers and older employees will sit in positions for 20-30 years making it difficult for anyone else to move up. For such a huge company you would expect more perks.

pros: I am glad working in the FedEx Corporate. The work-life balance is pretty good. There are a lot of learning and growth opportunities. It has a good caring culture, very nice teammates, and a clear career path.
cons: I get mad on the bureaucracy, if you have any new ideas, you need to report to your boss, and he or she needs to report to his or her boss, and the boss's boss report up again. When you get approval from the highest level, your idea might loose the value.

pros: Very employee friendly, great culture. Employees are top-notch in their field. Competitive but friendly culture at the same time.
cons:
Since very few people leave, promotions are very few. For any positions that open, there are sometimes 20+ internal candidates for same position. This is inspite of the 'promote from within' policy that is followed for manager positions and above. 
Management of some of the larger projects can be done much better

review_title: FedEx is the size of a small country so has a bit of everything
pros: Truly embrace diversity. Never have to worry about senior executives doing something unethical or them blowing your pension. They actually do try to provide work life balance unlike some other corporations.
cons: Ginormous bureaucratic organization that takes forever to execute initiatives due to siloed approaches and focus on process instead of results.

pros:
Great Company that practices P-S-P, People, Service Profit equally.  Global Fortune 500 company with immediate name recognition and a very good reputation.  

Strong leadership that has a clear vision of the future.

A great deal of autonomy and decision making ability.
cons:
From a HR standpoint a great deal of hourly employees to support and very policy driven because of the highly regulatory environment of the operation.  

A little behind the times from an internal technology standpoint.

review_title: Success is not a destination, but a journey! FedEx Ground has helped me pave a clear path on my journey to success.
pros: Competitive compensation, bonuses, tuition reimbursement, medical insurance, great stock options, Aggressive 401K plans, very diverse work environment.
cons: Long hours for salaried management.

review_title: A great environment with multiple opportunities to grow
pros:
They focus on individual development and recognition
Great team working environment.  Wonderful cross departmental collaboration
Benefits are first rate
Compensation on par with other major companies.  Love the yearly bonus!
cons:
Some management is stuck in micromanagement and strangle creativity.
HR does not really represent the employee.  They protect the interest of management.
Some employees were treated harshly when mistakes were made

job_title: World Wide Account Manager in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Flexible Hours, Good People, Interesting and Challenging Work, Fair Management
cons: Under market in pay scales (utilize wide, broad base pay bands that can result in massive differences in pay within the same job code), extremely difficult to move into management roles, and behind on diversity.

pros: Benefits are great. Training is provided through your career. The company is very competitive. You don't have to worry about losing your job due to outsourcing. The company grows year over year.
cons: The work is extremely demanding, very physical. Conditions are subject to the weather. You have to schedule all your vacation at the beginning of the year. The peak season is demanding.

pros: stand for quality, speed, customer focus, efficiency, thinking outside of the box, employee empowerment, leadership excellence, flat organization
cons:
Very lean organization. Great in that you learn a lot and have a broad scope of responsibility but one can burn out if one is not careful.
The organization was starting to put more distance between upper management and the employee voice... becoming too typical of other organizations. Unfortunately, this can erode their People First philosophy.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Olive Branch, MS
pros:
Decent pay
Mostly steady and consistent hours
Friendly environment
cons: Sort managers have days where they care more about numbers than the well-being of their employees.

job_title: Agency Team Leader in Denver, CO
pros: Benefits are great, pay is good. Paid vacation and sick time is standardized to start at 2 weeks paid vacation, 6 floating holidays, and 80 hours of sick time, and gain more the longer you work there. Annual raises.
cons:
You don't get many holidays off besides the major ones.
People can be a bit difficult to deal with internally, but you get through it.
Takes FOREVER to actually get you through the interview process and started working there.
Just decreased their annual raise amounts to 2%.

review_title: Strong Senior Management, strong and well run company, put employees 1st....career advancement limited
pros: Great experience, great brand name.  Strong financially to withstand economic downturn which is big plus.  People first philosphy is evident.
cons: Career opportunities are limited unless you network intensively.  Advancement not always offered to best qualified but to "who you know".

review_title: It's not run by people its run by performance numbers and goals
pros: A very professional corporation. Good benefits. Everyone is treated equally.
cons: Couriers are constantly made to raise their performance goals.This is partly due to a decline in business. Managers are forced to  do this because their goals are being constantly raised.  At the end of the day it's all about the numbers. that's all anybody cares about.

review_title: Great people and place, just wrong time
pros: Everyone there in/out of audit were great.  I loved the work environment.
cons: After almost 6 years my salary was noty much higher when I started (mostly bc of economy) and opportunities seemed to have dried up.  Couldn't survive on that amount with a family and play the waiting game.

review_title: Strong Company, Great Culture, Will learn a lot!
pros: Work-Life Balance is great. Training is good, and continual. Flex time is available at most sales office locations. Strong Company with a great reputation in the industry,
cons: Sales is moving towards more of a customer service role. The control over your own territory is being removed from the sales professional.

review_title: I was not a fit.... at all
pros: Fed Ex is a Big company.  There is Job security there and they seem to invest in their leaders to prepare them for the future.
cons: Low Pay for frontline managers.  Culture of lack of respect for the package handlers.  As a manager, I was very uncomfortable at times.

job_title: Sales Executive, Market Development in Wallingford, CT
pros: Good benefits. Local territories that results in being home nights and weekend.
cons: Gross over management and hand-holding.  Treats seasoned sales professionals like children. Must wear a full suit and tie every day, which is over-dressing customer by about 4-to-1.  Endless internal paperwork, exercises, etc. Goals are set by automation and salespeople are typically thrown into a ditch when quotas are re-set, then beaten daily to climb out.

review_title: good company if your a hourly employee not as a operations manager these days.
pros: good second job for hourly employees with benefits
cons:
No support to managers
increasing demands require longer hours to get job done
pay takes to long to increase yearly for outstanding performance
Really bad second and third level management in northern california

review_title: This is a great company to work for. A lot of opportunities and FedEx encourages the employees to grow their career
pros: The salary and package are great. Work life balance, peaceful environment, nice people working around here. It is just like a huge and warm family
cons: Management changed too frequently in the recent years which made employees a little bit hard to follow and get used to.

review_title: Working at Fed Ex Ground as a package handler
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Englewood, CO
pros: There are no customers in the warehouse so you dont have to deal with anybody but your fellow coworkers. Also, it is pretty much a paid workout and wS ill get you into shape.
cons: There is a decent amount of heavy lifting and you will be very sore. The warehouse is dirty so your clothes will get dirty and you will get black dirt in your nose when you clean it out after work.

job_title: Fed Ex Ground Package Handler in Springfield, MO
pros: Great work atmosphere. Coworkers are helpful and it is a team environment. Good, physical workout, fast paced. Safety is first priority.
cons: Early morning shifts, as early as 3:45 to as late as 4:15. A struggle to get 20 hours a week.

review_title: Overall Decent, if you're in need
pros: Rigid corporation (could also be a negative). Experienced staff, but not a lot of them at a location. Some ability to bounce around between locations.
cons: Retail Orientated, tight deadlines, little reward for work. Scheduling is tough, and shifts are not able to be covered be already busy coworkers.

pros: After 30 days your pay rate go up and then every 3 months after that you get a raise.
cons: This job is not for a female. Its very physical wear and tear on your body. I was injured so many times. The sad thing is the men are the laziest and won't help even if your struggling.

pros: nice environment to work in. nice people. air conditioned and climate controlled. relaxed setting. devices to repair vary. from getac laptops to rf scanners.
cons: very tough to become full time. selective and pretend interviews. great for steady experience. recommended for novice to seasoned experienced workers but should always keep eyes open to advance. do not get comfortable

job_title: GRC PROGRAM, Senior PROJECT MANAGER in Dallas, TX
pros: For those at FedEx Services who have survived Project Falcon, a multi--billion dollar company initiative to reduce company headcount, life is reasonably stable.
cons: If you are not in Memphis, professional development opportunities are limited. Dallas presence is being eliminated through organic attrition. When one manager leaves in Dallas, another is hired in Memphis.

review_title: Its time to start trimming the fat and go on a diet fueled by meritocracy
pros: Work Life balance and no lay-off policy
cons: It feels you are working for the Federal Government not Federal Express

review_title: Its time to start trimming the fat and go on a diet fueled by meritocracy
pros: Work Life balance and no lay-off policy
cons: It feels you are working for the Federal Government not Federal Express

pros: The benefits are great far as for medical and dental and what not, plus the flight benefits are good as well
cons: Theres no sympathy to the employee when things permit.. more than likely a individual local management situation.. also you get 40 hours of paid sick time.. but cant use it as you feel.. use to much and you will be written up.. pointless policy

pros: It's a job you can leave at work when you go home.  It's easy to learn, anyone can be hired as a package handler with no experience.  You will make a decent wage for the type of work it is.
cons: I heard horror stories about people not being able to get worker's compensation when they were injured on the job.

review_title: No advancement opportunities and lack of pay
pros: Tuition reimbursement, good insurance, onsite cafeteria, and clean bathrooms.
cons: Favoritism abounds.  Awards are raises often given to favorites vs. hard workers.  Recently layoff proved that seniority and hard work do not count.  Hard work not always rewarded/appreciated if you have the wrong manager.

review_title: FedEx is a great place to work
pros: The pay and benefits are great at FedEx. The employees are treated as the heart of the company and that is the way it should be.
cons: The handler position is hard labor. It takes hard work and a motivated person to complete this job correctly. Must know that it will not be a cake walk.

job_title: Programmer Analyst Intern in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great company to Intern with. Intern Program is well put together. Software Development Teams are very knowledgeable and helpful. Interns are given Actual Important Software Projects to work on/complete. FedEx Services defiantly looks to hire their Interns first, for full-time employment (after college graduation). Everyone is very nice. Corporate Campus included Basketball courts, Volleyball Courts, and a Work Out Gym.
cons: There really are no cons from my experience. Interns were even allowed to take unpaid vacation days if they wanted to.

review_title: insight on one of America's largest employer
pros: Good benefits which are offered to all employees (full & part time). great opportunity for advancement or relocation. Decent pay
cons: very resistant to change, strong 'us vs them' mentality, IT standards are over a decade behind current industry norms, managers are encouraged to look the other way when problems are reported, management priority is not to upset corporate for fear of possible impact on career.

review_title: Great Company, good benefits, lots of changes
pros: The benefits are good, the company has a great reputation, the values are there. Currently undergoing alot of work force changes.
cons: The perks that were once available are not anymore.  Sometimes it feels that the company is beginning to forget the individuals and it is all about the bottom line.  The benenfits are declining and are not as good as they once were.

job_title: Business Systems Tester in Memphis, TN
pros: Still one of the best employers in Memphis. Pay is not the greatest. Currently have a manager that understands work/life balance. Overall glad I am working here.
cons: Not much room for advancement. Hiring managers do not want to recognize your skills and talents that you have successfully proven at other companies.

pros: The pay is good, support is amazing.  Peo Pl let are always willing to step up to help in any way.
cons: Be ready to work insane hours.  And be ready to listen to every complaint possible.  And be ready to barely see your family.

pros:
great benefits!

Overall the actual job is not difficult if you're willing to work hard and can actually lift the 75lbs the say the require.
cons:
hours are minimal.. Part time and your lucky to get 20hrs a week during most of the year, the exception in the month of December.

no flexibility in the schedule. 

both of these tend to cause a high turn over rate so there for your short staffed A LOT.

pros: Fun job I loved ripping around the city delivering and talking to customers. Lots of independence, made a fair hourly rate. Supportive of you are ambitious and would like to grow in the company. Great diversity.
cons: Not many opportunities to get more hours. Very corporate/mega international lip service management style. Can feel personally limiting at times.

pros:
Job retention is semi stable. 
Benefits are OK. 
Flexible work schedules. 
co-workers look out for each other.
Facilities are usually decent.
cons: Management has no idea of what direction they are going. It seems most job time is spent figuring out ways to justify your job.....  Productivity is very low.  Management could care less if things are done right.

pros: Lots of opportunity, tuition reimbursement, broad selection of lateral and promotion movement availability, excellent people-centered culture, only the best managers, competitive salary and benefits, job security.
cons: There is very little downside that I can articulate to working with FedEx. I have been with the company since I was 18 years old (am now 33), and they have continued to provide opportunity to growth and development, as well as support to my pursuit of higher education.

review_title: Working at FedEx Express EMEA is not pleasant.
pros:
-No lay-offs at FedEx Express EMEA.
-Good medical insurance.
-2,500 euro/year tuition reimbursement
cons:
-Awful location for European headquarters (offices in Brussels airport cargo area with mediocre public transport).
-Managers to remain in the same position for 10, 15, 20+ yrs without receiving training on how to manage people.
-Inexistent/very slow career progression: only possible if you have the same personality as your boss and act as his puppet.
-Favoritism within the team.
-Being honest during annual feedback survey is used against you.
-Company rarely allows moving from one team/department to another: mainly goes for hiring external candidates... so most people remain stuck in the same team for years. 
-Boring atmosphere.

pros: Dealing with customers and the holidays. I love making people smile.
cons: Not very military friendly. I gave a notice 150 days out from my deployment that I had to leave and was fired 30 days before I left for reasons unknown.

job_title: City Driver/Sales Associate in Longview, TX
pros: Working for Fedex as a whole was a great experience. The pay was more than fair and the benefits were great. Seniority plays a big part which I liked and for the most part the people were great.
cons: The down side was trying to get time off for family events because not having a set schedule you never really knew what time you would be off. My advice is use HR that's what they are thee for.

review_title: Not worth the time - inside sales
job_title: Inside Sales Account Executive in Dallas, TX
pros: co-workers are great. That is all.
cons: Look for sales? This is not the place for you. 95% customer service. The internal ''sales'' reports are never up to date. Monthly compensation have zero relation to the amount of additional business you bring to FedEx. Zero promotional opportunities in DFW if you want to stay in "sales".

review_title: Company Too HR detailed and not enough Employee relations
job_title: Senior Freight Claims Representative in Harrison, AR
pros: Company was great to work for and had excellent benefits. I thought they really cared until I came to realization that I'm just another number.
cons: Too many policies to follow and not enough comradery or teamwork. They are very HR oriented which means they do every single thing by the book with no compassion toward individuals and their specific circumstances

review_title: Lots of potential.  Check back in a few years.
pros:
- Lots of potential in company - ready to grow when they get decent leadership in place.  
- If you're able to move to other companies within FedEx, seniority transfers.
- Nice PTO plan.
- Decent benefits.
cons:
- Not treated like part of FedEx, so the reputation of FedEx isn't applicable to FedEx Trade Networks.  
- Lack of growth and opportunity.
- Internal promotions discouraged and limited by policy.
- Low salaries compared to other companies within FedEx family.
- Lack of leadership.

review_title: Worst Place Ever FedEx Trade Networks
pros: Decent Benefits and Paid time off.
cons: Terrible management, Do not care about their employees what so ever. Their is not work/life balance because you never know when you are going to be getting off work. Over time is through the roof and turnover is at an all time high because everyone hates their life that works here. Atmosphere is awful with middle management having just as bad attitudes as the lady in charge.
