pros: Always changing to stay ahead and always looking to expand and buy other companies to compliment all Opcos.
cons: Salaried employees have no work life balance. Salespeople do not get vacation. If you choose to take days off, the time is not adjusted and you have to make up the  face to face calls.

pros: Excellent pay and benefits.  Very active training organization.
cons: Constant stress related to deadlines and making budget monthly.

review_title: Wonderful place to work and learn new skills!
pros: They help pay for up to $3,000 in school tuition. Also, there are many opportunities to move up within the company.
cons: Upper management isn't always around, and there are may times where workers are left on their own to handle situations.

pros: NONE, Unless you're desperate for a job.
cons: Mandatory overtime, no allowance for working large and complicated files. Poor raises... They put me in 3 specialty groups by the time I'd been there 6 months. There was only 1 other person that did all that I did and he had been there 6 years.

review_title: Created the express market but challenged in the mid-ranks of employees and management
pros: Good service, intentionally working on continuous improvement and quality, the brand is powerful.  Being one of two national providers has its merit
cons: Bureaucracy and excessive middle management have slowed innovation.  While there are smart people everywhere, the results are not as good as they should be.

review_title: Great company. loving ppl,and flexible but needed a pay raise.
pros:
The company is full of ppl who are caring and considerate
Family environment
Great Benefits
Management is very understanding
Great work life balance and flexible
Pay raise and bonus for everyone as long as company meets objectives
cons:
In a down market opportunities dried up and pay raises were cut as well as salary
Wanted more opportunities as job was not too diffucult or challenging
Hard to move around than previously thought

pros: Great Benefits, co-workers were amazing. The mix of technology and customer service were the perfect blend to make all of our customers happy.
cons: The amount of work you have to do when covering for another is hard to provide what we promise.

pros: Working on or around aircraft was awesome. MD-10 & MD-11, Airbus, small engine, 727. Great group of men and woman, camaraderie was great, everyone looked out for each other slightly dangerous job, but loved every minute; who doesn't love the smell of jet fuel. lol
cons: Worked early hours, but it is expected and you get used to it. Working conditions, you know the saying rain, hail, sleet or snow the mail has to go. The only time we stopped production due to lightening.

pros: Benefits are great. I loved being able to utilize the college reimbursement program while I was in school. The team I was placed with there was very well managed. Bonuses.
cons: Work-Life Balance is off when working grave yard shift. Hard to work your way up outside from Handler position. Most of hire up  positions work solely by seniority.

pros: This company pays a good salary for hard work. The benefits are very good. Great health care and incentives. Freedom on the route.
cons: If you have a family, you may rethink this job. You will work very long hours, especially around the holidays. You are required to work in in climate weather.

pros: Because England is my dream country and I love to work there. I want to learn some more.
cons: Benefits of working. Working, whether paid or unpaid, is good for our health and wellbeing. It contributes to our happiness, helps us to build confidence and self-esteem, and rewards us financially. Because of these benefits, it is important to return to work as soon as possible after an illness or injur

pros: It's affordable for management and full time employees.
cons: They're in such chaos their is no time to explain benefits and for those who ever never had insurance you're made to feel inferior. Not enough time to opt out of insurance and it's completely unaffordable if you have kids and this is the only house income you have. I've searched for days on how to get to the page to opt out of insurance without finding anything. Everytime I get to work their is such chaos I forget to even ask for help. When I do management says come back later and we will go over it. Then we both forget.

pros: Working in FedEx was interesting. You will meet any kind of people with different attitudes towards you. What’s challenging? Is when you change their bad mood into moderate to great.
cons: In any unusual situation can be divert to something that you want to be.

review_title: Certainly is a best place to work!!
job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: FedEx is an excellent company that REALLY does care about their employees. If you apply yourself there are plenty of career opportunities available and plenty of professional development opportunities as well. Work/life balance is encouraged and supported by all levels of management. The people I work with are professional, caring and always work to get the job done right.
cons: It is a large company and does have a lot of complexity.

review_title: Not what it used to be!!
job_title: Ramp Agent in New Orleans, LA
pros: You can wear a uniform and not have to worry about what to wear each day.  Also, uniforms created unity amongst coworkers.  It really does!  Only place you will truly work with others as a united team.
cons: Weak management, reluctant to make decisions, and frequently make unfair decisions in one's work group.  If you get injured, it will be held against you.  Management pushes you too much to not disclosed injuries.  No movement up due to seniority rules.

job_title: Manager/Senior Manager Assist V in Philadelphia, PA
pros: There is a wide range of responsibilities that allow for professional growth within the company.  Management genuinely cares about the success of their employees, and gives you the tools to complete the job.
cons: The cons of working with FedEx are that there is CONSTANT change, and mediocre salaries.  It can be a challenging company to work for due to the high demand, but also rewarding to those that work hard.

review_title: No work/life balance below Center Manager
pros: The front line team members made going to work a little easier.
cons: No development strategy in place.  Stores are so short staffed that training is very tough to accomplish.

pros: The Salary, Benifit, environment and performance pay is really attractive. I'd say I could grow old here. I admire how the company value and supports it people. Somehow, you have a lot of room to grow and progress here.
cons: Depending on your job description, but for me I guess work-life balance is definitely a problem send my job needs most of my time to work, and less time to be with my family

review_title: Good job if you don't mind hard work
pros:
Good starting pay
Relaxed dress code
Mostly good people to work with
Paid weekly
Great hours
Athletic trainer on site
Weekends off
cons:
Hub isn't climate controlled (you'll sweat your face off in the summer)

Breaks aren't always the same (anywhere from 20 min to an hour, depends on the day.)

Hard work. 

Minor cuts and bruises. 

Company doesn't really train people, they just throw you in and hope for the best.

review_title: Overall, great company, top leadership terrific.
pros: Brand name recognition, high caliber past sales history of FedEx Express.
cons: Dilution of general business acumen in the sales force ranks.

pros:
-Early morning shift allows for more daytime available for school or other jobs
-Great pay for a student
-Multiple shifts and different facilities around the country
-The quicker you learn, the better you will be
cons:
-May experience sleep deprivation until you find a good balance
-Electronic issues can cause a great deal of stress
-For people banking on seniority as an automatic job advancement, don't, if you work hard and learn, there will be opportunities for you

review_title: Company that has a flexible and ever changing philosophy that they call PSP
pros: Working for a BRAND name Corporation makes you proud.  There are a lot of long term employees that can speak to the good ole days.
cons: Upper Management is the  best with smoke and mirrors.  Pay and benefits and average as compared to what is expected.  FedEx makes you feel as if you are well paid but they are comparing apples to oranges when they compare what is expected.

job_title: Inside Sales Account Executive in Memphis, TN
pros: Great company to work for! Management is great & wants to see you succeed. Plenty of opportunities for advancement. Great training programs and work life balance. Very enjoyable work environment. Competitive pay & great benefits!
cons: There are not many cons with this position - work can be repetitive at times and some processes are too complicated, but all in all ... not a big deal!

pros: Decent benefits and good customers.
cons: Poor upper management, poor hiring practices and employee standsrds, poor customer reliability, unnecessary policies got in the way of doing the job, employees have no voice and poor monetary incentives are just some of the problems, imbalance in fair treatment of employees.

pros:
Mostly set pt schedule to go with a FT job. 
Fast Paced Environment. 
Management was appreciative of work done. 
Had meeting before day started.
cons:
Very early mornings. 
Physically demanding. 
High turnover. Hard to keep good people.

pros: Fast paced, the work days go by very fast. Working outdoors and wearing shorts everyday, even during the winter time.
cons: The ops managers are never on the same page. When in doubt, listen to your direct manager. The pay scale is totally off. Chances are if you've been at the company for 5-10 yrs, you are not making much more than a brand new employee

pros: I loved that it was not an stationary position able  to move around and enjoy the outdoors, no one looking over your shoulders not that you can see anyway. It's a fast pace job and you have to bring you A game.
cons: Working in the snow and you stay out there until your done. I did not like walking around in the dark with a flashlight attached to my head in the middle of the night.

pros: Job security, great pay, best work/life balance and A lot of PTO
cons: IT - a lot of changes to internal systems for sales and doesn't seem to enhance the life of AEs.  Sales has plumeted and doesn't recognized it has anything to do with all the IT changes that are HORRIBLE!!!

pros: Get to work with the latest technologies, good heath care plan, the culture supports a Living (PSP) or People, Service, Profit mentality.
cons: As with most large organizations sometimes you can "feel" like a number.  It is important to move around on a regular basis taking on different responsibilities to keep everything fresh

job_title: Material Handler in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The pros about working at Federal Express was the ability to enjoy all the perks of working on airport grounds. The Medical, Vision, and Dental benefit were also a plus.
cons: The cons of working for Federal Express was the waiting process of wanting to transfer within the company.

job_title: Customer Service Representative  in Boston, MA
pros: they have never had a layoff in their history. the are a good solid reputable company to work for.  my managers have all been great and fair. the review process is totally fair and it is not possible for any favoritism.  i feel that i am given free reign to be the best that i can and dont have to depend on a managers opinion for my review score.
cons: the job is very complicated. and stressful. the criteria is hard to meet

review_title: Good work/life balance, lack of career development planning/advancement opportunities
job_title: Senior Marketing Analyst  in Memphis, TN
pros:
Work / life balance is a priority -- schedules are pretty flexible.
Heavy IT focus -- thus data is plentiful and well-organized.
cons: Culture of mediocrity within the Marketing division.  Most everyone gets an Average rating, poor performers are not reprimanded, top performers are not always recognized.

review_title: It's a nice place to start your career
pros: Industry will always be around.  Benifits are pretty good.  You will meet and work with a lot of interesting people.
cons: FedEx has only one competiter, UPS, and they know it.  Commisions for salespeople keep going down every year because management knows they do not have to pay out much to be successful.

review_title: My experience has been satisfactory but limited professional and career growth unless you are willing to relocate.
pros: FedEx is a very well run company. I have tremendous respect for Fred Smith and his senior leadership. I am happy that FedEx has managed to stay to competative during down turn in our economy.
cons: I prefer not to work in a cubicle all day. It is difficult to get a field position in this market so it is encouraged to relocate in order to advance within the organization.

job_title: Senior Strategic Marketing Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: FedEx cares for it's people, is investing in maintaining a healthy/positive culture, and provides good job stability (almost never lays off people - reduction in force is typically voluntary). Work life balance is great. Management is very supportive. Employees usually have a great deal of flexibility (although it varies by team.) Strong leadership team. Great product.
cons: Few promotional opportunities, mature industry (specially in the US),  top performers have to wait long time to benefit from their efforts.

pros: Top brand company; visible and respected executives; improved growth; mostly personable colleagues; first-name basis with most workers (with rare exception)
cons: work/life balance is often touch to achieve; highly political; examples of favoritism and inconsistent policies; blatant hierarchy; very little discipline/penalties for low-contributing teammates; complacency and "I'll just do enough to get by" mentality of some colleagues who realize the low-likelihood of termination

pros: Benefits are a plus and good for what others have to offer. Some management is good. Work a lot of hours if salary.
cons: Strict on overtime. Management is spotty some are good and look out for their people others are only concerned about their own advancement. Not really room for growth. Pay should be reevaluated.

pros: The best parts about the job is that I start at least a.m. and that its only a four to five hour work shift that pays well and then I have the day to myself for other tasks, other opportunities lie within working the night shift for extra hours.
cons: if you work at the night shift then you really don't have much times for a night life. Other sides it can become a bit overwhelming if you let the stress get to you.

review_title: Safety,proper load/unload,monitor metrics,timely dispatch,engagement,Recognition, Etime,data entry,accountability
pros: Opportunity for advancement within 2yrs or less. Great benefits 401k, very engaged weekly staff meetings, Rewards &  Recognition.
cons: Work life balance, Training,

review_title: Safety,proper load/unload,monitor metrics,timely dispatch,engagement,Recognition, Etime,data entry,accountability
pros: Opportunity for advancement within 2yrs or less. Great benefits 401k, very engaged weekly staff meetings, Rewards &  Recognition.
cons: Work life balance, Training,

pros: Strong leadership, Service Driven and great employee benefits.  Job security due to lack of layoffs.  Advancement opportunities are unlimited if you're willing to work at the Headquarters location.
cons: Large company issues such as it's hard to move quickly on decisions and slow to implement new processes due to complex global business model

pros: Since the day i was called to come in for an interview to where i am today working for FedEx. I really enjoy my job.  Plus the company rewards their employees. Really great company to work for.
cons: The run around on customers who deal with customers service and the printing centers. Information can be misleading the wrong intention of our company.

pros:
Good environment 
Good Pay
One of the few companies still giving pension
cons:
You are not promoted for a great job it's who you know
Management gossips 
FedEx limits growth if you are not a favorite

review_title: If you just want a job...this will work..if you want to feel like you make a dif..forget it.. too much old guard still..
job_title: Senior Technical Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Great Company in General and great benifits
cons: Hard to get promoted... or stupid decisions, promoting people becouse they have been here since the start of time not becoust the have anything to contribute other than more of the same.

review_title: FedEx is an excellent company to work with because it recognises that its employees are key to it's success.
pros:
Fortune 100 Company
The company has exceptional visionary leadership
The company values and rewards it's people
The company has a strong financial position
Multiple operating companies that offer challenging opportunities
The company has multiple ocations across the country
In times of crisis the company takes care of it's people
cons:
Complex business model that takes a new comer awhile to learn
Newbies have to earn the respect of their peers because they are considered outsiders

review_title: Best place to work in Memphis, TN
pros: FedEx offers extremely competitive salaries and benefits.  Funding and resources are allocated sufficiently to meet the needs of critical projects.
cons: Politics and personal agendas can get in the way of progress at times.  There are not many promotional opportunities, especially for management and above.  Some areas have to pull the weight for others.

review_title: ok but you have to be a favorite to get promoted
pros: money , hours , weekends off , decent pay , starts off at 10.25 and up with exp. inside track to post office
cons: you get treated like crap if you dnt hit goa your getting screamed atl senoir mangment will write you up for every little thing

review_title: Great place to work.... slow career progress
job_title: Senior Analytics Contributor in Memphis, TN
pros:
Takes care of employees through benefits (though this was pruned heavily during 2008/2009).
Training to learn the tools of the trade (and beef up the resume!).
Challenging projects.
Very good work life balance!
cons:
Slow career progress unless you are a "chosen one".
Hard to get into Management.
Some projects take so long to complete - so if you are a go-getter this could be frustrating.

pros: Great benefits. Great pay but too many management changes and management going in different directions. No room for growth once you get in an analyst role. I felt like I was on a dead end street.
cons: Lot of changes and reorgs. Severance buyouts. Getting rid of a lot of the tenured employees and opting to bring new ones in for minimal pay,. No longer people service profit philosophy. Now its a profit, service, people.

review_title: I had a good experience at FedEx but was disappointed with the dishonesty in management.
job_title: Warehouse Agent in Elk Grove Village, IL
pros: i had freedom. Not in a sense that i can do whatever i wanted, but the fact that i was told what needed to be done and my supervisor did not hound me throughout the day. i felt trusted and reliable, instead of feeling incompetent.
cons: There is very little for promotions.

pros: You work with some really great people. People are hard working, carry their load, and are generally fun to be around.
cons: It's hard work. If you can't take hard manual labor, it's not for you. The pay is poor and shifts are short, so it ends up being hard work for a small paycheck

job_title: Senior Technical Analyst in Collierville, TN
pros: This is a good place to work. The majority of workers are competent. The compensation is fair and the benefits are good.
cons: Titles are important, as well as, who you know.  There is age discrimination when it comes to first time managers.

pros: like being on a sports team. loved it. everybody had your back, my boss was great and even was greater after I got injured on the job. when i was leaving the company, he told me that he would welcome me back should i ever want to come back,
cons: long hours for full time drivers. scanning, loading in the morning to doing your route, to possible trips to the airport at the end of the day can make it taxing on your family.

pros:
Freedom of working without constant supervision
Ability to manage own Route area
Can make an impact via customer service
Camaraderie can be awesome
cons:
Inside station management BRUTAL
Rules in writing; Verbal pressured to break rules
NON-Union company 
Camaraderie can suck
Pay raises are sporadic and horrible!!!
Each year top of pay get further away. Takes nearly 20 years!
Management stinks compared to years past
Routes are run by computer; no input from people with experience
Management can never be trusted

review_title: FedEx is not very considerate of their employees
pros: The team I worked with was great I enjoyed my time working with them.
cons: They hired new employees after me that I would help train and I found out they started them off more than they were paying me and they didn't give me a raise I deserved. They also would not move me to part time after I had my baby who needed intense physical therapy.

job_title: Sales Account Manager in Coraopolis, PA
pros: Great company, excellent PTO, benefits,  401, great network with a name everyone knows and trusts which is a huge help when trying to sell a brand.
cons: Long hours,  sales can be tiring at times in addition to a drain when you hear no no no no all day long but thats sales for you.  Extremly high turnover.

pros: Part-time job leaves a lot of extra time for other daily things , good starting pay , a lot of room for advancement  ,benefits , paid holidays, paid time off
cons: lots of physical labor ,very early mornings , so your sleep patterns will change , very fast pace for slow moving people , very loud and dusty environment

review_title: Unless you don’t care about your back don’t work the belt
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Newark, NJ
pros: None. Everything is a joke the discount airline tickets and all. The healthcare is a joke too.
cons: High school asf!! Old people working there get special treatment even though we got the same job title. I’m young so I have to lift heavy boxes HAHA. NO THANKS!! You’ll also never work full time and have to fish and suck up to get hours. It really sucks

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Sharon Hill, PA
pros: Full time, vacation, semi decent benefits
cons: Management - free for all as there is no one overseeing how this remote office is ran - male dominated - no respect for coworkers and issues brought to their attention - hr communicates via phone - NEVER show up. It’s laughable

review_title: The work content is great and there are opportunities and challenges, but is also very stressful.
pros: Diverse group of people, challenging projects, opportunities within IT to expand knowledge.  Education reimbursment.  Salary ok for area.  Job opportunities.
cons: Unrealistic expectations for working overtime, many nights and weekends on a continuous basis with no end in sight.  Poor performers are still awarded compensation.

review_title: Not a bad place if you can handle the repetitiveness.
pros:
-decent pay for the job
-college reimbursement
-job stability
-chances to move up
cons:
-bad management. (my first day I wasn't even told when I was suppose to leave. I ended up stay 30 mins to an hour longer)
-lack of on the job training (I had 5 mins of job training)
-all my coworkers who were around me didn't speak english. (couldn't ask questions)

review_title: Great place to work but a lot of red tape
pros: Very enjoyable place to work, lots of training opportunities and ability to move up if you are willing to.
cons: There is a lot of bureaucracy with anything that needs done.  Any project that would take a week to complete will take 10 weeks due to all the paperwork associated with it.  Medical insurance is expensive and bad.

pros: Fast paced work environment, days went quick. Constant change in work, customers will bring a large varied amount of jobs in from copies to shipping and everything in between.
cons: Constant change in management. Change of machines from Xerox to Canon left quality to something left to be desired. FedEx what was two full time jobs ( shipping, and copies) and crammed into one.

review_title: One of the Premier companies to work for in Memphis area
job_title: Senior Technical Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: There is a defined career path for most positions in the company. There's opportunities to move within the different divisions as well. Depending on which area you work in, there's decent work life balance.
cons: Sometimes moving into different roles in the company is based on who you know, networking is necessary to advance. Therefore, having a strong skill set may not get you into a position you may actually be qualified for.

review_title: FedEx cares about employees and there families.
job_title: Material Handler/Courier in Marina del Rey, CA
pros: The benefits and the career advancements.  QUALITY DRIVEN MANAGEMENT.
cons: I really cannot think of any thing negative.  Will always live by the PURPLE PROMISE.

review_title: Challenging and physically demanding job with decent compensation.
job_title: Package Handler Part-time in Lewisberry, PA
pros: The physical and fast-paced work environment really push you, and the coworkers there are helpful and friendly.  Although repetitive, it does not take long to learn how everything works.
cons: The hours are minimal even if the hourly compensation is relatively high per hour.  repetitive work can become mind-numbing.

review_title: Very well run corporation. Fred Smith is a top CEO.
pros: A leading corporation in its field. Very good corporate culture which provides employees with competitive pay, benefits and work-life balance. Employee recognition for a job well done. Opportunity for training and advancement. Stable work environment.
cons: A number of seasoned employees/managers have either retired or accepted the recent voluntary employee buyout offer. Shift to outsourcing in a number of areas with resources who don't possess the level of knowledge of the people they replaced.

job_title: Fed Ex Ground Package Handler Part Time in Port Angeles, WA
pros: it worked with my schedule while I went to school. Saw some extra hours when I could make it. Good environment, good management and coworkers were fun.
cons: I moved about a thousand packages in an hour or so.  It was a physical job, which I prefer, but it happen to be pretty rough on my wrists. Took quite a few months for the aching pain to go away, but I enjoyed the job.

review_title: Standard No Prior Certs and Exp
pros: For not having any certifications, background, major degrees, or specialties. They'll desperately take anyone willing to work graveyard shifts and may be daytime shifts for better than min wage.
cons: The shifts times are very poor and can fluctuate.  Fulltime is not really an option so making a living off of this is impossible. It is a decent supplemental position with high turn over.

review_title: Good Job with occasionally bad loads
job_title: Night Trunk Driver in Weston-super-Mare, England
pros: Regular Monday to Friday shift as an out based driver. No hassle from the office. Money was ok at £12+ per hour.
cons: Boring work. Overtime paid at standard rate. Vehicles were poorly maintained. Warehouse staff did not care so loading was occasionally poor with badly wrapped pallets falling over.

review_title: Management really knows how to talk a good game.
pros: It's better than most places I've worked but it's no where near as good as what you read in the Forbes rankings and the like.
cons: It's located in Memphis.  First line managers are nothing more than paper pushers.  They are afraid to make decisions.

review_title: Great place to work with slow career growth
job_title: Senior Marketing Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros:
1. Great work environment
2. Very good people policies
3. Low cost living
4. Great senior management
cons:
1. Low chances of growth
2. Exceptional performance not rewarded with exceptional career growth - little difference in mediocre and high performers growth/salary structure.
3. Memphis is not the most vibrant city (but has low cost of living)

pros: Laid Back and very employee friendly company. Great benefits and cant beat the low cost of living in town. Good innovation although Strategy is somewhat messed up.
cons: Overly laid back, diplomacy and lot of red tapsim, senior management lacks visibility to what's going down below, big operational loop holes to be filled

review_title: Good place to work, employees come first
job_title: Market Development Account Executive in Houston, TX
pros: reputable company, service sells itself. very open communication from superiors to employees. really put "people first". excellent opportunities for advancement.
cons: make sure  you have a good manager, makes all the difference... they expect us to  be "consultants" and they provide us with the tools and support to do so for our customers which is what makes us stand out from our competitors... all that's missing is the pay.

job_title: Senior IT Project Manager in Irving, TX
pros: Most of the people are easy to get along with and the work environment is friendly. The hours can be flexible but that's because you will likely need to put in 40+ hours every week, just not at a set 9-5 type of schedule.
cons: Work life balance doesn't exist much in the IT area. There are cycles but, more often than not, 40+ hours/week including nights and weekends is quite the norm. Salaries could be much better as well.

job_title: Manager Administrative in New York, NY
pros: Great work life balance, Huge Company, Career Advancement Opportunities in places all over the US and Internationally, Great Benefits, Caring Executive Management (took pay cuts and offered buy outs instead of handing out lay offs), Very Understanding Management.
cons: Company as a whole leans more toward the older generation that founded it. Needs younger blood.

review_title: Not an awful company but not great neither.
pros: Benefits are decent, can move up the ladder in fast rate (depends if you have a degree or not.) friendly employees
cons: The hours are not great, pay is not very good, the working environment is awful, cold when it's winter and very hot when it's summer, the safety environment is at an all time low.

pros: Training process is quite long, consisting of online modules and web based classroom settings.  It is effective, though.  When you are finished you pretty much can handle most of the day to day problems that arise.
cons: The store I worked at was understaffed, often times I was the only one there with a line out the door.  Customers get frustrated, it becomes harder to focus on not making mistakes.

review_title: Good workout, average pay, great benefits
pros: Fast paced environment, room to move up internally, good workout.  Good benefits, 401k. And a pension plan
cons: Depending on where u work it is a lot of lifting.  Lazy people need not apply.  Hard workers are not rewarded like they used to be

review_title: Good workout, average pay, great benefits
pros: Fast paced environment, room to move up internally, good workout.  Good benefits, 401k. And a pension plan
cons: Depending on where u work it is a lot of lifting.  Lazy people need not apply.  Hard workers are not rewarded like they used to be

pros: corporate culture is good, benefits are great, and good support.
cons: too many process changes to keep up with, company is making so many changes so quickly without giving staff a chance to learn the process (IT, account management, operational) that customers are adversely affected, frustrated.

pros:
- Work Life Balance
- Competitive Pay
- Great Benefits
- Flexible
cons:
- If you have good middle management, you're lucky. Else, say goodbye to your career aspirations
- Low quality of work
- Internal IT systems are horrible. They need to invest more into IT and hire some more folks. There is a lot of work to be done in this company

review_title: No way would I ship anything by Fedex ground...
pros: None, if you happen to be a package handler. Great if you are in management.
cons: People eating working environment. Managers are paid a salary PLUS a commission for packages delivered. The Package Handlers? Not a damn thing, except back injuries, little respect from managers. You are expected to be perfect all the time, and if you make an occasional mistake, they barely tell you about it, then fire you so they don't have to pay unemployment compensation.

review_title: Great CEO, Good leadership - too big if you are looking to advance
pros:
Great 'people first' mentality shown by the company during the difficult economic conditions.
Good benefits
Good resources
Fred Smith
cons:
Innovation mentality seems to be lacking
Advancement very tough - no one leaves and it seems that it is hard to crack the management bubble unless you are connected.

review_title: Came to Fedex taking a pay cut for "stability" only to laid off before 2 years!
pros: great name in the industry; a local big name (Memphis);
cons:
Lousy middle management
Hard to move out of a job because you get typecast
Extreme politics
feedback regarding your manager is never taken seriously

pros: Hours are good depending on which store location, plenty of work and never boring, lots of self improvement offerings
cons: Self center co-workers, seem to blame other people instead of solving the issues, lots of transferring of work orders to other shifts that they do not want to do, there are no incentives to move up due to lack of small bonuses

pros: Lot's of opportunity for career growth, good benefits, able to move around the country if that is something you are looking for.  Good for college students or part-time work.
cons: Too much HR, hard to get your foot in the door, have to sit in your seat for x number of years before you can advance regardless of your contributions.  Holidays were not much fun as operational processes would change, and everyone pitched in for Peak season.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
Very Ethical company 
Provides Best in Class service to our Customers
Opportunity with other outstanding individuals
cons:
Transportation industry currently has an excess in capacity making the environment very competitve
There is a large block of tenured (25+ yrs) that would have retired save for the great recession.  This group holds a large number of executive management postion.  This makes promotional opportunities very competitive.  This will likely change in the next 3-5 years

review_title: Perfect for extra income while still working a full-time position at another company
pros:
Great Pay
Excellent Benefits
Ideal hours for someone looking to work a full-time position at another company and have this as their part-time income
cons:
Physically demanding, although I don't mind, it can become strenuous at times.
Weather can be a factor as it is inside and outside from an airport hangar.
Part-time hours, although if you are looking for that, then it is a great source of income.

job_title: Senior Engineering/Operations Specialist in Frederick, MD
pros: FedEx express is a very good company to work for.  The benefits are very good and the quality of people who work there is great.
cons: There can be long working days and working during Christmas can be very stressful.  the job takes away from your family and friends during the holidays

pros: Ability to manage your routes the way you want (with in fedex guidelines) good money as long as everything is running good ,great co workers.
cons: Routes are hard on trucks ,unpredictable stop counts. Need at least 3 routes to operate smoothly ,routes are costly , extreme weather conditions,if the packages make it to the terminal, they will be delivered

review_title: Not All It's Cracked Up to Be
pros: Great company image, excellent training processes and refreshers, decent benefits.
cons: Didn't care about work/family life balance although they claimed to and pay was not that great compared to other companies. The mandatory overtime at Christmas just about killed any Christmas spirit since you would be so tired. Not many options for advancement within the call center and now they are going to at home reps model.

pros: Challenging work, days off because I worked at night.  Good Management team at my location. Opportunities to advance were present.
cons: Warehouse work, dusty environment however that comes with the territory.  Management can make all the difference, if you have a good team, you are good to go, a bad team, well you can fill in the blanks.

pros: Great company with good pay compared to rivals. Great benefits and perks. Ability to excell and climb corporate ladder.
cons: Hours are hard to obtain. Hours are crazy. Sometimes being required to arrive at 3am. Some members of management really don't care about the workers.

job_title: Swing Courier in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Always have work available when I want.  Overtime is time and a half over 8 hours per day or 40 hours per week.  Social interaction with most of the public in their workplace.
cons: Extreme pressure when delivering.  This job will age you prematurely and will make you weary when you find it hard to meet the increasingly greater expectations placed upon you.

pros: Exercise, part time pay not bad for part time work...when we work the hours that we were hired for
cons: Hours cut short, management does not appreciate employees. And I have witnessed upper management only helping certain individuals that they supervise. (But preach teamwork constatly)

pros: One of the better jobs for a commercial airline pilot. Competitive pay and benefits as compared to the passenger carriers. Opportunities for both domestic and international flying.
cons: Much of the flying is at night. This is part of the business. Each pilot develops techniques to deal with circadian rhythm issues and managing fatigue.

job_title: Fed Ex Ground Package Handler in Riverside, CA
pros: Great community, good pay, with a good opportunity to be promoted inside the company. Everyday cardio workout for those who need it
cons: Working out everyday, this job can take a toll on you mentally and physically. More physically than mentally. And it's very dusty in the trailers from time to time

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Grayslake, IL
pros: Short work days, food on occasion, good benefits, and nice pay
cons: People call off or show up late often, no drug testing, no repercussions for lazy workers, unappreciative drivers

job_title: Operations Administrator in Kansas City, MO
pros: They have excellent top notch benefits for full time employees.
cons: Very pro man. Instead of showing corporate how things really work when they visit they put on a dog and pony show so that corporate is not aware of changes that need to be done to benefit the company.

pros: Work exposes you to all types of marketing and event coordination as well as other types of business interactions with prepares you for the corporate universe
cons: Very competitive there are thousands of employees that you will have to fight against to make sure you rise to the top

review_title: Not bad if you are good in politics
pros: Not a bad place to work if you play the politics game and do not challenge many decisions made locally.
cons: A really bad place to work if you do not play the politics game and challenge many decisions made locally.

pros: very good health benefits - growth is always available if you want it.  you just have to be willing to go after it.
cons: sometimes the hours are limited- and the work is hard (but that's no seceret) - and management can be a pain because some act like drill sgts!

review_title: Great job but not a career
pros: Great pay for a college student. Full benefits even for part time employes.  School incentive programs.  Availability to move up in the company.  Availability to move around the US within the company. Paid vacation.
cons: Lots of promotions are based on seniority  rather than who is the best candidate.  Can be very unorganized at times.  Met my ex-girlfriend there.

review_title: Safe and secure in a job I adore
pros: FedEx is true to the work-life balance methodology.  They support all decisions based on family because they realize family comes first.  As long as your work is getting done in a reasonable time frame, no request is unreasonable.
cons: As with all salaried positions, sometimes it is required to work longer hours every now and then, taking home your laptop to work from home at night or on the weekends.

pros: Excellent company to work for lots of opportunity for advancement. Company on very solid ground no lay off worries.
cons: Very unhappy with pay progression. I have been an ops manager for 8 years and I am only 9% above what a new manager would start out and our bonuses that they hang over you like a carrot have been terrible. Also our medical benefits every year have gotten worse and more expensive.

job_title: Strategic Marketing Fellow in Memphis, TN
pros:
* Work life balance
* Competitive Salary in Memphis based on cost of living (not so much elsewhere)
* Good perks especially the 5% of salary pension match
cons:
* Wide Career bands (i.e. your pay can increase significantly from one end of a job band to the other end, but the title may not change)
* Limited career growth
* Salary outside of Memphis is not competitive

pros: Stable Company with good benefits. Career advancement opportunities but only if you are willing to relocate.
cons: Very stressful position, micro-management. VP's advise that we are the most profitable division with in FedEx. However, the pay and commission structure is not there. Say the company is tech savy however systems do not work and their are multiple operating systems.

review_title: I loved it but what they dont tell you is...
pros:
good pay 
usually descent customers
discounts 
if lucky, free prints. if youre a college student that is  a blessing
cons:
-slave driver
-close the store alone
-24 hour locations only have 1 person at night
-company doesnt really care for its employees

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: You have to be set up to do a walk through, after that they will send you and email to fill out the application. I filled out my application on Monday 2 days after my walk though and was called back Monday evening being asked to come in for an interview the next day. I had to set up for Wednesday. I will keep you posted as to how this interview goes.
cons: Everything seemd to go smooth so far.

pros: Great Benefits even for part time, tuition reimbursment, not at a desk all day, people were good and regular customers became like family
cons: weather could be harsh ,esp in south, dog bites hurt, stepping in and out of truck all day wears on your knees. Christmas, Mothers Day and other high quanity shipping days your not going to see your family much.

job_title: Can Coordinator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Working hours are what I was looking for.  Access to benefits.  Paid holidays, 2 weeks vacation 1 week of sick pay
cons: They can change the time you some in on a week to week basis.  No Union.  Be ready to work in all kinds of weather conditions.

review_title: I LOVED working at FedEx as a Customer Service Research Asst.
job_title: Customer Service Research Assistant in Memphis, TN
pros: Awesome insurance, tuition reimbursement, family leave, military leave, vacation and sick time, professional culture, stability, and promotion from within, several awards and tokens of appreciation, a family culture, and very professional company to work for and retire from!
cons: This position is meant to be a stepping stone to a higher position. Please have a plan to move upward, soon after you are hired.

job_title: Group Home Manager in Whiteville, NC
pros: Enjoy working in any environment. Very fast learner at anything and complete all my tasks in a timely manner. Very easy to get alone with.
cons: Don't like to be distracted when on the job. Like for my job duties to be explained to me as correctly as possible. Don't like working in an unhealthy environment.

review_title: FedEx has a culture that focuses on people,  service and profit. Individuals are responsible for their own development.
pros: The company is respected in the industry and the world. Good benefits and culture.
cons: It's a very large company. To progress, relationships matter. Under the FedEx umbrella are various operating companies with different policies and procedures that may be confusing for new employees and customers.

job_title: Ops Administrative I in Chesapeake, VA
pros: Good benefits, good training depending on station and manager opportunity to learn and advance. Open door policy with your manager and promoted from within
cons: Sometimes lack of management follow through can result in an environment without team work and lack of acknowledged for the hard working dependable members of the team

review_title: Worked for this company for 27 years. Awesome company and great people to work with.
pros: Good salary and benefits.  You get great travel benefits also.  Fast paced. Great working hours. Company allows employee an opportunity to advance rather easily also.
cons: If you are not open to change the work may not be right for you. Could be an issue if you are not an outdoor person.

pros: Job Security. Convenient location. Co-workers and peers are generally good team members. Brand name and image. Good benefits. Ability to work from home.
cons: Lack of accountability for actions. Lack of feedback on job performance. Pay is not based on experience and job performance. Lack of opportunity for advancement unless you are willing to relocate to Memphis.

pros: Good pay. Decent benefits. Meet lots of people. Energetic job. Working closely with other couriers and making friends that last forever.
cons: Local mngt can make own rules and not follow co.policy. work some holidays. Gotta work in the rain and snow. Jumping in & out of the truck all day. Bad on the knees.

review_title: FedEx, a good place for single/stay-at-home parents, students, and those with disabled children in need of good benefits
pros:
- Flexible hours
- Above average hourly pay
- Yearly raises
- Fast paced, work can double as a workout
- 3 day weekends
- Seniority is valuable for promotion
cons:
- Cannot support self or family with this income alone
- Difficult to get a full time job or salaried position
- Hard to work more than 17 hours, must come in extra day just to get 17

review_title: Great Place to work but needs to be more diversity in upper management
pros: This is an awesome place to work. People are friendly, cordial and professional. Everybody works together as a team and towards common goal.
cons: Diversity in upper management can be improved. Diversity includes women and minorities. I think FedEx does a great job in putting women in upper management but there is opportunity for minorities to be included in that place too especially in IT and Marketing.

job_title: Center Specialist in The Woodlands, TX
pros: You learn a lot very quickly and you learn to work under extreme pressure.
cons: They expect the employees to be able to do more work than they are willing to pay for and they over manage all tasks envolved with the jobs they expect you to do.

pros: the job has decent pay and you can pretty much take on as many hours as you like.
cons: hard physical work but you tend to get used to it after a few weeks tho. hours are hard to get a sleep schedule around as shifts start in the evening or early morning (3am).

pros: The benefits are very good for a part time job. They also have a cafeteria where you can get some food to eat
cons: the managers yell at you a lot and can be mean. I don't think FedEx has a union so that could be the reason

pros: Excellent benefits.  If you exercise a positive attitude, show up when expected, and do the work, they will return the respect and help you to advance as part time or to move to full time.  The benefits cost the employee almost nothing and are excellent.
cons: Must be physically willing to do the work. Almost everyone starts out doing physical tasks.

job_title: Fed Ex Courier in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Great benefits and very fair management and company policies regarding employee support and benefits beyond the excellent hourly rate.
cons: Training is a bit rushed.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Solid company that has a history of very few layoffs.
cons: Difficult to move around in the corporation as people have been with the corporation for their entire careers and the jobs that are posted internally are usually filled before the interviews are conducted.  They do not get rid of the dead weight.  It is one thing to be loyal to the employees it is another to not get rid of the ones who are not contributing.

pros: I like meeting people, whilst out and doing my daily deliveries. And work in a team, to get all trucks empty smoothly and safe.
cons:
Once trucks are unloaded . Loading your vans up to 100 drops a day. They leaving yard and making
Sure all your customers get there delivery that day

pros: Really good benefits here, no layoffs in at least 30 years (at my location at least). Pay is pretty decent. The work is manageable and not too stressful once you learn your route.
cons: Management seems out of touch with the workers. Can be strict and overbearing constantly reviewing every minute of your day making sure your productivity is always 95%+ otherwise your review (and therefore raise) suffers.

pros:
great benefits
pension plan
well respected employer
job security as long as you perform
good people to work with and for at times
cons:
Politics when it comes to promotions some times
Nonexistent work/life balance in November and December
Pay could be better
contractor legal issues/lawsuits
Not enough career advancement opportunities

pros: Great benefits even for part time employees, shifts that allow you to work another job, good pay rate for part time work
cons: Lots of employees who do nothing, stand around and have to have help for their work to be completed because no one can leave shift till certain tasks are completed

job_title: Sales Executive in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: There are some incredible people to learn from within the organization. If you want to learn how to sell and sell great, this is the company to work for.
cons: Difficult to get promoted into Management.

pros: Wonderful company, believes in People, Service, Profit... In that order.  Very active in the local community and throughout the world.  I am proud to say that I worked for FedEx.
cons: They have a high level of expectations and can create some stressful situations.  Also moving away from remote workers, while the rest of the world moves towards remote workers, FedEx is moving away from remote workers

pros: Great people. The market leader in shipping and logistics. The CEO is fantastic.
cons: Low salary, tough to advance.  Recent erosion of great people programs. Senior management has lost touch with the employees.

review_title: excellent company that cares for it's employees
job_title: Business Applications Advisor in Memphis, TN
pros: Collaborative environment with learning opportunities and challenging work. Every employee has a direct impact on the bottom line and are able to see how their individual contributions help the growing company take it's place as a top competitor in the market. Competitive salaries, great benefits, and employee perks make this a great place to work.
cons: with the slowing economy and not as much natural attrition, opportunities for advancement are lacking

pros: Health Insurance, 401K, Pension, Shipping Discount
cons: Compensation is poor. Senior and Upper Management is very rude and will work you way too many hours. They will tell you everything you are doing wrong and nothing you are doing right. Not a positive minded place to work. Everything is about numbers. If you like work 60+ hours a week minimum on salary and not treated with respect, then this is the place for you!

pros: Consistent  work, weekends off, direct deposit , descent work environment
cons: late evening pick ups, no incentive's in place for more pay, no bonuses, no paid vacation, no payed  holiday, nothing in place to value the  employee that has proven themselves

pros: You always have an opportunity to move around the hub once you been there for 3 months.  If you work offload on the planes you will make a lot more money.  You will find yourself hitting overtime or there.
cons: The weather is very hot in the summer and very cold in the winter.  Be prepared.

pros: Lots of opportunity for growth, small teams that foster collaboration, intelligent people, cafeteria onsight, decent parking, great neighborhood
cons: Heavy politics, mistakes can haunt you, cutthroat competition, some managers are not available to support their team, can be difficult to be mentored, silo environment with heavy walls that are blocking against success.

pros: FedEx is a good company with good benefits, good salary, and good advancement opportunities. I highly recommend working there. Go for it.
cons: FedEx is a large company, so sometimes you feel lost in the crowd. Management is military is style, top down directed, with not much opportunity for employee recommendations.

pros: the only i can say is benefits and discounts
cons: low pay, can't trust the human resource manager, they hire their friends and family over the qualified candidates. make themselves look amazing to charities and hopeful new clients but treat the employees like crap.

pros: Benefits including pension and 401k.  Depending on the location can work out of the house. They do offer flex time.
cons: Micro Management to the extreme. Shifts are not flexible if you have not been there over 10 years. Procedures and polices always changing and IT support is very limited.

review_title: Secure company, it's not going anywhere.
job_title: Senior Sales Analyst in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: It's secure at FedEx. Hiring all the time. Don't necessariy have to perform above average, being liked is most important.
cons: It's a male centric company. also management will convey one message but reward employees for something completely different.

pros: Most of the managers were young and pretty cool. They didn't get in the way of you just wanting to work and focus on your truck.
cons: If u are not hitting your load rate, they will pest u until you quit. Or if you are injured they expect you to bounce right back

review_title: Great company, great culture, but a slow-moving giant!
pros: Positive Culture. Flexible Management. Cafeteria/Gym in Building. Pension. Free Parking. Lots of Opppourtinity.
cons: Lack of Resources. Lack of Young Talent. Too Structured of a Pay/Promotion Scale. Lack of Work From Home Options / Flexibility. No Free Coffee. Tenured Employees / Political Enviroment.

job_title: Inside Sales Account Executive in Irving, TX
pros: Really fun people with a company that really does care about its employees. If you're willing to move, FedEx will treat you right and you'll move up.
cons: If you aren't willing to move, there isn't a lot you can do. Your bonuses are based on the performance of your territory, which is out of your hands to a large extent.

pros: When I needed to move closer to my parents hometown due to their health issues, FedEx  moved me back where i needed to be. I am thankful to those that facilitated the move and to FedEx for the opportunities and for working with their employees.
cons: Tight staffing model for smaller stations. Never enough time

pros: Great benefits all around, for most part, great management team depending which company and/or division you work at, but overall great sense of appreciation and value of employees.  Multiple opportunities to grow and they do try to hire from within.
cons: Politics instead of talent and abilities/capabilities in enabling one to move up the corporate ladder. Pay not always competitive.

review_title: Good company with good pay and benefits
job_title: Senior Business Applications Analyst in Mississauga, ON
pros: Large company with a lot of well-honed HR processes.  Great access to International projects and potential travel.  Pay is slightly above median, benefits are fairly robust, including health and well being, education, vacation.
cons: They tend to reward the superstar of the moment, with little regard to the loyal- long term- lights on employees, which can become demotivating after a lengthy employment.

review_title: A great place to work in sales but only if income is not you're priority.
job_title: Corporate Account Manager in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Job security and a very strong brand.
cons: Hard work in sales is not rewarded by the appropriate bonus compensation.  The compensation plan get worse every year.

review_title: The rich just keep getting richer!!!
pros: There are none. They have gotten so big now that they don't care about their employees especially the ones that have been there 20 years or more.  They are too Senior Mangement heavy!!
cons: When they fire you 2 weeks before Christmas and then take your last check because your vacation time ate it up I would say that sucks!! You have nothing to support  your family on and FedEx doesn't care!!

review_title: outstanding 14 years, hardwork is required to secure promotion and growth, expectation from employees are high
pros: freedom to do the right thing, less interference from upper management, well run company, great leadership and vision from the management. They are generally employee friendly and promote from within.
cons: long working hours, less work life balance

pros: steady job, great on the job training and great support at your finger tips on the computer as well as the teams if you need questions answered.
cons: due to the nature of the business your days can be very long and not much chance to move up and advance your career unless you have a degree

review_title: Fedex is an impressively well run company
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Springfield, MO
pros: The management is well selected; the facilities and concern for employees is a priority; and the work is variable , constant, and fast paced.
cons: There havent been any major cons in my experience so far. Like any industrial job, there is constant noise (belts running, etc), but I couldnt see it leading to even slight hearing damage unless one worked full time for years.

job_title: Fed Ex Courier in Wichita, KS
pros: Great training and benefits paid training.
cons: Not enough hours, or way too many, fluctuating schedule for par timers hard to build a routine and get used to longer hours when you never know how long you are going to work.

job_title: Cross Border E-Commerce Specialist in Memphis, TN
pros: Not that hard of a job.
cons: Working nights and weekends. And low pay for a college degree.

job_title: Fed Ex Express Courier in Kansas City, MO
pros: Good health, dental and vision insurance, nice 401k matching, great people, decent pay and opportunity to be outside meeting people. College degree not required and generally easy work for a manual labor job.
cons: Seniority policy makes it difficult to move into a decent full time position or get a vacation on a week you want. Part time couriers will likely work in the evening which can be a strain on family life.

pros: Love the people, love the job and the environment. The company as a whole fostered a great sense of comradely and purpose. While the job was sometimes difficult, it was always worth it to be part of something that large.
cons: When you deal in time as a commodity, the expectations can often feel more than a little daunting

pros: Good benefits, career opportunities, good pay, convenient hours to work around the clock, diverse work environment, team work is mandatory! Safe environment
cons: Different personalities like any place , when weather is hot it's hotter on building and voiced versa. When cold several layers needed, months where can go over hours (peak season) during the holidays

pros: Good benefits, career opportunities, good pay, convenient hours to work around the clock, diverse work environment, team work is mandatory! Safe environment
cons: Different personalities like any place , when weather is hot it's hotter on building and voiced versa. When cold several layers needed, months where can go over hours (peak season) during the holidays

job_title: Senior Revenue Science Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Great team atmosphere. Smart people, who work on good interesting projects. Tasks are dependent upon management direction. Excellent work life balance
cons:
Kinda slow. New technologies take time to get so people leaving the company might take time to adjust to the fast paced life outside. 
Health benefits are definitely wanting and other perks are non existent.

pros: Health benefits are ok. Work environment depends on management.
cons: Pay is not comparable to work requirements at any level. Benefits on the job have all been removed and employees are still required to work above and beyond.

review_title: Was better before the politics kicked in but it's still a great place to work
pros: 401K, employer contributions, competitive pay, hours available if you're willing to stay, overtime per day after 8 worked hours and double time after 12, nice place to meet every type of person possible.
cons: Minimal hours unless you're trained but training is available, hard work depending on the operation, lots of complaining kids working for the first time and retirees doing the bare minimum.

review_title: Run far away from this place.
pros: The job itself is really pretty awesome. It is always changing, you always are dealing with something new, and always talking to a huge variety of people. You learn a ton of great information that you will know for future jobs.
cons:
Just about everything else. The management is absolutely the worst I've ever seen. The senior manager needs to be replaced ASAP. She is running that place into the ground and has been for years. She is vindictive, manipulative, and will find a way to get rid of you if you disagree with her in any capacity. If you make her mad enough, she'll completely make something up to try and get you fired. The employees there have seen it happen multiple times. Her and the majority of management do not care about any of the employees or their well being. Favoritism is an issue as well. 
The pay is laughable. They try to call the job a call center, though nothing about it is like a call center. They pay low wages because they consider it one, although new hires get hired on now making more than the supervisors even do, or the employees that have worked there for 15+ years. The senior manager is trying to force all the tenured employees out the door so that she can replace them with people that don't question her and are younger and more productive. 
The workload is insane. They have mismanaged things so badly that employees are having to take on literally 4X the normal amount of work, and management doesn't do anything about it because they know that "it'll get done one way or another".  The list goes on and on. Turnover and attrition are at an all time high. People are quitting right and left. 
 Run so far away from this circus and go work for someone who values you. Go work for any other branch of FedEx even.  You will also have absolutely no work life balance. Expect to work massive amounts of overtime because there is so much work constantly.

pros: Pay was $13/hr and you could work over college breaks. Managers were super flexible. Co-workers liked you because you were seen as temporary employment and didn't pose a threat for promotions/bonuses. They feed you food weekly. It's a basic position but employers always wanted to talk about my time there.
cons: There's no AC so it's hot in the summer and freezing in the winter. It's hard labor.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Oceanside, CA
pros: The people are great and the work will help get you in shape. Some supervisors are supportive and want to see you succeed, others not so much.
cons: Upper management seems out of touch with workers and don't value the work put in to get trucks out on time.

review_title: Don't buy into "one of the best place to work".
pros: Lots of recognition.  Almost too much which becomes meaningless over time.  Ok work life balance.
cons: Went overboard with cuts during bad economy with  permanent reduction in salary, 401K, merit and bonus.  Most entry level and mid level managers below average in intellect and motivation.

pros: cultural diversity, opportuntiy for advancement, training resources, team work, excellent benefits, great brand recognition, best in the business, always growing and changing.
cons: large corporate structure sometimes there is disconnect from department to department.  lots of change constantly happening and sometimes lines get crossed.

job_title: IT Analyst in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
As an IT analyst, I had opportunities to change career direction and specialties every 3-5 years.
Management has re-focused on PSP Philosophy - Take care of People, people provide great Service for customers, leading to Profit for shareholders.
Recent voluntary buy-out offer will provide more opportunities for remaining staff.
cons: Downsizing from voluntary buy-out may result in a dynamic environment for a while.

job_title: Package Handler Part-time in Kennesaw, GA
pros: Pay and benefits. Good supervisors, employees, security and staff. Very good sturdy employment, and supervisors are always willing to assist you at any given time.
cons: Very strenuous work with certain aspects. Can be a dangerous work environment if not taken with caution at times. A bit stressful. I would not recommend this job with anyone who has a health problem in regards to stress either.

review_title: Excellent company, excellent employees, leading-edge projects for the best and the brightest
pros: Good compensation, better than average benefits, historically long term job satisfaction and most people stay at least 10 years, but many stay much longer
cons: There are not a lot of levels to advance through promotional opportunities.  You cannot come in with an expectation to advance at the rate some other companies have ... be patient, wait for your time, repeat if necessary.

pros: FedEx was a great company with great benefits. Flexible schedule and weekends off. Paid vacation and holidays off . Great part time job
cons: I really enjoyed working at FedEx. The people were nice and helpful. Really my only complaint was there was not enough hours

review_title: Issues with culture within certain departments
pros: Formal performance appraisals, clear objectives
cons: I can't speak for all departments, but the department I worked in was toxic and, despite voicing concerns to HR and management, little was done to improve the situation.  The supervisor in my department was also unequipped to adequately lead a team; she had been promoted from within and should have been provided with appropriate training to prepare her for the role.

job_title: Senior ECO Import Agent in Memphis, TN
pros:
Good working environment, decent pay and will afford you time-off  as needed. Plenty of overtime.
Great opportunity to learn and get exposure other governmental agencies.
cons: Work with US Customs and have to be flexible to the various changes as they occur. Overtime is required and limited growth within sub-company.

review_title: overall its been a pretty good company to work for. Very secure work place.
pros: Great pay. Friendly atmosphere. Have enjoyed for the most part, working there.
cons: Too much OT for me. They need to have a more level work flow throughout the work week. Instead of having certain days with a heavy volume. Also,have an even number of people to work every inch of warehouse, functions.

job_title: Senior Service Agent, Trace Agent in Miami, FL
pros: Great pay and benefits.
cons: Teamwork is not always there, managers are just working for their bonus, if  you have to go through GFTP process it is a joke, don't waste your time. Just move on. HR representative never there for you.

pros: Fast paced. Great benefits. Motivating atmosphere. Paid vacations. Surrounded by Honest, hard working people. Managers are fair and will help you move up as long as you work hard and are responsible
cons: Can get stressful if you can’t handle multiple tasks at once. Until you get a routine going. Not for everyone. Must be able to keep up with time/task expectations as Their logo is “The World on Time”

job_title: ECO Import Agent in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Excellent benefits, decent hours, opportunities to learn new things, most managers are pretty decent, people are nice to work with if you can deal with office drama.
cons: Don't even think about rocking the boat and reporting harassment or bullying, it puts a target on your back.  Very cliquish.  Must have 100% accuracy and 100% performance at all times.  Very stressful.

pros: There are a few fine people that work there... (few)
cons: What a dreadful place to work. Local HR and Security Gestapo.... run around like storm troopers intimidating workers over petty stuff. Godless company with no moral compass. Cult like management system. Stay away. Low pay... not up to industry standards. TNT merger a disaster. Toxic work environment. Lemming like mentality. I refrain from chastising the entire company. I hope it is just local issue (Gardena,CA) not a corporate Memphis issue... who knows?

pros: Opportunities to move within the company and market competitive salary, language used is mainly english, so no major issues if you don't know french or dutch
cons: work work and work,,,, it can be quite stressfull at times,,depends upon the project though !! headquarters of EMEA ..one has to travel a lot

review_title: A waste of years at FedEx
job_title: Inside Sales Account Executive in Irving, TX
pros:
The brand
Stability
Build friendships
Can lead to a better job with another company
cons:
Pay based on how cool you are with your mgr
Treat sales reps like kids
childrenlike culture
mgmt doesn't promote based on performance
mgmt give different performance reviews based on who they like
mgmt disrespects employees and tell employees business
mgmt lie constantly to employees 
getting hired is strictly based on referrals and not your background
education is not important here
Annual salary increase is terrible

pros: Executive support and hard work. Extremely dedicated work force that keeps customer first focus.
cons: Long hours at times. Very rigid work process that is at times difficult to get exceptions when needed. However, at organization this size the standardization is needed and exceptions are being considered more frequently than in the past.

pros: Stability, benefits, flexibility in work environment/hours.  Work can be challenging and you can work to obtain and practice new skills
cons: Because it is a stable place, few folk leave, so moving up is difficult.  Seems to become overly political at the director/vp level.

pros: Good benefits grate 401K package
cons: If you are an Operations Manager at FedEx Ground you are not treated very well. Upper management tells you that you are servis but they talke down to you alienat people and are not nice when you need help. Fedex Ground has started to get rid of alot of Operations Manager positions on the Dock so your days get longer like 12 to 14 hour days with lessw pay.

job_title: Air Craft Material Handler in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Fun job, got paid for a great work out everyday! Employee benefits weather you are full or part time which seemed to provide generous time off even working part time.
cons: Usually would have to work early early mornings or evenings at the airport. No real day jobs and not much opportunity to go full-time unless you moved.

pros: Great pay and great benefits. Great christmas tips
cons: expectations were very unrealistic. Its impossible to do 45 stops in 35 minutes all spread out in the snow. Theres no concern for your safety just get it done. And if you dont kiss up to the managers get ready for alot of uncalled for write ups that you see other people get away with on a everyday basis.

pros:
Ok pay for the type of work
Work with some cool people
although you're in at 3:30 in the morning, you're out by 8.
cons:
HORRIBLE head manager!
Head manager is always on my back for no reason. One time he even told my immediate manager that he did not want us taking. Also he does not really care about advice employees give to make the job easier and more efficient.

review_title: Company isn't loyal to its employees and employees are underpaid. This use to not be the case but things have changed
pros: I enjoy having flexible hours and the benefits are really good. The staff where I'm at is very friendly
cons: Work a crazy amount of hours and there is constant pressure

review_title: They don't care about their contractors.
pros: As a driver working for a contractor you do have work.
cons: As a tractor trailer driver and a OTR driver running teams. They suck they treat drivers like crap they don't care if they get you home when they are suppose. They leave you set while you watch loads go out the gate on Prime, CRST, CR England and US Express.

pros: The envirmonment was positive. Great coworkers. I enjoyed my time working for such a great company.
cons: A lot of pressure to make sure packages were on time and customers were treated with ultimate respect. Not negative pressure, mostly pressure you put on yourself to not let anyone down.

pros: 1. Great employee oriented company, consistently in the best companies to work for in the US and world 2. Competitive salaries 3. Cost of living in Memphis suburbs is low, quality if life very nice including good/great schools. 4. Excellent work-life balance 5. Pension plan
cons: Big company, not many people want to give up excellent quality of life - the end result being not many growth opportunities.

pros: Decent benefits,starting pay is decent as well
cons: Even after 10 years with the company,still can't get the cacation time i requested off. Vacation is yours to take,but only when they say so.Although last raise was decent,last 3+ years raise toal was 4% total for a 4 year period!

pros: Great environment, i learned alot in the short amount of time that I was there and hope to be working for them full time when I graduate
cons: Very strict working hours.  Alot of work to handle on a daily basis.  Can be very stressfull

pros: You work for a route owner. You can negotiate with that owner for your salary and what kind of truck you drive etc. You are basically on your time during the day as long as you meet your pick up times and the occasional specific drop time. Keeps you in great shape!
cons: If you work for a bad contractor your experience will be a bad one. No benefits.

pros: They invest in their employees and promote from within.  The have a people, service, profit motto that they live and breath-if you hire the right people and treat them well, they will give exceptional service to the customer which brings in the profit.  Some of the best mentors in my career were at FedEx.
cons: For most sales positions you will be required to move to a new state.

pros: good job for college attendants/ people who need health benefits generally nice people to work with if u can work hard it should not be too bad
cons: not a place for advancement usually care more about diversity than actual skill sometimes not a huge issue but can get slightly annoying

job_title: ECO Import Agent in Indianapolis, IN
pros: decent insurance, lots of vacation and sick time
cons: scheduled to work every holiday (decent compensation for this), actual pay isn't that great, the heat has been broken on and off since I started in 2015, a lot of inconsistency in policy and procedure application,

pros: Professionalism promoted from within to provide the customer with the best solution possible. Flexibility in scheduling but also must meet/exceed goals with balanced performance of increasing business in all service segments, Express, Ground, Freight and International.
cons: Always more to do. Changes ensure system improvement but can be confusing to customers.

review_title: Don't get on this sinking ship. (FedEx Trade Networks, Springfield, MO)
job_title: Senior ECO Import Agent in Springfield, MO
pros:
-Good Benefits, 401K match, benefits day 1 of hire. 
-There are team leads who haven't left yet who are good, caring people- always willing to help. 
-3 of the managers are good people and willing to recognize and admit that there are problems even though their hands are tied because the senior manager is vindictive and ruthless.
-new hires make more starting out than employees who have been there 5-10 years, so that's good if you are starting out although the tenured agents/team leads would disagree.
cons:
-not a good place to work if you like seeing your family. 50 hour work weeks are the norm with no end in sight.
- new hires have no desk to sit at and are forced to sit in a training room by themselves until the next disgruntled employee walks out, freeing up a desk
-new web based systems are being forced on the agents and they crash hourly because the servers aren't strong enough 
-new phone system is a joke. Customers aren't even able to leave a message. Team leads are forced to micromanage employees every second of the day. Literally, you have to specify what you are doing when you get up. If you get up to go to the bathroom, your team lead may be forced to stop what he or she is doing to take a call.
-team leads are stretched so thin that they can't even be expected to get to all of their tasks.
-team leads are grossly underpaid. 
-feelings of hopelessness among leadership (leads and managers) because of how the senior manager is running the place.
-team leads and managers aren't allowed to meet with senior manager's boss without senior manager present. No real feedback can ever be given because of this and it creates a real "keep your head below the parapet" mentality 
-senior manager will lie to make herself look good
-senior manager avoids coming out of her office most of the day
-very few career advancement opportunities

review_title: No Strategic directions. A ship without a licenced captain.
pros: Flexibility and nice ppl. Experiences of the employees helps pieced up this company. Being a young forwarder, a great place for opportunities & growth.
cons: Management not listening hard enough. Top down approach does not achieve desired results. To many grey areas within opco.

review_title: A good job but not a lot of room for growth
pros: FedEx still provides a work enviorment that empowers employees to make decisions, and isn't stressfull.  Benefits are still above average.
cons: There are no career paths and limited professional growth opportunities.  This makes FedEx seem more like a job and not a career.
