review_title: A great Company that is doing so much right.
pros: The upper level management is making great decisions.  The company is working on and developing great new opportunities and strengths for itself.  In the future I am confident that the growth and market share will increase for FedEx.
cons: Everything boils down to how management impacts you.  I can say that most of the managers I have had at FedEx have been great.

pros: Very family oriented company. Truly take care of their employee. The management does think of families their decision affects. Team members are very friendly.
cons: Technology is not cutting edge. Changes are very slow. The salary is not keeping up with the market. In some department their is lack of innovation.

review_title: Thankful for the experience and knowledge I gained as well as the relationships
pros: Good benefits, training, and opportunities for career advancement
cons: Hourly employees work extremely hard but are not paid wages that reflect their worth

pros: Fedex has great employee and insurance benefits. For material handler, this should only be a part time job unless a part time job is all you're looking for
cons: You will only only get about 4 hours per day/ night if you are lucky. Christmas is about the only time you will get more hours. You can always ask for more hours, but odds are, it's only going to be on the weekends.

pros: Good way to earn money part time.  Especially if you are a student or you have other requirements of your time.
cons: uncaring management.  Sometimes, situations happen that are beyond our control and prevent us from coming to work on time.  Although, I do understand that reporting to work and on time is a requirement of the job.

pros:
Committment to compliance
Benefits
Worldwide locations offers many job opportunities.
cons: Decision making far too centralized; too much emphasis on process engineering so that they tend to lose sight of the fact that there is more to a decision than the numbers alone.

pros: Easy job to get and the pay is decent. The benefits are also really good. I love the fact that they have tuition reimbursement.
cons: Actual training for the job was non-existent and you can't take breaks. Takes forever to get your last paycheck if you don't have direct deposit. And, it's wayyy to hot in there. I got dehydrated, so I decided to quit.

job_title: Center Assistant Management in Oakland, CA
pros: Great working environment, fantastic experience with the coworkers, and fabulous management style.
cons: You have to work overtime usually in order to complete since the job is extremely heavy and there are tons of stuffs you have to do in order to complete the daily task.

pros: Have good vacation benefits. 2 weeks to start and after 5 years 3 weeks. Insurance is very good as well although a high deductible depending on your plan
cons: For sales a lot of administration that henders one to sell  and to many levels of sales.  Work 10-15 hour days.

review_title: Excellent place i worked in 12 years back
job_title: Senior Network Engineer in Cairo, Cairo Governorate
pros: Very friendly environment and wise management, team work and dynamic workplace and very enthusiastic . IT manger was a real leader and always supporting my new ideas and initiatives
cons: Always loaded with tasks and many times worked for more than 20 continuous hours. That should have rationalized by increasing resource and additional training

pros: Flexible hours, tuition reimbursement. I like that it is a fast paced environment. It is great place to work for a part-time job. Excellent benefits!
cons: The work can be very physical. The weather can sometimes slow down the progress of getting the freight out on time.

review_title: Hard to move up and promote.
job_title: Material Handler in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great benefits and and retirement plan. The hours are ok. With the right schedule you don't work weekends and you get paid holidays off.
cons: Never more than 20 hours a week. You have to give up your personal life for overtime if you are picked.

review_title: umm if you like customers, you will be fine
pros: shipping discount and retail dicount, depending on the center the employees are real cool, cant say to much else about it!!
cons: Needy customers wh demand attention all the time, training is not very efficent within the center. everyone seems to be really busy.

pros: great benefits, sound business and company to work for. they treat employees fairly well and have updated computer applications and equipment.
cons: downsizing and making the reduced workforce responsible for more than they can sometimes handle. very fast paced and distracting at times. upper management disengaged from workers and issues.

pros: Benifits are great and flexible for students.  Tuition reimbursment program is an excellent benifit.  When the economy was down FedEx still provided a secure work setting.
cons: 110 Degree warehouse in the summer.  The holidays are non-existant because we are providing a service that is stressed during those times.

review_title: Overall a good company to work for
job_title: Senior Customer Service Representative in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Good Benefits, Job Security, able to transfer to other sites, able to upgrade from part time to full time, Good people there,
cons: Very busy during holiday season and overtime is mandated. Very strict about attendance and tardiness.  You are marked down on your review if you use sick time.

review_title: Great company, good benefits, forward thinking
pros: Good company, strong focus on IT, very forward thinking.  Strong focus on delivering helpful information to all users through progressive use of the web.
cons: FedEx sometimes loses focus on their goals and chases the competition.  At times it drives its people harder and longer than needed.  Upward mobility is usually limited unless you are in Memphis.

review_title: Great company, great culture, decent pay
pros: Pay is below market level for the area. Great company with great and true people-first culture. Career advancement opportunities are available, especially on international divisions
cons: Challenging financial conditions which impact pay. Very low turnover. Some people that have been with the company for years perform poorly and still get a chance to stay in the job.

review_title: They take care of their own.
pros: You know exactly what you'll be doing every day. Not a whole lot of surprises. Easy Money. Lots of room to move around in the company.
cons:
Don't plan on getting any more hours that what you come in at.
Poor leadership on the floor.

job_title: Material Handler in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great benefits, paid a minimum of 17 hours/wk as long as you show up and work. Managers are kind and listen to suggestions.
cons: Not much opportunity for overtime, work can be monotonous, grueling and repetitive; exposure to extreme heat and cold.

job_title: Market Development Acct Executive in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Great brand
Actually has a pension plan that is funded by the company
Loyal to employees
Lots of long term employees work here
Company tries to maintain work/life balance.  Usually successful, but work sometimes takes precedence
cons:
Pay may be lower than market for similar positions
Constant changes...which is sometimes good, but it's actually too common at FedEx

pros: Great company. Lots of people. The environment is very clean. Young energetic company that is fast paced and trying to grow.
cons: No growth opportunity-  the money isn't at all what to what is promised. Management thinks they are above everyone else. do not care if you're fired.

review_title: Worked as a PH for 3+ years. N Phx location has little opportunity to advance and bad communication.
job_title: Fed Ex Ground Package Handler in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Insurance, school financial help, decent pay. Friendly and safe co-workers. Free food? Woop dee doo... Sometimes will work with your schedule.
cons: No hours. Unorganized MGMT. Physical labor. No deserving recognition. Transfered away from N Phoenix and have never looked back. Good company if you find right place.

job_title: Senior ECO Import Agent in Memphis, TN
pros: Great overtime when it is available. Immediate management is great and very helpful to help you.
cons: You're a nobody if you're at the bottom. Favoritism and nepotism runs the place and if you don't fit in, you will never be a part of the group. Upper management won't care about you or your desires. This is a production-based, 24/7 operation and if you don't produce numbers, then you won't get anywhere.

job_title: Part Time Dock Worker in Fremont, IN
pros: Good benefits. Great people.Probably the easiest job you will ever find. They are pretty good about working with you for time off.
cons: You always hire in as part time. As far as hours, you'll be working pretty much 40+ hours a week until home office sends an email stating that your average hours are too high. At that point you'll only get between 25 and 30 hours a week.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Forest Park, GA
pros: pay is decent and the managers are cool
cons: employees are ghetto, they don't listen to management and they are full of drama

pros: Best company to work for so far. Currently enjoying my time working there for this big corporation as its one of the best companies to work for.
cons: Currently I have not seen any cons so far in my present time working for my employer.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Diego, CA
pros: Only "pros" I can come up with is getting paid every week.
cons: Work place bullying, uneducated managers, lazy co-workers,favoritism, lazy managers. Favoritism is everything at this company. Managers at the ramp will announce a open position tell people to apply for it,have a side conversation with another employee give him the job but still tell everyone else to apply. When managers are confronted about this the lie. Double standers are used when it comes to ramp agents and handlers.

review_title: Great place to work with many career opportunities and benefits.
pros: Benefits, including flight discounts and shipping, and they pay for a portion of your scholarship. Great place to work if you're looking for a career.
cons: The hours could be better. Favoritism is a thing that does exist in this place. People also don't like to stay here very long. Work orders for broken equipment never get filled..

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great coworkers, freedom, no micromanagement. Amazing benefits and pay, and the job is never boring. Work is stable and managers willing to adjust schedule for school, and work/life balance.
cons: Sometimes stressful, and extremely fast paced. Management sometimes play favorites. Politics come into play when trying to move up in the company. Some workers disrespectful and unprofessional.

pros: Great job environment and awesome co-workers and management. Have 2 trucks to load or less to work on.  Team work is the key to success.
cons: Unless its not peak season you won't get more than 5 hours a day. Also if you need extra hours maybe working on inbound 2 day a weeks max

pros: There are several pros. One of these is the excellent pay and a great team.
cons: Just like any job there are always some cons as well. One of the cons is the long hours during holidays like Christmas. Also you will probably be working with a contractor. If this is the case risk of being dropped if freight falls off is great.

pros: Working time is very flexible. People are nice and helpful! Wonderful working environment. Good culture.
cons: Memphis is not like big cities. There's no much fun activities or parties going on living here. And it's not very convinient to visit other states of the country (always need to transfer flight).

pros: Great Exercise, Promotes from within, Full-Time Benefits.
cons: Awkward Hours, Sometimes can be stressful to body. Make sure to always stretch!

pros: You get an opportunity to help different business focus on what's important to them. I loved the idea that the AE was empowered to run their territory as if it was their own business. Unfortunately this empowerment was slowly taken away.
cons: In recent years the culture fundamentally changed in a negative way owing to a new direction taken by the leadership team.

pros: Decent pay,can be trained for almost all jobs
cons: Unskilled and poorly trained mgrs...most are just trying to get better hrs and vac time! Difficult to get fair treatment when upper mgt dating  co workers and half the people u work with are related to each other...

pros: Great place to work with solid people and development practices.  The company has a people, then service, then profit philosophy that makes them who they are
cons: It is slower to have a career progression, sometimes more to do with seniority than merit.

pros: they offer great benefits, they are extremely fast paced, and I love that you get weekly pay there is much opportunity to move up
cons: the job is very physical in most entry level positions, in the warehouse it is not a climate controlled environment

pros: they offer great benefits, they are extremely fast paced, and I love that you get weekly pay there is much opportunity to move up
cons: the job is very physical in most entry level positions, in the warehouse it is not a climate controlled environment

pros: Get to work with great people, in a strong company with lots of different work to challenge you.
cons: Corporate structure has been set in stone. Not as much room for advancement upward if your goal is to get above first level of management.

review_title: Experience was good, however, some rules are really unacceptable.
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Calgary, AB
pros: Supporting people are there, day shift job, one can apply for the desired role after completing 6 months in an organisation.
cons: They will not allow employees to take bio(washroom) breaks by own, We have to ask team leaders for that and many times they even don't allow for it which is really stressful. They will ask you to work overtime compulsory as per business requirements.

pros: Great company with good benefits and pay.  Employees are treated fairly and with respect.  Lots of advancement opportunities depending on where you live or want to live.  Bonuses are decent.
cons: Professional advancement is limited in most cities outside of Memphis which is corporate headquarters.  Pay raises aren't the best but bonuses are pretty good.

review_title: My experience has been a very good one
pros: The benefits are excellent, the hours are flexible around my schedule, the management system is fine - an all around good company
cons: The benefits package was just adjusted. Depending on your situation (married, single, kids) it can be a negative, but that varies by individual situations

review_title: It is a nice workplace environment. I work from home
pros: Working at home, and can dress anyway i like.  Great benefits to working at home.  people are always nice.
cons: As Speciality rep you are expected to know everything.  Jack of all trades and a master of none.

job_title: Senior Marketing Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: company culture foster collaboration, team work, personal connection. Philosophy of serving customer best.
cons: quite some overlap in projects/functions across various organizations. Management level can be too protective of its own org and lose the whole Picture. Tardiness in one team can cause costly delay in a big cross-functional project.

pros: Flexible schedule.   Good product.  Superior service provider.
cons: Stress!!  Micro managed.   Bad work life balance.   Compensation is dwindling.   You stretch on goals unrealistic.  Cannot meet goals anymore do to huge LTL goals.  Bonuses are nonexistent.   They've dummies down the sales force by merging  parcel and LTL sales.

pros: Great work-life balance and people-service-profit culture.  Interesting work and people.
cons: Very difficult to advance in your career because of little growth or attrition in marketing.  Many parts of the company are very siloed.  Inability of management to make a decision can be stifling at times.  Very slow to react to the market.

review_title: Supervison is very informative  meet their goals , when we do a good job we are congratulated.
job_title: Package Handler Part-time in Bethlehem, PA
pros: I work for FedEx Ground Bethlehem,PA and we are best in our divison.  It gives you a sense of pride.  The benefits they have are excellent.
cons: Fast pace and  a lot of lifting which I dont mind.

job_title: Business Sales Inside in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Only have to work 40 hours. Can work 4 x 10 schedule as long as keep numbers up.  Can move up if able to relocate. Have lots of positions open at all times. If can't relocate May be waiting years to change positions.
cons: Constant changing territories. No control over numbers. Either you have a good territory or you don't. Things don't always work like they should.

review_title: Great as a starting job, but long term career options are limited.
job_title: Assistant Manager in San Diego, CA
pros: Usually a good working environment, but it all depends on management. Fair compensation for the work expected of you.
cons: Vague job descriptions and responsibilities, ridiculous expectations set by corporate all but guarantees failure. No set working hours/schedule, could change day-to-day based on perceived needs.

pros: You'll have a job, I guess?? Also, the pay is okay, but only if you press for a good salary.  Work-Life balance is better than other areas at times.
cons: Stagnant, compartmentalized, go nowhere job.  If you want a job that you can sit in for the next 40 years and do the same thing day in and day out, this is the place for You! Management is useless, they will never have your back and cower to sales every chance they get.  You will only get a promotion after working there about 10 years and that will be only if HR makes them because you're maxing out the salary grade.  The only other way you're getting promoted is if you're on project work, but the catch is, they pick the same people (favorites) to do project work over and over.  So don't bet on that.  The work is demeaning and draining every second of everyday!  Sales will literally treat you like dirt under their feet.  They will belittle you, harass you, and treat you down right unprofessionally without repercussions and in most cases your manager will not have your back or defend you or the team in any way. Finally, because of most of the things I've mentioned and more I didn't, we have had a FLOOD of people leaving the department which makes more and more work and stress for the people who remain since they can't hire people fast enough. Even when people are hired, it take at least 6mos to a year to get up to speed in order to effectively help with the workload.

pros: Good people doing hard work.  Takes a few weeks to get acclimated if you are not use to a fast pace work environment.  Good benefits. Opportunity for advancement, flexible shifts.
cons: Fast paste. Heavy lifting, pay under $13.00 an hour

pros: The people make the culture, and there's always opportunities to connect with other folks in the IT areas.  Technology drives the ability to help deliver for the company.
cons: Delivering on projects is key to the teams' success and in trying to beat the competition to the market.  It's sometimes demanding on work/life balance, but management really helps in those situations.

pros: It is the only large cargo carrier in Memphis, Memphis does not have many competing jobs in this category.
cons:
FedEx does not provide adequate benefits to a majority of the employees.  Some Workgroups do have adequate benefits.  The executive management group has an excellent pay, retirement, and bonuses.  There retirements benefits are outstanding, retirement pay, and retirement medical.  

As for the majority of employees the pay is inadequate, the health insurance is sold to the employees for a high price with very poor coverage.  The traditional pension plan was discontinued, and frozen.  They have a very inadequate cash Pension Plan that will pay a minimum token amount when the employee leaves after 20 years.  It is based on your salary and time in service, and applied to a company account every three months with a interest rate of 1% every three months.  That ADDS up to 4% the year, and you do not control the money in the account.  It is controlled by the company.  

Many of the retirees are struggling with the health insurance.  The retirees have to pay $700 to $1,000 a month for coverage for two people.  This is no better than Cobra coverage.  

Many people go to work for large companies for the benefits,  health insurance and retirement knowing that this was promised at the beginning of their employment with this company.  

FedEx is very good with public relations they have the means and the money to make the story sound good.  They also are very good of promising many things.  But to is all smoke and mirrors.

pros: Decent pay, incentives to grow. You must have a knowledge of who's who and network well to make sure you get ahead.
cons: Incentives are hard to reach, mostly a climb on your own. Management doesn't listen often, and if they do they're mostly appeasing.

pros: Fred Smith is a visionary, globalization trends will only make the services of FedEx more important. The "Purple Promise" to make every customer interaction outstanding is key.
cons: The size of a decentralized company of three hundred thousand people can be cumbersome when trying to be nimble and react to a customer need.

review_title: I worked for a great contractor, but I have heard he was an exception to the norm.

cons: Long hours, Demanding work. Lots of running (kept me in shape, but tiring). No medical benefits.

pros: Good Environment and People, always felt good going into the work place. Maybe my co workers made it all better but I always enjoyed. I only left to move to another company and higher up.

How can you raise the starting pay to almost near someone who has been working there 6 plus years? How black are your hearts in upper management? Terrible company and they act like they make no money. Look at all the crap you sponsor! Put money into the people that matter! Union union union union

job_title: Hub Operations Manager in Bedford, England
pros: Unlimited opportunities to progress within the Company across the whole world. Instantly recognized brand not only within the industry, but generally in the marketplace.
cons: Unsocial hours for this particular role. The type of role and the particular location only operate night hours, pretty typical for parcel industry.

review_title: It's part of FedEx but, it's Awful
pros: Become an employee to get your foot into the FedEx brand then move to another Opco where they seem to have things a bit more organized. FTN is a deadend in the FedEx world
cons: Basically you have long time employees hanging on in their positions which clearly have no desire to improve themselves or the company. They started in an office and will end their career in the office and don't really understand air or ocean freight. For a freight forwarder I have never been around so many people that know so little about transportation or even about other parts of FedEx. Middle and upper mgmt don't seem to travel like they do at other forwarders. At other forwarders you will find very diverse team from all over the world even in hourly and intern positions. Well not here they seem to be all from Memphis. They are clueless what markets need attention to grow business and they seem to run both operations and office environments with minimal employees. The next biggest thing for FTN is to grow Air and Ocean to overtake the competition but, they lack the tools, employees, and leverage with carriers to do this. They also want to utilize Fedex Freight to grow their trucking business. I find this strange because most forwarders don't put their focus in the trucking business. They have no TMS system, nor do they plan on getting one, they seem to like do do things manually. They leave positions open intentinaly to save money. Its a company that wants to be global but thinks local. Find something better.

review_title: Not the company it used to be.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Memphis, TN
pros: Decent salary, nice location, some of the people were very nice, the cafeteria food was excellent, that is about all that is good
cons: so as to avoid lawsuits, all discriminatory practices were incredibly subtle; on the surface (e.g., word/communication level), there was no discrimination and allegedly support. However, if you are not African-American (or if you are, but don't "fit"), then the discriminatory behaviors begin. One person was fired because he did not come in to work his shift when he had a 103 fever (proven by a hospital note), even though he had given several hours notice that he was in the hospital. Another was fired because they did not like her clothes (she was harassed daily on her choice of clothing - which was border-line professional: nice pants and a top - and sent home to change until she was fired). I was told to lie on the phone: "tell the customer whatever you have to tell them to get them off the phone". I was not fired, but I was harassed daily, given conflicting instructions from day to day (although I will say that the person "sentenced" to "coach" me started apologizing by the end of day 2 - and it was obvious she was being forced to create a stressful work environment - and it caused her more stress than it did me). All of those fired for "created" reasons (some were fired for legitimate reasons) were white. Those, like me, who were not fired had to "live" with a very hostile environment. One of my friends, a beautiful (inside & out) woman of color, advised me (when I started) to be "invisible - get in, do your work, get out" - hard to do that when I don't have a dark tan.

cons: it is a good old boy network.  A good place to get along but not get ahead.

review_title: great at first, in time noticed the company cares for no one!
job_title: Driver in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Pay is ok. Made some great freinds.
cons: Promote from within family, and freinds. Hours, Pay rate for shuttle driving.

review_title: You will be treated like crap and paid like it too.
pros: It's better than being homeless.  You get to be outside and get a decent workout from carrying boxes and getting in and out of your truck all day.
cons: Terrible pay, long hours, horrible supervisors.  An environment where safety and honesty are punished.  No benefits or opportunity for advancement whatsoever.

pros: Great benefits, salary, management and company. I don't have anything to complain about.
cons: If you have a hard time being on time this job is not right for you. A key part of the job at FedEx is punctuality and responsiblity. Not necessarily a con but something to think about if you have a hard time getting up in the morning or being on time.

pros: Good pay, good benefits and good people to work with.
cons: Long work days, managment not engaged with employees needs.   Leadership team members are treated as second class citizens.  Managment did not have a good grasp on daily operations.

review_title: Good starter job to get on the customs brokerage ladder.
pros: Brilliant team, and co workers.  Good starting place for and introduction to customs brokerage.  Good benefits grouped in with FedEx Express.
cons: Bureaucracy.  Short term vision.  Little or no potential for advancement.  Old fashioned way of thinking.  Will not implement foxes to long standing bugs in the job.

review_title: Great culture, but it is changing
pros: Respect for employees, internal grievance process, good benefits, promote from within, financially sound, top executives, great chairman
cons: Pressure from Wall Street is reflecting on People Service Profit culture. Bad apples are hard to let go. HR processes can be convoluted. Career progression has been limited. Top professionals are leaving quickly. Memphis is not the most appealing city

pros: Great Benefits. The thing I like most is the flexibility I have in my schedule. It allows for good work life balance.
cons: Slow advancement. You always hear that FedEx is a great company that where you can move up. However, it's only great for certain people. You can waste plenty of career time here waiting for a deserved promotion.

pros: If you are not the type of person who wants to get a four year degree then start from the bottom, but rather, join the workforce at a reasonable wage, Fedex is a great place to work with great job security
cons: It is a physical job and you are outside 90% of the time so weather conditions must be considered before accepting a position

job_title: Business Applications Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Comfort, slow pace, can work from home, happy hours with team, life work balance can be achieved if you decide to stay low.
cons: Slow pace, too slow. Need new gen in the company, too much meetings, officers are not open to ics. Benefits are going down.

job_title: Senior Sales Executive in Robinson, PA
pros:
-Good salary.
-401k, pension
-President's Club
-Ability to move up (if you move)
cons:
-Bonuses compared to other sales jobs are small.
-Some managers micro manage but depends on who you have
-Upper management gives you "sales pitch" and you feel like you are being sold

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Louisville, KY
pros: Good pay, great benefits - at least medically, etc -no layoffs ever, good people, managers who are open to discussion, uniforms are provided.
cons: Laziness seems to be acceptible, employee-suggested changes not implemented, minimal hours, they seem to forget that employees come first-not the customer.

pros: A lot of great people work at FedEx.
cons:
It's good to see existing employees promoted to management positions. However, almost all of these long tenured employees lack actual business skills to be effective and often make poor decisions. 

The hiring practices are absurd at this company. A lot of jobs aren't posted and employee's are automatically move into roles. JCA process doesn't work, and its sad to see "HR" turning a blind eye to blatant hiring practices.

pros: People are pretty cool, management on night shift was also pretty cool.
cons: Even though i only worked part time, the workload can be pretty tough and get you pretty sorr

pros: You get a regular paycheck but that is pretty much it. Sometimes they give a freebie like a shirt or a mug.
cons: The job is already stressful.  A trace agent speaks to upset/irate customers all day long, 8-hours a day. It is a division of customer service - but is not customer service.  So you don't even get the nice friendly calls to inquire about services or rates.  You only get the upset customers from calls that have been escalated.  (And the calls are back-to-back ... And you better be on "available" or you have to write an explanation as to why you are not taking calls.) You understand that is part of the job - it is what it is.  However, most of the co-workers are very unprofessional with a fierce, petty, ghetto attitude. Many of them have grown up together and go to the same church and/or live close to each other.  So it is very cliquey. If the non-stop irate calls and the co-workers are not stressful enough, you get no support from the managers.  In fact, they might say they have an open door policy - but that does not mean they are actually willing to listen to any of your concerns or helpful suggestions ... Lest you have a complaint.  They will only preach to you the corporate policies to make you get "on-board" with the program.  Once I had a problem with a manager that kept bullying me.  I mean a manager that treated me like a kindergartner and told me to do things because "she said so".  When I approached the Sr. Mgr. with my concerns, the response was "Let's use this as a coaching opportunity for you".  In other words, the complaint will get nowhere.  So I better shut up and take it.  I realize now the mentality of a large corporation and how management is only there to back each other up.  It's such a shame as I was a hard-working employee that tried to do my best to keep up with the high call volume and consistently be empathetic and helpful to the customers that were in an awful predicament without the delivery of their package.  Other departments at FedEx might be great.  But this particular department has only gone downhill.  It is a nasty cut-throat abusive environment. They expect Trace Reps to be the customer's advocate.  But the management is not there to be the Trace Agent's advocate.  The job is terrible and is always in a "crisis" mode with your taking a beating for FedEx on almost every call.  Yes, that is understood that is what you signed up for.  But the job could be so much more tolerable with sympathetic and supportive managers and less Corporate politics and the ever growing rules that add more burden than assistance to the job/employee itself.  The whole department is a pressure cooker waiting to explode. I would not wish this job on my friends ... buy maybe my worst enemies - Yes.

pros: They really got to know you and allowed me to move around to different jobs when I wanted to.
cons: It is very fast paced so if you cannot handle continuously working for 5+ hours then it probably isnt for you. First two weeks were the worst but after that you get used to it.

job_title: IT Contractor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Work is interesting and great co-workers. Employees treated contractor as another fellow employee, Great group to work with. Very helpful and thoughtful.
cons: A little too much politics in the management levels. Make it difficult for a contractor to do his/her  work. Sometimes it was awkward and caused project to be delay unnecessarily.

review_title: FedEx Great Company to work for
pros: I love there culture I so regret leaving. Management was always great and there benefits where above any company i have worked for.
cons: If your looking for full time hours with part-time position this might not be the job for you. This position is for a secondary job or part-time job. Some employees want full-time hours since its there only job

review_title: Run Away! A pittance for the stress and giving away any semblance of a personal life.
pros:
Health benefits 
401k
Vacation time
Holiday pay – you work all holidays excluding Christmas and New Year's Day
cons:
Pay – Call center wages and is not anywhere near being a call center. 
Call Center – NO. Pay is at call center wages but this is no call center. 
Overtime – Mandatory excessive and extreme overtime.  
Advancement – NO. This is only a job, not a career. There is no opportunity advance. 
Vindictive Workplace – Agents cannot speak up or take time off for fear of retaliation.
Favoritism – Agents are required to "assist" others to get the work done, not their own work, but someone else’s work. 
Turnover – The turnover is high due to low pay and a high-stress work environment.
Systems – The systems are antiquated.

pros: Fred Smith's vision was and is still outstanding.  Unfortunately, it's mostly only his vision now.
cons: FedEx doesn't follow their own code of business ethics policies and procedures, they are not worth the paper or digital media they are printed on, the words are there for the sake of the shareholders and to help prevent lawsuits!   Sales Managers are given free reign to say and do whatever they want about an employee and fire them on the spot without providing any details or opportunity to defend themselves.  At Will employment does not mean that FedEx Managers can break the law and they are.  Harassment, Hostile work environments, intimidation, disparagement and bullying is rampant and even when you report it Nothing is done....Oh wait something is done-the Manager keeps their job and the employee gets fired.  Discrimination violations are rampant and nobody tells anyone for fear of retaliation and HR is a joke(everyone knows FedEx HR is in place for FedEx Management only and going to HR is career suicide).  Unbelievable-it's still the good ol' boys network!

review_title: Pushed far beyond bodily limits.The amount of pushing,pulling,climbing that we do is not worth the effort or the pay.
pros: Job stability, benefits, paid time off (vacation, floating holidays. Personal days), ability to advance, lots of opportunity, overtime whenever
cons: Low pay because of short hours, management, physically exhausting, overworked and underpaid

pros: Overall it was a great place to work. The management was great. For an internship, the assignments were challenging. People are real friendly and easy to meet. In particular the managers in different departments. Once you get your foot in the door there are a lot of opportunities in many different areas of the company. There is job security.
cons: Corporate environment that was a little to process oriented.

review_title: An amazing company and premiere transportation company working to evolve

Great reputation and amazing service
Flexibility and supportive management
Opportunities to learn and grow within the company

pros: new to the field. The job will allow me to use my strong communication and computer skills with the company.

room to move up in company

pros: Good pay and benefits, job security if you can make the numbers.  Lots of good hard working people here

pros: I  got the opportunity to work an scanner and just to know it was my responsibility to make sure the clients got their gifts.

review_title: 25 years and would stay another 25 years!

cons: no matter how hard you work it is not good enough. I is always your fault not the managements,even if they made a bad call the hourly worker in the end is to blame

review_title: A great company to work for. Great benefits and very good personnel policies
pros: People friendly, great team spirit, Good benefits. Management is serious about keeping employee morale up. One of the best companies to work for.
cons: Medical benefits are getting less attractive. Reflects a general trend though. Memphis has limited options and aside from FedEx there are not many great employers in this town.

pros: The best position within the company as far as hourly. The pay is reasonable, very less stressful from being a courier.
cons: No hours and losing freight to Fedex freight and ground. I'm part-time and barely getting hours because full-timers have to get their hours first. Not worth it if its your only job.

review_title: My expirience at FedEx was a good one, I learned the value of hard work.
pros: Flexible schedule. Weekends off. Payed every Friday.
cons: Hard work with no help. The harder you work the more they will take advantage off you. Takes a long time to move up.

review_title: Worked for a great manager in a busy hub, a good part-time job for someone looking for a little extra spending money.
pros: Great manager, decent training.
cons: Incredibly fast-paced work environment, sometimes overwhelming. Very low pay, only good as supplemental income.

pros: Employee importance takes the top position when talking about FedEx. Team work is the key here. Recently started adopting new technologies on board. Teams are more like families.
cons: Still some old technologies are being used. Advancement of personal career is not fast.

job_title: Air Craft Material Handler in Irving, TX
pros: Pros: Very easy job considering it is manual labor. FedEx does a great job of staying up to speed on technologies that help improve employee efficiency
cons: Taking off work is a hassle, no cohesion between management, Very few cons, but it is an overall decent place to work

review_title: It's a great company to work for.
pros: Always busy which I like. Promote inside the company. Night shift isn't as bad as everyone makes it seem.
cons: When it gets backed up the 12 hour days come in. Weather weather and weather again.

pros: Great Time off, transparency for the most part. Well respected company. Room for growth.
cons: If you are a great worker additional tasks (mostly managerial tasks that they don't want or cannot handle) will be thrown in your lap.

pros:
This job is perfect for those who 
-like to go in with where nothing changes on a daily basis
-want decent benefits
-get not so great pay
-want to live in "The Office", "Office Space" or any other office-spoof comedy
cons:
-The "raises" 
-The review scores 
-The month before management surveys are due
-It is glorified data entry with no chance of change

pros: Give you great hours if wanted. Not on a point system . Give you opportunities to bid on a different job description to work your way up with the company. Offer car insurance .
cons: No 401k plan an less your management . Work becomes very physical becomes hard on your body.

pros: stable company, extremely strong brand
cons: management is way too political sometimes. saw more than qualified reps get passed over for promotion for someone whose parent worked at the company.

pros: Benefits are awesome and enjoy working at Fedex been there for iver 10 years always communicate with your manager and lead people. I work part time
cons: Working out in mother nature rain snow ice heat is a part of fedex that you will have to get use to a lot of people can not with the environment

pros: Great health care, paid time off, 401k and pension.
cons: I was told for years to work hard and you will get promoted, just to find out this is a company that hand picks who they promote based on who can save them a dollar.

pros: Good benefits. Semi decent pay.
cons: Too little interaction with other departments, confusion for new hires, horrible training, lots of ego  for people unqualified for their titles,  unfriendly and  good ole boy mentality.  More like an adult high school

review_title: FedEx is a Positive environment to work in and a CHANGE company that manages through the tough times effectively!
pros: FedEx is a CHANGE company and manages through the tough times effectively!
cons: the constant chnages can make it difficult for employees to stay focused

pros: Work is not hard and there aren't a lot of deadlines. Flex time is standard and there isn't a clock to punch.
cons: The industry is aging & shrinking and the company will have to shrink with the industry. There are silos in work areas that contributes to duplication of work efforts.

review_title: It is a good place to work if you are in school or to have as a second job.
pros: If you want, you can learn a lot and move up in the company. Everyone starts at the bottom, so they can relate to at all levels.
cons: Everything is on you. You get what you put in to it.

review_title: It is a good place to work if you are in school or to have as a second job.
pros: If you want, you can learn a lot and move up in the company. Everyone starts at the bottom, so they can relate to at all levels.
cons: Everything is on you. You get what you put in to it.

review_title: It was a challenging but great place of employment.
pros: The team was great. Everyone helped one another. There were always opportunities for advancement. The environment was extremely fast paced leaving very little moments of down time.
cons: When the conveyor belt malfunctioned, the overall workflow came to a sudden stop. There were times when it shut down for hours.

review_title: Wonderfull job if the investors weren't trying to soak every dime from the company and take it away from the employees
job_title: Senior Global Vehicle Tech in Phoenix, AZ
pros: The benefits are still good for the employees. Every year they cover less and cost more.
cons: Upper management not being realistic about work loads for hourly employee

review_title: Good company, but very few options to move up.
pros: Fast paced work environment, with a fun friendly atmosphere.
cons: With in last year or so with good management and hardworking employees our building increased its productivity by at least 50 percent and we have not been given a raise or acknowledged by region for what we have accomplished.

job_title: Customs Team Lead in Clarence, NY
pros: Great benefits and training program.  Good vacation time.
cons: Limited room for advancement.  Pay is OK, but doesn't equal the amount of knowledge you must have, workload everyday, and due to the job (Making sure international shipments have all required documents and related forms to clear Customs, the job is very important for the USA

job_title: Package Handler in Bedford Park, IL
pros: Easy, laid back, just some days their are some trailers full of heavy items then it get hard like that time goes by fast
cons: Some of the supervisors their like to just stare at you for long periods of time while you are working it's like they think you going to steal something it gets very annoying

pros: fast pace ,pleasing customers delivering and picking up packages  pay rate is good
cons: employees don't work as a team

pros: The incentives awesome people very friendly
cons: Really none every employer have rules that must be kept and follwed

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Lakeland, FL
pros: Great Benefits, Cheapest I've ever had, paid time off, they offer something called LWOP (Leave without pay) and it does not count against you. Very flexible with allowing employees to switch schedules, for any reasons.
cons: Very low pay for the amount of work, long hours during peak season, raises are not good. No career opportunities in the area,

job_title: Programmer Analyst Advisor in Collierville, TN

pros: Standard company benefits - although they are particularly good for exec management.  .
cons: Hierarchical structure.  Not really agile.

pros: Hours are nice and so are some of the co-workers as well as the company you are contracted through. Easy to overtime if you want

pros: Good work life balance, salary, health and retirement benefits. Also, wage increases are provided each year based on performance.
cons: Lack of retiree health benefits so will need to work until at least 65 to be eligible for Medicare.  Also, training is poor at times.

review_title: People are nice, but not innovative
pros: FedEx truly loves its people.  The company focuses on making almost any accommodations for there people which is why the average years of service is about 15.
cons: FedEx is not an innovative company.  Being based in Memphis  narrows the focus of the world and thus, from an IT perspective, trails competitors.

job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Belleville, MI
pros: All of the people that I work with are very friendly and are a pleasure to work with. I also like that it a a fun job to have
cons: It can be a very stressful job at times, but the cool thing is that you have a lot of people that are able to help you

review_title: Good for a part time job

Kind of throws you into the job with little time to fully grasp but also help learn it fast

cons: They want degrees in anything and everything. So unless you want to stay in entry level, be prepaired to go for masters or higher for jobs that don't necessarily need it.

pros: Work\life balance, benefits are good.
cons: Some mid-level employees are not as competent as they need to be and should have been let go during the recent lay-offs.

review_title: Is great working at FedEx Services, but  could do better with salary at the mid level career.

cons: Entry level and mid career level salaries are behind the industry level for IT professionals.

pros: Treated well, very fast-paced, good managers, good training program, good experience with a top company, not long hours, so it's easy to find a second job
cons: Extremely difficult work and hot, injuries fairly common in the workplace (we were given a party for a month without an injury), worn out by the end of the day

pros: The benefits were very competitive. The work load was constant, so the oppurtunity to get hours was always there.
cons: The pay doesn't match the work. Workers there have a very demanding job physically, and the pay that the get is on the lower part of the pay scale.

pros: it was alright, it could have been better, good perks but needed more pay.  It might eb doing alright now though.  They had fun events every now and then

job_title: Organizational Development Advisor in Memphis, TN
pros: Fedex has really invested  a lot of their resources (i.e., time; money & energy) towards creating a postive "employee centerd" work environment  & culture that puts their people first & actvely invests in programs that supports employee growth &  development.
cons: The company has a lot of politics...

review_title: A big ship that's very slow to turn

cons: Outdated technology, takes forever to get anything updated. Silos are getting worse, not better, limiting advancement; especially if you're not in Memphis.

cons: You buy your own benefits. Although the income seems good, the expense of insurances can add up quickly
